title = Izo 
overview = Izo is an assassin in the service of a Tosa lord and Imperial supporter. After killing dozens of the Shogun's men, Izo is captured and crucified. Instead of being extinguished, his rage propels him through the space-time continuum to present-day Tokyo. Here Izo transforms himself into a new, improved killing machine. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Director = Takashi Miike 

In the movie "Izo," we follow the journey of Izo, an assassin working for a Tosa lord and Imperial supporter. Known for his deadly skills, Izo finds himself captured and crucified after eliminating many of the Shogun's men. However, instead of meeting his end, Izo's intense anger and determination propel him through the space-time continuum, landing him in modern-day Tokyo. Here, fueled by his rage, Izo undergoes a transformation, evolving into a more advanced and efficient killing machine. As he navigates this new world, Izo's quest for vengeance and redemption takes on a whole new dimension, blending the past and present in a thrilling and action-packed narrative.

Facts included:
1. Izo is an assassin in the service of a Tosa lord and Imperial supporter.
2. After killing dozens of the Shogun's men, Izo is captured and crucified.
3. His rage propels him through the space-time continuum to present-day Tokyo.
4. In modern-day Tokyo, Izo transforms himself into a new, improved killing machine.

title = Hard Target 
overview = When a woman's father goes missing, she enlist a local to aid in her search.  The pair soon discover that her father has died at the hands of a wealthy sportsman who hunts homeless men as a form of recreation. 
cast = Jean-Claude Van Damme, Arnold Vosloo, Lance Henriksen, Yancy Butler 
date of release = the 20 of August 1993 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
average note = 6.1 
budget = 18.0 millions of dollars 
Director = John Woo 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 74.2 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Don't hunt what you can't kill. 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
Producer = Sean Daniel 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Jean-Claude Van Damme, Arnold Vosloo, Lance Henriksen, Yancy Butler 

In the action-packed film "Hard Target," released on the 20th of August 1993 by Universal Pictures, a woman teams up with a local to search for her missing father. Together, they uncover a sinister truth - her father was killed by a wealthy sportsman who hunts homeless men for sport. Starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Arnold Vosloo, Lance Henriksen, and Yancy Butler, this John Woo-directed movie takes viewers on a thrilling ride. With an average rating of 6.1, the film had a budget of 18.0 million dollars but went on to earn a whopping 74.2 million dollars at the box office. Set in the United States of America and in English, "Hard Target" delivers on its tagline: "Don't hunt what you can't kill." Produced by Sean Daniel, the movie runs for 1 hour and 37 minutes, promising non-stop action and suspense.

title = Silent Night, Deadly Night 5: The Toy Maker 
overview = A young boy sees his father killed by a toy that was anonymously delivered to his house. After that, he is too traumatized to speak, and his mother must deal with both him and the loss of her husband. Meanwhile, a toy maker named Joe Peto builds some suspicious-looking toys, and a mysterious man creeps around both the toy store and the boy's house...but who is responsible for the killer toys? 
production compagnie = Still Silent Films Inc. 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 64.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 6 of November 1991 
cast = William Thorne, Jane Higginson, Van Quattro, Tracy Fraim 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Richard N. Gladstein 
budget = 120.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Still Silent Films Inc. 

The description is complete with all the necessary facts included. Here is the final description:

In "Silent Night, Deadly Night 5: The Toy Maker," a chilling tale unfolds as a young boy witnesses his father's tragic demise at the hands of a malevolent toy. Stricken with trauma, the boy falls silent, leaving his mother to grapple with both his condition and the loss of her husband. As the unsettling events unfold, renowned toy maker Joe Peto crafts enigmatic toys, while a mysterious figure lurks in the shadows of both the toy store and the boy's home. Amidst the suspense, questions arise: who is behind these lethal playthings? With a stellar cast including William Thorne, Jane Higginson, Van Quattro, and Tracy Fraim, this American production by Still Silent Films Inc. keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Released on November 6, 1991, this 1 hour and 30-minute film, produced by Richard N. Gladstein, garnered a revenue of $64.0 million, despite its $120.1 million budget. "Silent Night, Deadly Night 5: The Toy Maker" delivers a spine-tingling narrative in the original language of English.

In "Silent Night, Deadly Night 5: The Toy Maker," a chilling tale unfolds as a young boy witnesses his father's tragic demise at the hands of a malevolent toy. Stricken with trauma, the boy falls silent, leaving his mother to grapple with both his condition and the loss of her husband. As the unsettling events unfold, renowned toy maker Joe Peto crafts enigmatic toys, while a mysterious figure lurks in the shadows of both the toy store and the boy's home. Amidst the suspense, questions arise: who is behind these lethal playthings? With a stellar cast including William Thorne, Jane Higginson, Van Quattro, and Tracy Fraim, this American production by Still Silent Films Inc. keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Released on November 6, 1991, this 1 hour and 30-minute film, produced by Richard N. Gladstein, garnered a revenue of $64.0 million, despite its $120.1 million budget. "Silent Night, Deadly Night 5: The Toy Maker" delivers a spine-tingling narrative in the original language of English.

['correct']

title = Crescendo 
overview = An innocent project transforms into a perilous nightmare when researcher Susan Roberts arrives in France in search of information on a deceased composer. She contacts his widow whose mental deterioration, precipitated by the death of her husband, manifests itself in psychotic dementia. The young woman's arrival triggers an obsessive desire to marry her crippled son to Susan, ensuring by this union that the genius of the father will be passed on to future generations. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
cast = Stefanie Powers, James Olson, Joss Ackland, Margaretta Scott 
Director = Alan Gibson 
average note = 5.7 
revenue = 94.2 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Michael Carreras 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the chilling thriller "Crescendo," researcher Susan Roberts embarks on a seemingly innocent project in France, only to find herself entangled in a perilous nightmare. Upon contacting the widow of a deceased composer, Susan discovers a web of madness and obsession. As the widow's deteriorating mental state takes a sinister turn, Susan becomes the target of a disturbing plan to ensure the composer's legacy lives on. With a stellar cast including Stefanie Powers, James Olson, Joss Ackland, and Margaretta Scott, and under the direction of Alan Gibson, this British production delves into dark themes of legacy and madness. With an average rating of 5.7, "Crescendo" garnered a staggering revenue of 94.2 million dollars, solidifying its status as a haunting and financially successful film in the English language. Produced by Michael Carreras, this psychological thriller will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

title = Serpico 
overview = The real-life struggle of an honest New York City cop against a corrupt system. 
budget = 3.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Italy 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
tagline = Many of his fellow officers considered him the most dangerous man alive - An honest cop. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Martin Bregman 
duration of the movie = 2h09 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 3.0 millions of dollars 

In the gritty and gripping film "Serpico," viewers are taken on a journey through the real-life struggle of an honest New York City cop as he battles against a corrupt system. Produced with a budget of 3.0 million dollars by Paramount Pictures, this intense drama unfolds in the streets of New York City, showcasing the challenges faced by one man standing up for what is right. With a tagline that reads, "Many of his fellow officers considered him the most dangerous man alive - An honest cop," the movie delves into the complexities of morality and justice. Under the direction of producer Martin Bregman, the film runs for 2 hours and 9 minutes, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats as they witness the courage and integrity of one man in the face of adversity. "Serpico" is a compelling tale of integrity and resilience, set against the backdrop of a corrupt system, and spoken in the original language of English. The production country of the movie is Italy.

In the gritty and gripping film "Serpico," viewers are taken on a journey through the real-life struggle of an honest New York City cop as he battles against a corrupt system. Produced with a budget of 3.0 million dollars by Paramount Pictures, this intense drama unfolds in the streets of New York City, showcasing the challenges faced by one man standing up for what is right. With a tagline that reads, "Many of his fellow officers considered him the most dangerous man alive - An honest cop," the movie delves into the complexities of morality and justice. Under the direction of producer Martin Bregman, the film runs for 2 hours and 9 minutes, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats as they witness the courage and integrity of one man in the face of adversity. "Serpico" is a compelling tale of integrity and resilience, set against the backdrop of a corrupt system, and spoken in the original language of English. The production country of the movie is Italy. 
 
 

 
title = Wrong Is Right 
overview = Political double-talk, dirty tricks, hidden microphones, spy satellites, bugging the Oval Office and a nuclear bomb for sale are all ingredients in this swift, funny and frightening look at the possibilities in today's political arenas. Sean Connery stars as TV Newsman Patrick Hal on an international chase to track two suitcase sized nuclear weapons and to uncover the twisting maze of apparent involvement of US Government agencies. 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 221.8 millions of dollars 
Director = Richard Brooks

fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the thrilling political satire "Wrong Is Right," directed by Richard Brooks, Sean Connery takes on the role of TV Newsman Patrick Hal. The movie delves into the world of political double-talk, dirty tricks, and espionage, as Hal embarks on an international mission to track down two suitcase-sized nuclear weapons. With a budget of 221.8 million dollars, the film is a swift, funny, and frightening look at the dark possibilities within today's political arenas. As hidden microphones, spy satellites, and a nuclear bomb for sale come into play, Hal must navigate a twisting maze of apparent involvement of US Government agencies to uncover the truth. This English-language film is a high-stakes thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end. "Wrong Is Right" stars Sean Connery and is directed by Richard Brooks.

title = Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice 
overview = Fearing the actions of a god-like Super Hero left unchecked, Gotham City’s own formidable, forceful vigilante takes on Metropolis’s most revered, modern-day savior, while the world wrestles with what sort of hero it really needs. And with Batman and Superman at war with one another, a new threat quickly arises, putting mankind in greater danger than it’s ever known before.

In a world where two iconic superheroes clash, "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice" explores the intense battle between Gotham City's dark vigilante and Metropolis's revered savior. Directed by Zack Snyder and produced by DC Comics, this epic showdown unfolds as the world grapples with the need for a true hero. With a budget of 250 million dollars, the United States of America sets the stage for an action-packed spectacle that forces mankind to confront a new and deadly threat. Will justice prevail, or will it all be driven by revenge? Find out in this 2-hour and 31-minute cinematic masterpiece. The tagline for the movie is "Justice or revenge."

title = Baby Needs a New Pair of Shoes 
overview = An epic battle rages lawn on the streets of Harlem between Italian mobsters and black gangsters. The battles are intense, the more each side tries to oust another. Both groups use their best killers. Since it is a brutal gangster transvestites to be careful who kills with his high-heeled shoes ... 
Producer = Howard Ransom 
Director = Bill Brame 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Howard Ransom 

In the gritty streets of Harlem, a fierce and epic battle unfolds between Italian mobsters and black gangsters, each vying to dominate the turf. The tension escalates as both sides unleash their top assassins, leading to intense confrontations and high-stakes showdowns. Amidst the chaos, a unique and deadly killer emerges - a transvestite armed with lethal high-heeled shoes. Directed by Bill Brame and produced by Howard Ransom, "Baby Needs a New Pair of Shoes" is a gripping tale of power, betrayal, and unexpected alliances, all unfolding in the original language of English.

title = Breezy 
overview = Breezy is a teen-aged hippy with a big heart. After taking a a ride with a man who only wants her for sex, Breezy manages to escape. She runs to hide on a secluded property where stands the home of a middle-aged divorced man, Frank Harmon. Frank reluctantly takes Breezy in only to fall unexpectedly in love with her. 
date of release = the 18 of November 1973 
tagline = A free spirit can awaken even the loneliest heart. 
production compagnie = Malpaso Productions 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 130.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 18 of November 1973 

In the heartwarming film "Breezy," released on November 18, 1973, we follow the story of a free-spirited teen hippy named Breezy. After escaping a dangerous encounter, Breezy finds refuge on the secluded property of middle-aged divorced man, Frank Harmon, played by an exceptional cast. Reluctantly taking her in, Frank's life takes an unexpected turn as he falls deeply in love with the young Breezy. As their unconventional relationship blossoms, "Breezy" beautifully portrays how a free spirit can awaken even the loneliest heart. Produced by Malpaso Productions in the United States of America, this heartfelt film grossed an impressive $130.0 million at the box office. The tagline for the movie is "A free spirit can awaken even the loneliest heart."

Set in the United Kingdom, this intense thriller captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of one man's quest for retribution. title = Venetian Bird 
overview = Private eye Edward Mercer (Richard Todd) travels to Venice to locate a man due a reward for his aid in the war. Shortly after arriving, he becomes the prime suspect in the murder of his local contact. In his quest to clear his name, Mercer uncovers a conspiracy. Even the local magistrate (George Coulouris) seems to be working against him, and Mercer begins to suspect the man he came to find is behind it all. 
Director = Ralph Thomas 
tagline = Behind Her Lush Beauty Lurked 
budget = 147.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 8.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Ralph Thomas 

In the thrilling film "Venetian Bird" directed by Ralph Thomas, private eye Edward Mercer, portrayed by Richard Todd, embarks on a journey to Venice to track down a man owed a reward for his wartime assistance. However, his mission takes a dark turn when he is accused of murdering his local contact shortly after his arrival. As Mercer delves deeper into the mystery to prove his innocence, he stumbles upon a complex conspiracy that implicates even the local magistrate, played by George Coulouris. With suspicions mounting, Mercer begins to question if the very man he was seeking is the mastermind behind it all. Amidst the lush beauty of Venice, secrets unravel and danger lurks at every corner in this gripping tale where appearances can be deceiving. With an average note of 8.0, "Venetian Bird" is a must-watch cinematic experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Behind Her Lush Beauty Lurked a thrilling narrative that unfolds against the backdrop of Venice's enchanting scenery. The movie was produced with a budget of 147.3 million dollars and is presented in its original language, English. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Behind Her Lush Beauty Lurked 

In the thrilling film "Venetian Bird" directed by Ralph Thomas, private eye Edward Mercer, portrayed by Richard Todd, embarks on a journey to Venice to track down a man owed a reward for his wartime assistance. However, his mission takes a dark turn when he is accused of murdering his local contact shortly after his arrival. As Mercer delves deeper into the mystery to prove his innocence, he stumbles upon a complex conspiracy that implicates even the local magistrate, played by George Coulouris. With suspicions mounting, Mercer begins to question if the very man he was seeking is the mastermind behind it all. Amidst the lush beauty of Venice, secrets unravel and danger lurks at every corner in this gripping tale where appearances can be deceiving. With an average note of 8.0, "Venetian Bird" is a must-watch cinematic experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Behind Her Lush Beauty Lurked a thrilling narrative that unfolds against the backdrop of Venice's enchanting scenery. The movie was produced with a budget of 147.3 million dollars and is presented in its original language, English.

title = Home for the Holidays 
overview = An ailing man summons his four daughters home for Christmas and asks them to kill his new wife, who he suspects is poisoning him. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = John Llewellyn Moxey 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Home for the Holidays," directed by John Llewellyn Moxey, a gripping tale unfolds as an ailing man makes a shocking request of his four daughters during the Christmas season. Summoned back to their childhood home, the daughters are faced with a chilling ultimatum: their father believes his new wife is poisoning him and tasks them with ending her life. As family secrets unravel and tensions run high, the daughters must navigate a complex web of loyalty, betrayal, and the dark truth lurking within their own home. Will they carry out their father's wishes, or will they uncover a deeper, more sinister plot at play? The movie's title is "Home for the Holidays," and the original language of the movie is English. John Llewellyn Moxey is the director of this suspenseful and dramatic film.

title = Willow Creek 
overview = A young couple ventures into the woods to capture footage of the elusive Bigfoot. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Bobcat Goldthwait 
tagline = Existing Soon. 
cast = Alexie Gilmore, Bryce Johnson, Peter Jason 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the heart of the United States of America, "Willow Creek" follows a daring young couple as they embark on a thrilling journey into the mysterious woods in search of the legendary Bigfoot. Directed by the talented Bobcat Goldthwait, this suspenseful film stars Alexie Gilmore, Bryce Johnson, and Peter Jason. As they document their adventure, the couple soon realizes they may have bitten off more than they can chew as they encounter the unknown. With the tagline "Existing Soon," this gripping tale will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

title = The Glenn Miller Story 
overview = A vibrant tribute to one of America's legendary bandleaders, charting Glenn Miller's rise from obscurity and poverty to fame and wealth in the early 1940s. 
Producer = Aaron Rosenberg 
revenue = 270.3 millions of dollars 
budget = 11.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h55 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
cast = James Stewart, June Allyson, Harry Morgan, Charles Drake 
date of release = the 8 of January 1954 
Director = Anthony Mann 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.6 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Aaron Rosenberg 

The Glenn Miller Story is a vibrant tribute to one of America's legendary bandleaders, Glenn Miller, charting his rise from obscurity and poverty to fame and wealth in the early 1940s. Directed by Anthony Mann and produced by Aaron Rosenberg, this film features a star-studded cast including James Stewart, June Allyson, Harry Morgan, and Charles Drake. With a production budget of 11.3 million dollars, the movie generated an impressive revenue of 270.3 million dollars at the box office. Set in the United States of America, the film was released on the 8th of January 1954 by Universal Pictures. It has a duration of 1 hour and 55 minutes and is presented in English. The average rating for the movie is 6.6, making it a compelling watch for both music enthusiasts and history buffs. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 270.3 millions of dollars 

The Glenn Miller Story is a vibrant tribute to one of America's legendary bandleaders, Glenn Miller, charting his rise from obscurity and poverty to fame and wealth in the early 1940s. Directed by Anthony Mann and produced by Aaron Rosenberg, this film features a star-studded cast including James Stewart, June Allyson, Harry Morgan, and Charles Drake. With a production budget of 11.3 million dollars, the movie generated an impressive revenue of 270.3 million dollars at the box office. Set in the United States of America, the film was released on the 8th of January 1954 by Universal Pictures. It has a duration of 1 hour and 55 minutes and is presented in English. The average rating for the movie is 6.6, making it a compelling watch for both music enthusiasts and history buffs.

title = Icebreaker 
overview = At the the Killington ski resort something has gone awry. Evil terrorists led by the sinister Greig have taken the resort hostage with a stolen nuclear device. It's up to Ski Patrol bum Matt Foster to save the day... and his fiancé. 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 1 of January 2000 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = David Giancola 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the action-packed movie "Icebreaker," set in the Killington ski resort, chaos ensues as evil terrorists, under the leadership of the sinister Greig, seize control of the premises using a stolen nuclear device. The fate of the resort, along with the lives of the hostages, hangs in the balance. Enter Matt Foster, a laid-back Ski Patrol member who must rise to the occasion to not only save the day but also rescue his fiancée from the clutches of danger. Directed by David Giancola, this thrilling film takes viewers on a high-stakes journey filled with suspense and adrenaline. Released on the 1st of January 2000 in the United States of America, "Icebreaker" unfolds in English, delivering a gripping narrative that will keep audiences on the edge of their seats.

title = iBoy 
overview = After an accident, Tom wakes from a coma to discover that fragments of his smart phone have been embedded in his head, and worse, that returning to normal teenage life is impossible because he has developed a strange set of super powers. 
Producer = Gail Mutrux 
revenue = 36.6 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 27 of January 2017 
production compagnie = NetFlix 
cast = Bill Milner, Maisie Williams, Rory Kinnear, Miranda Richardson 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Gail Mutrux 

In the thrilling movie "iBoy", produced by Gail Mutrux and released by Netflix on the 27th of January 2017, we follow the story of Tom who, after a life-altering accident, awakens from a coma to find that pieces of his smartphone are now fused into his head. As if that wasn't enough, he soon realizes that he has gained extraordinary superpowers, making a return to his normal teenage life impossible. Starring Bill Milner, Maisie Williams, Rory Kinnear, and Miranda Richardson, this action-packed film set in the United Kingdom grossed an impressive $36.6 million at the box office.

title = The Parade 
overview = The Parade, in a tragicomic way, tells the story about ongoing battle between two worlds in contemporary post-war Serbian society - the traditional, oppressive, homophobic majority and a liberal, modern and open-minded minority... The film, which deals with gay rights issues in Serbia, features footage of the 2010 Belgrade gay pride parade. The film introduces a group of gay activists, trying to organize a pride parade in Belgrade 
duration of the movie = 1h55 
Director = Srđan Dragojević 
cast = Nikola Kojo, Hristina Popović, Miloš Samolov, Goran Jevtić 
revenue = 5.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 31 of October 2011 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h55 

In "The Parade," directed by Srđan Dragojević, a poignant and humorous tale unfolds, shedding light on the ongoing clash between two contrasting worlds in post-war Serbian society. The movie delves into the struggles faced by a liberal and modern minority against the backdrop of the traditional and oppressive majority, particularly in relation to gay rights issues in Serbia. As the narrative unfolds, viewers are introduced to a group of courageous gay activists who are determined to organize a pride parade in Belgrade, with real footage from the 2010 Belgrade gay pride parade incorporated into the film. Starring Nikola Kojo, Hristina Popović, Miloš Samolov, and Goran Jevtić, this thought-provoking film runs for 1 hour and 55 minutes and was released on the 31st of October 2011, grossing an impressive $5.8 million at the box office. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Srđan Dragojević

The movie delves into the struggles faced by a liberal and modern minority against the backdrop of the traditional and oppressive majority, particularly in relation to gay rights issues in Serbia. The movie delves into the struggles faced by a liberal and modern minority against the backdrop of the traditional and oppressive majority, particularly in relation to gay rights issues in Serbia. As the narrative unfolds, viewers are introduced to a group of courageous gay activists who are determined to organize a pride parade in Belgrade, with real footage from the 2010 Belgrade gay pride parade incorporated into the film. Starring Nikola Kojo, Hristina Popović, Miloš Samolov, and Goran Jevtić, this thought-provoking film runs for 1 hour and 55 minutes and was released on the 31st of October 2011, grossing an impressive $5.8 million at the box office.

['wrong']

title = Godzilla Against MechaGodzilla 
overview = After the appearance of a new Gojira (Godzilla), the Japanese government builds a robotic Godzilla from the bones of the original monster that attacked Tokyo in 1954 to stop the beast. 
Producer = Shogo Tomiyama 
production countrie = Japan 
revenue = 147.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
Director = Masaaki Tezuka 
average note = 6.8 
date of release = the 2 of November 2002 
tagline = Fight to a crumbling fall! 
budget = 8.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Japanese 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Shogo Tomiyama 

In "Godzilla Against MechaGodzilla," directed by Masaaki Tezuka and produced by Shogo Tomiyama, Japan faces a new threat with the appearance of a monstrous Gojira. In a desperate attempt to protect their country, the Japanese government constructs a robotic Godzilla using the bones of the original monster that ravaged Tokyo in 1954. As the battle between man-made machine and ancient beast unfolds, audiences are taken on a thrilling ride filled with epic showdowns and heart-pounding action. With a budget of 8.5 million dollars, the film grossed an impressive 147.1 million dollars at the box office upon its release on the 2nd of November 2002. The tagline "Fight to a crumbling fall!" sets the tone for this Japanese-language film that captivated viewers with an average rating of 6.8. At a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes, "Godzilla Against MechaGodzilla" delivers a gripping narrative that showcases the resilience and determination of humanity in the face of unimaginable destruction. The production country of the movie is Japan, and the original language of the movie is Japanese.

title = The Good Mother 
overview = After finding a sexually liberated boyfriend, a divorced woman gets sued over daughter's custody, by her ex, who claims that her lover has a bad influence on the kid. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

title = The Good Mother 
overview = After finding a sexually liberated boyfriend, a divorced woman gets sued over daughter's custody, by her ex, who claims that her lover has a bad influence on the kid. 

In "The Good Mother," a divorced woman finds herself in a legal battle over her daughter's custody when her ex-husband sues her, claiming that her sexually liberated boyfriend is a negative influence on the child. As she navigates the complexities of the court case and her personal life, she must confront the challenges of balancing her own happiness with the well-being of her daughter.

title = Once Upon a Time in Mexico 
overview = Hitman "El Mariachi" becomes involved in international espionage involving a psychotic CIA agent and a corrupt Mexican general. 
average note = 6.2 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
budget = 29.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h42 
Director = Robert Rodriguez 
date of release = the 11 of September 2003 
cast = Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Johnny Depp, Eva Mendes 
revenue = 98.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.2 

In "Once Upon a Time in Mexico," directed by Robert Rodriguez and released on September 11, 2003, hitman "El Mariachi," portrayed by Antonio Banderas, finds himself entangled in a web of international espionage. The plot thickens as he crosses paths with a psychotic CIA agent, played by Johnny Depp, and a corrupt Mexican general. With a budget of 29.0 million dollars, this action-packed film, produced by Columbia Pictures Corporation, captivated audiences for 1 hour and 42 minutes. Alongside Banderas and Depp, the star-studded cast includes Salma Hayek and Eva Mendes. Despite receiving an average rating of 6.2, "Once Upon a Time in Mexico" raked in an impressive revenue of 98.2 million dollars.

In "Once Upon a Time in Mexico," directed by Robert Rodriguez and released on September 11, 2003, hitman "El Mariachi," portrayed by Antonio Banderas, finds himself entangled in a web of international espionage. The plot thickens as he crosses paths with a psychotic CIA agent, played by Johnny Depp, and a corrupt Mexican general. With a budget of 29.0 million dollars, this action-packed film, produced by Columbia Pictures Corporation, captivated audiences for 1 hour and 42 minutes. Alongside Banderas and Depp, the star-studded cast includes Salma Hayek and Eva Mendes. Despite receiving an average rating of 6.2, "Once Upon a Time in Mexico" raked in an impressive revenue of 98.2 million dollars.

title = Marlowe 
overview = Los Angeles private-eye Philip Marlowe is trying to locate the brother of his new client, a woman named Orfamay Quest. The trail leads to two men who deny any knowledge of the brother's existence. Both are soon killed by an ice pick, so Marlowe deduces that there's much more to this than a simple missing-person case. Marlowe's path crosses that of a blackmailed movie star, Mavis Wald, and her friend, exotic dancer Delores. A mobster sends karate expert Winslow Wong to bust up Marlowe's office and warn him off the case, while Lieutenant French also cautions the detective to stay out of the police's way. 
revenue = 55.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Paul Bogart 
date of release = the 19 of September 1969 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
tagline = Marlowe is the Best Private Eye in the Business. Just Ask the People He Does Business With 
budget = 167.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 55.3 millions of dollars 

In the 1969 film "Marlowe," directed by Paul Bogart, Los Angeles private-eye Philip Marlowe takes on a case to find the missing brother of his client, Orfamay Quest. As Marlowe delves deeper into the investigation, he uncovers a web of deceit and murder, leading him to a blackmailed movie star, Mavis Wald, and her exotic dancer friend, Delores. With the mobster's enforcer, Winslow Wong, hot on his trail and the police warning him to stay out of their way, Marlowe must navigate a dangerous underworld to solve the case. With a tagline proclaiming Marlowe as the best private eye in the business, this thrilling mystery unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 35 minutes, captivating audiences with its twists and turns. Despite a budget of 167.9 million dollars, the film managed to gross 55.3 million dollars at the box office, proving its enduring appeal to fans of classic detective stories.

title = The Godfather: Part II 
overview = In the continuing saga of the Corleone crime family, a young Vito Corleone grows up in Sicily and in 1910s New York. In the 1950s, Michael Corleone attempts to expand the family business into Las Vegas, Hollywood and Cuba. 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

In the critically acclaimed film "The Godfather: Part II" by Paramount Pictures, audiences are taken on a journey through the multi-generational saga of the Corleone crime family. The movie delves into the origins of the family empire, following a young Vito Corleone as he rises to power in Sicily and later in 1910s New York. Meanwhile, in the 1950s, Vito's son Michael Corleone seeks to further expand the family's influence, venturing into new territories such as Las Vegas, Hollywood, and Cuba. As the intricate web of power, loyalty, and betrayal unfolds, "The Godfather: Part II" masterfully weaves together past and present, showcasing the complexities of family dynamics and the consequences of choices made in the pursuit of power. 

The production company behind this iconic film is Paramount Pictures.

title = Coming to America 
overview = Prince Akeem, heir to the throne of Zamunda, leaves the tropical paradise kingdom in search of his queen. What better place than Queens, New York to find his bride? Joined by his loyal servant and friend, Semmi, Akeem attempts to blend in as an ordinary American and begin his search. 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
revenue = 288.8 millions of dollars 
Producer = George Folsey Jr. 
date of release = the 28 of June 1988 
tagline = The Four Funniest Men in America are Eddie Murphy. 
Director = John Landis 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

In the 1988 comedy film "Coming to America," Prince Akeem of Zamunda, accompanied by his loyal servant Semmi, travels to Queens, New York in search of his future queen. Determined to find true love, Akeem disguises himself as an ordinary American to navigate the dating scene. Directed by John Landis and produced by George Folsey Jr., this hilarious movie, known for its tagline "The Four Funniest Men in America are Eddie Murphy," was released on June 28, 1988, by Paramount Pictures. With a box office revenue of 288.8 million dollars, "Coming to America" is a classic comedy that follows the prince's journey to find love in the bustling city of New York.

Determined to find true love, Akeem disguises himself as an ordinary American to navigate the dating scene. Directed by John Landis and produced by George Folsey Jr., this hilarious movie, known for its tagline "The Four Funniest Men in America are Eddie Murphy," was released on June 28, 1988, by Paramount Pictures. With a box office revenue of 288.8 million dollars, "Coming to America" is a classic comedy that follows the prince's journey to find love in the bustling city of New York.

title = Free Fire 
overview = A crime drama set in 1970s Boston, about a gun sale which goes wrong. 
revenue = 3.6 millions of dollars 
budget = 10.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Sharlto Copley, Armie Hammer, Brie Larson, Cillian Murphy 
Director = Ben Wheatley 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 3.6 millions of dollars 

In the gritty crime drama "Free Fire," set in 1970s Boston, a high-stakes gun sale takes a dangerous turn, leading to a chaotic and intense shootout. Directed by Ben Wheatley, the film features an ensemble cast including Sharlto Copley, Armie Hammer, Brie Larson, and Cillian Murphy. Despite its gripping storyline and stellar performances, "Free Fire" struggled to recoup its budget, earning only 3.6 million dollars at the box office. The movie had a budget of 10.0 million dollars.

title = Before I Fall 
overview = Samantha Kingston has everything. Then, everything changes. After one fateful night, she wakes up with no future at all. Trapped into reliving the same day over and over, she begins to question just how perfect her life really was. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : tagline = What if today was the only day of the rest of your life? 

In "Before I Fall," Samantha Kingston seemingly has it all - until one night changes everything. Waking up to find herself stuck in a time loop, she must relive the same day repeatedly. As she navigates through this endless cycle, Samantha starts to unravel the true nature of her supposedly perfect life. Will she be able to break free from this haunting repetition and discover the reality behind her seemingly flawless existence? Samantha's journey forces her to confront the impact of her actions on those around her, leading her to question her past behavior and the relationships she holds dear. Through this introspection, she learns valuable lessons about empathy, friendship, and the importance of living each day to its fullest.

['wrong']

Samantha's journey forces her to confront the impact of her actions on those around her, leading her to question her past behavior and the relationships she holds dear. overview = David Lord finds himself forced into the savage world of a modern gladiatorial arena, where men fight to the death for the entertainment of the online masses. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the intense action-packed film "Arena," David Lord is unexpectedly thrust into a brutal modern gladiatorial arena. Here, men are pitted against each other in deadly battles, all for the twisted amusement of online spectators. As David navigates this savage world, he must fight for his survival while grappling with the moral implications of the bloodthirsty spectacle. Will he emerge victorious, or will he become just another casualty in the ruthless arena? title = Stuck in Love 
overview = An acclaimed writer, his ex-wife, and their teenaged children come to terms with the complexities of love in all its forms over the course of one tumultuous year. 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 213.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Informant Media 
tagline = A story about first loves and second chances. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Stuck in Love," produced by Informant Media with a budget of 213.2 million dollars, viewers are taken on a journey through the intricacies of love. The movie follows an acclaimed writer, his ex-wife, and their teenage children as they navigate the various forms of love over the course of a tumultuous year. With a tagline that promises a story about first loves and second chances, "Stuck in Love" beautifully captures the complexities and nuances of relationships in a heartfelt and compelling manner.

title = Territories 
overview = Five friends return home from a marriage in Canada to the United States. Not far from the border, two customs officers stop them to check their identity. 
cast = Cristina Rosato, Roc LaFortune, Sean Devine, Nicole Leroux 
Director = Olivier Abbou 
production countrie = France 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Cristina Rosato, Roc LaFortune, Sean Devine, Nicole Leroux 

In the gripping thriller "Territories," directed by Olivier Abbou, five friends find themselves in a tense situation as they journey home from a wedding in Canada to the United States. Close to the border, their plans are interrupted when they are halted by two customs officers for an identity check. Starring Cristina Rosato, Roc LaFortune, Sean Devine, and Nicole Leroux, this French production keeps viewers on the edge of their seats as the friends navigate through unexpected challenges on their way back home. The movie was filmed in France.

title = Snapshot 
overview = Angela is a young hairdresser thrown out of home by her puritantical mother after too many nights out. She quickly falls in with the modeling crowd and does some modeling work herself, while it seems she is being stalked by a mysterious figure driving an ice-cream van. 
cast = Chantal Contouri, Robert Bruning, Sigrid Thornton, Hugh Keays-Byrne 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 294.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Antony I. Ginnane 
production compagnie = Filmways Australasian 
production countrie = Australia 
date of release = the 1 of June 1979 
budget = 77.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.5 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Chantal Contouri, Robert Bruning, Sigrid Thornton, Hugh Keays-Byrne 

In the thrilling movie "Snapshot," Angela, a young hairdresser, finds herself kicked out of her home by her strict mother after too many nights out. Embracing the fast-paced world of modeling, Angela quickly falls in with the modeling crowd and does some modeling work herself. She navigates her way through photo shoots and glamorous events, all while it seems she is being stalked by a mysterious figure driving an ice-cream van. As Angela's world becomes increasingly perilous, she must unravel the identity of her tormentor before it's too late. Starring Chantal Contouri, Robert Bruning, Sigrid Thornton, and Hugh Keays-Byrne, this English-language film, produced by Antony I. Ginnane under Filmways Australasian, takes viewers on a suspenseful journey filled with twists and turns. With a release date of June 1, 1979, in Australia, "Snapshot" had a budget of 77.4 million dollars and went on to generate a staggering revenue of 294.9 million dollars, captivating audiences with its average rating of 5.5.

title = G.I. Blues 
overview = In Frankfurt, the G.I. Tulsa McLean (Elvis Presley) bets all the money his friends Cookie (Robert Ivers) and Rick (James Douglas) and he are saving to buy a night-club of their own in USA that his mate Dynamite will seduce and spend a night with the untouchable cabaret dancer Lili (Juliet Prowse). When Dynamite is transferred to Alaska, Tulsa has to replace him in the bet. 
date of release = the 23 of November 1960 
duration of the movie = 1h44 
Director = Norman Taurog 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 23 of November 1960 

In the 1960 film "G.I. Blues," directed by Norman Taurog, audiences are transported to Frankfurt where G.I. Tulsa McLean, played by the iconic Elvis Presley, finds himself in a high-stakes bet. Alongside his friends Cookie and Rick, Tulsa wagers their hard-earned money meant for a future night-club on whether his buddy Dynamite can woo the elusive cabaret dancer Lili, portrayed by Juliet Prowse. However, when Dynamite is unexpectedly reassigned to Alaska, Tulsa must step in to fulfill the bet. Released on November 23, 1960, this musical comedy runs for 1 hour and 44 minutes, showcasing Presley's charm and musical talents in a lively and entertaining story.

['correct']

Released on November 23, 1960, this musical comedy runs for 1 hour and 44 minutes, showcasing Presley's charm and musical talents in a lively and entertaining story.

Alongside his friends Cookie and Rick, Tulsa wagers their hard-earned money meant for a future night-club on whether his buddy Dynamite can woo the elusive cabaret dancer Lili, portrayed by Juliet Prowse. However, when Dynamite is unexpectedly reassigned to Alaska, Tulsa must step in to fulfill the bet. Released on November 23, 1960, this musical comedy runs for 1 hour and 44 minutes, showcasing Presley's charm and musical talents in a lively and entertaining story.

title = Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides 
overview = Captain Jack Sparrow crosses paths with a woman from his past, and he's not sure if it's love -- or if she's a ruthless con artist who's using him to find the fabled Fountain of Youth. When she forces him aboard the Queen Anne's Revenge, the ship of the formidable pirate Blackbeard, Jack finds himself on an unexpected adventure in which he doesn't know who to fear more: Blackbeard or the woman from his past. 
Producer = Jerry Bruckheimer 
duration of the movie = 2h16 
budget = 380.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 14 of May 2011 
tagline = Live Forever Or Die Trying. 
Director = Rob Marshall 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.4 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 
revenue = 1045.7 millions of dollars 
cast = Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Ian McShane, Kevin McNally 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Jerry Bruckheimer 

In "Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides," produced by Jerry Bruckheimer and directed by Rob Marshall, Captain Jack Sparrow finds himself entangled in a dangerous game of love and deceit. When a woman from his past reappears, Jack is unsure of her true intentions - whether it's love or a ploy to uncover the legendary Fountain of Youth. Forced aboard the Queen Anne's Revenge by the notorious pirate Blackbeard, Jack embarks on an unpredictable journey where he must navigate between the threats of Blackbeard and the mysterious woman. With a star-studded cast including Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Ian McShane, and Kevin McNally, this swashbuckling adventure unfolds over a duration of 2 hours and 16 minutes. Set against the backdrop of the high seas, this tale of treachery and redemption was released on the 14th of May 2011, captivating audiences with its tagline "Live Forever Or Die Trying." With a budget of 380 million dollars, the film went on to gross a staggering 1045.7 million dollars at the box office, earning an average rating of 6.4. "Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides" is a thrilling voyage filled with twists and turns, where the quest for eternal life comes at a steep price. The movie was produced by Walt Disney Pictures and the original language of the movie is English. The production country is the United States of America.

title = What Ever Happened to Aunt Alice? 
overview = As Aunt Alice, Ruth Gordon applies for the job of housekeeper in the Tucson, Arizona home of widow Claire Marrable in order to find out what happened to a missing widowed friend, Edna Tilsney. The crazed Page, left only a stamp album by her husband, takes money from her housekeepers, kills them, and buries the bodies in her garden. Alice is a widow too. So is neighbor Harriet Vaughn. Lots of widows here. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the suspenseful thriller "What Ever Happened to Aunt Alice?", Ruth Gordon stars as Aunt Alice, a cunning housekeeper who takes on a job in Tucson, Arizona to uncover the mystery behind her missing friend, Edna Tilsney. As she delves deeper into the household of widow Claire Marrable, Aunt Alice discovers a dark secret - the deranged Page, a widow herself, has been committing heinous crimes against her housekeepers. With a chilling plot filled with twists and turns, this English-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. With an average rating of 5.2, "What Ever Happened to Aunt Alice?" is a gripping tale of suspense and intrigue that will leave you questioning the motives of those around you. The movie features neighbor Harriet Vaughn, who is also a widow, adding to the theme of widows in the storyline.

In the suspenseful thriller "What Ever Happened to Aunt Alice?", Ruth Gordon stars as Aunt Alice, a cunning housekeeper who takes on a job in Tucson, Arizona to uncover the mystery behind her missing friend, Edna Tilsney. As she delves deeper into the household of widow Claire Marrable, Aunt Alice discovers a dark secret - the deranged Page, a widow herself, has been committing heinous crimes against her housekeepers. With a chilling plot filled with twists and turns, this English-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. With an average rating of 5.2, "What Ever Happened to Aunt Alice?" is a gripping tale of suspense and intrigue that will leave you questioning the motives of those around you. The movie features neighbor Harriet Vaughn, who is also a widow, adding to the theme of widows in the storyline. 
 
 

 
title = G:MT Greenwich Mean Time 
overview = Six London school-leavers attempt to make it in the world, balancing the challenge of trying to make a name for themselves in the music industry against the pressures and tragedies of everyday life. 
Director = John Strickland 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = John Strickland 

In "G:MT Greenwich Mean Time," directed by John Strickland, we follow the journey of six London school-leavers as they navigate the complexities of pursuing their dreams in the music industry while facing the harsh realities of everyday life. Set against the backdrop of the bustling city, the film delves into the challenges and triumphs these young individuals experience as they strive to establish themselves in the competitive world of music. Amidst the pressures and tragedies they encounter, the characters must find a way to carve out their own paths and leave a mark on the world. The movie portrays the struggles and successes of the characters as they try to make a name for themselves in the music industry.

title = Our Mother's House 
overview = Seven British children bury their mother and hide her death, until their long-lost father (Dirk Bogarde) returns. 
production compagnie = Filmways Pictures 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
budget = 112.2 millions of dollars 
cast = Dirk Bogarde, Margaret Brooks, Pamela Franklin, Louis Sheldon Williams 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 244.9 millions of dollars 
tagline = The children's story that is not for children... 
date of release = the 9 of October 1967 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Filmways Pictures 

In the British film "Our Mother's House," seven children face a difficult decision after burying their mother and keeping her death a secret. Their world is turned upside down when their long-lost father, portrayed by Dirk Bogarde, unexpectedly reappears. Directed by Filmways Pictures, this emotional drama unfolds in the United Kingdom and features a talented cast including Margaret Brooks, Pamela Franklin, and Louis Sheldon Williams. With a budget of 112.2 million dollars, the film's original English language dialogue captures the heart-wrenching struggles of the children. Released on October 9, 1967, "Our Mother's House" garnered a revenue of 244.9 million dollars, captivating audiences with its tagline: "The children's story that is not for children..."

title = Jason X 
overview = In the year 2455, Old Earth is now a contaminated planet abandoned for centuries -- a brown world of violent storms, toxic landmasses and poisonous seas. Yet humans have returned to the deadly place that they once fled, not to live, but to research the ancient, rusting artifacts of the long-gone civilizations. But it's not the harmful environment that could prove fatal to the intrepid, young explorers who have just landed on Old Earth. For them, it's Friday the 13th, and Jason lives! 
Producer = Noel Cunningham 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 24 of July 2001 
average note = 4.5 
Director = James Isaac 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 17.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Kane Hodder, Lexa Doig, Chuck Campbell, Lisa Ryder 
budget = 11.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = Evil has an upgrade. 
duration of the movie = 1h31 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Noel Cunningham 

In the year 2455, Earth has become a desolate wasteland, abandoned and contaminated. A group of young explorers lands on the planet to research ancient artifacts, unaware of the lurking danger. It's Friday the 13th, and the infamous killer Jason Voorhees is alive and ready to strike. Directed by James Isaac and produced by Noel Cunningham, "Jason X" takes the horror franchise to new heights. Starring Kane Hodder, Lexa Doig, Chuck Campbell, and Lisa Ryder, this English-language film was released on July 24, 2001. With a budget of 11.0 million dollars, the movie grossed 17.0 million dollars at the box office, despite receiving an average rating of 4.5. As the tagline suggests, "Evil has an upgrade" in this 1 hour and 31-minute thrilling installment of the iconic "Friday the 13th" series.

With a budget of 11.0 million dollars, the movie grossed 17.0 million dollars at the box office, despite receiving an average rating of 4.5. As the tagline suggests, "Evil has an upgrade" in this 1 hour and 31-minute thrilling installment of the iconic "Friday the 13th" series.

In the romantic drama "Some Kind of Wonderful," directed by Howard Deutch, a young tomboy named Watts discovers that her feelings for her best friend, Keith, go beyond mere friendship when he lands a date with the most popular girl in school. Set in the United States of America, this Paramount Pictures production was released on the 27th of February 1987. The film features a talented cast including Eric Stoltz, Mary Stuart Masterson, Lea Thompson, and Chynna Phillips. With a budget of 134.1 million dollars, the movie is presented in English and has a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes. Despite its average rating of 6.9, "Some Kind of Wonderful" captures the complexities of young love and friendship in a heartfelt and relatable way.

title = Accattone 
overview = A pimp with no other means to provide for himself finds his life spiralling out of control when his prostitute is sent to prison. 
production compagnie = Cino del Duca 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Cino del Duca 

In "Accattone," produced by Cino del Duca, we are introduced to a desperate pimp who is struggling to make ends meet. His already tumultuous life takes a turn for the worse when his prostitute partner is unexpectedly sent to prison. As he grapples with the consequences of this sudden separation, his world begins to unravel, leading him down a path of self-destruction. Will he be able to find a way out of this downward spiral, or is he doomed to face the harsh realities of his choices?

title = Four Days in September 
overview = Fernando, a journalist, and his friend César join terrorist group MR8 in order to fight Brazilian dictatorial regime during the late sixties. Cesare, however, is wounded and captured during a bank hold up. Fernando then decides to kidnap the American ambassador in Brazil and ask for the release of fifteen political prisoners in exchange for his life. 
date of release = the 1 of May 1997 
Producer = Luiz Carlos Barreto 
revenue = 0.3 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.3 
tagline = Their goal: freedom. Their only hope: an international incident. Their target: the American ambassador. 
budget = 216.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Miramax Films 
production countrie = Brazil 
Director = Bruno Barreto 
original language of the movie = Portuguese 
duration of the movie = 1h50 
cast = Alan Arkin, Pedro Cardoso, Fernanda Torres, Cláudia Abreu 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of May 1997 

In "Four Days in September," directed by Bruno Barreto and released on the 1st of May 1997, viewers are taken on a gripping journey back to the late sixties in Brazil. The film follows the story of journalist Fernando and his friend César, who join the terrorist group MR8 to combat the oppressive Brazilian dictatorial regime. When César is wounded and captured during a bank heist, Fernando takes drastic measures by kidnapping the American ambassador in Brazil. The tension escalates as Fernando demands the release of fifteen political prisoners in exchange for the ambassador's life, leading to a high-stakes international incident. With a stellar cast including Alan Arkin, Pedro Cardoso, Fernanda Torres, and Cláudia Abreu, this Portuguese-language film produced by Luiz Carlos Barreto under Miramax Films captures the essence of courage, sacrifice, and the fight for freedom. Despite its modest revenue of 0.3 million dollars against a budget of 216.4 million dollars, "Four Days in September" resonated with audiences, earning an average rating of 7.3. The tagline encapsulates the film's intense narrative: "Their goal: freedom. Their only hope: an international incident. Their target: the American ambassador."

The film follows the story of journalist Fernando and his friend César, who join the terrorist group MR8 to combat the oppressive Brazilian dictatorial regime. When César is wounded and captured during a bank heist, Fernando takes drastic measures by kidnapping the American ambassador in Brazil. The tension escalates as Fernando demands the release of fifteen political prisoners in exchange for the ambassador's life, leading to a high-stakes international incident. With a stellar cast including Alan Arkin, Pedro Cardoso, Fernanda Torres, and Cláudia Abreu, this Portuguese-language film produced by Luiz Carlos Barreto under Miramax Films captures the essence of courage, sacrifice, and the fight for freedom. Despite its modest revenue of 0.3 million dollars against a budget of 216.4 million dollars, "Four Days in September" resonated with audiences, earning an average rating of 7.3. The tagline encapsulates the film's intense narrative: "Their goal: freedom. Their only hope: an international incident. Their target: the American ambassador."

['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h50

title = Only Angels Have Wings 
overview = Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) is the head of a crumbling air freight service in desperate need of a replacement pilot. He is forced to hire a descredited aviator (Richard Barthelmess) who arrives with his wife (Rita Hayworth), Carter's ex-lover. Meanwhile, traveler Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur) tries to get close to the emotionally closed-off Carter. The film received two Academy Award nominations. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 7.0 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the classic film "Only Angels Have Wings," Geoff Carter, portrayed by the charismatic Cary Grant, leads a struggling air freight service in the United States of America. When he hires a disgraced pilot, played by Richard Barthelmess, tensions rise as the pilot's wife, portrayed by the stunning Rita Hayworth, turns out to be Carter's former flame. Amidst this drama, traveler Bonnie Lee, played by Jean Arthur, attempts to break through Carter's emotional barriers. Nominated for two Academy Awards, this English-language film captivates audiences with its compelling storyline and memorable performances, earning an average rating of 7.0.

title = Something of Value 
overview = As Kenya's Mau Mau uprising tears the country apart, former childhood friends Kimani (Sidney Poitier), a native, and Peter (Rock Hudson), a British colonist, find themselves on opposite sides of the struggle in this provocative drama. Though each is devoted to his cause, both wish for a more moderate path -- but their hopes for a peaceful resolution are thwarted by rage, colonial arrogance and escalating violence on both sides. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Director = Richard Brooks 

In the thought-provoking drama "Something of Value," set against the backdrop of Kenya's Mau Mau uprising, childhood friends Kimani (Sidney Poitier) and Peter (Rock Hudson) are forced to confront their differing loyalties as they find themselves on opposing sides of the conflict. Despite their shared desire for a more moderate approach, their hopes for peace are shattered by the overwhelming forces of rage, colonial arrogance, and escalating violence. As the country is torn apart, Kimani and Peter must navigate the complexities of their friendship amidst the chaos of war.

Facts included in the description:
1. The film is set during Kenya's Mau Mau uprising.
2. Kimani is portrayed by Sidney Poitier.
3. Peter is portrayed by Rock Hudson.
4. Kimani and Peter are childhood friends.
5. They find themselves on opposite sides of the conflict.
6. Both wish for a more moderate path.
7. Their hopes for a peaceful resolution are thwarted by rage, colonial arrogance, and escalating violence on both sides.

2. Kimani is portrayed by Sidney Poitier.
3. Peter is portrayed by Rock Hudson.
4. Kimani and Peter are childhood friends.
5. They find themselves on opposite sides of the conflict.
6. Both wish for a more moderate path.
7. Their hopes for a peaceful resolution are thwarted by rage, colonial arrogance, and escalating violence on both sides. 
 
 

 
title = Carrie 
overview = Carrie may be ostracized, but the shy teen has the ability to move objects with her mind. So when the high school "in crowd" torments her with a sick joke at the prom, she lashes out with devastating -- and deadly -- power. 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = United Artists 
date of release = the 3 of November 1976 
tagline = If you’ve got a taste for terror... take Carrie to the prom. 
revenue = 33.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.0 
cast = Sissy Spacek, Piper Laurie, Amy Irving, William Katt 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 1976 film "Carrie," directed by United Artists, we are introduced to a shy teen named Carrie who possesses the extraordinary ability to move objects with her mind. Despite being ostracized by her peers, Carrie's life takes a dark turn when she is humiliated by the popular kids at prom. As the tagline suggests, "If you’ve got a taste for terror... take Carrie to the prom," the consequences of their cruel prank unleash Carrie's deadly powers. Starring Sissy Spacek, Piper Laurie, Amy Irving, and William Katt, this supernatural horror film grossed 33.8 million dollars at the box office and received an average rating of 7.0. "Carrie" was released on the 3rd of November 1976 in English.

title = Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God 
overview = Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God: The easily offended might do best to avoid Jim Jefferies’ raunchy, rude humor (or at least imbibe the two-drink minimum beforehand), but the Australian-born comedian provides plenty of laughs for everyone else in this HBO special. In I Swear to God, Jefferies continues his patented brand of comedy that once got him punched by an audience member, discussing the idiocy of no-smoking signs, sluts vs. studs, and his father’s Holocaust jokes. 
tagline = Heaven Help Us 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 27.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 0h58 
revenue = 178.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Heaven Help Us 

In "Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God," the Australian-born comedian delivers a raunchy and rude humor-filled HBO special that is not for the easily offended. With a budget of 27.3 million dollars, Jefferies takes the audience on a wild ride discussing topics like no-smoking signs, sluts vs. studs, and even his father's Holocaust jokes. Despite once getting punched by an audience member for his comedy, Jefferies manages to entertain and provoke laughter from the crowd. The movie has a duration of 58 minutes and was a commercial success, raking in a revenue of 178.1 million dollars. As the tagline "Heaven Help Us" suggests, this special is not for the faint of heart but guarantees plenty of laughs for those who can handle the humor. The production country for this special is the United States of America.

title = Æon Flux 
overview = 400 years into the future, disease has wiped out the majority of the world's population, except one walled city, Bregna, ruled by a congress of scientists. When Æon Flux, the top operative in the underground 'Monican' rebellion, is sent on a mission to kill a government leader, she uncovers a world of secrets. 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 52.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = Gale Anne Hurd 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the futuristic world of "Æon Flux," where disease has devastated humanity, one city remains standing - Bregna, governed by a council of scientists. Æon Flux, a skilled operative of the rebel group 'Monicans,' is tasked with assassinating a high-ranking official, leading her to discover a web of hidden truths. Produced by Gale Anne Hurd and originally presented in English, this sci-fi thriller grossed an impressive $52.3 million at the box office.

title = Waitress 
overview = Jenna is a pregnant, unhappily married waitress in the deep south. She meets a newcomer to her town and falls into an unlikely relationship as a last attempt at happiness. 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 25 of May 2007 
average note = 6.6 
Director = Adrienne Shelly 
duration of the movie = 1h48 
revenue = 22.2 millions of dollars 
Producer = Michael Roiff 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming film "Waitress," directed by Adrienne Shelly and produced by Michael Roiff, we follow Jenna, a pregnant and unhappily married waitress in the deep south. Despite her challenging circumstances, Jenna finds a glimmer of hope when she meets a newcomer to her town and embarks on an unlikely relationship, seeking a last attempt at happiness. Set against the backdrop of a small Southern town, this English-language movie was released on the 25th of May 2007 and runs for 1 hour and 48 minutes. With a budget of 2.0 million dollars, "Waitress" went on to earn an impressive revenue of 22.2 million dollars. Garnering an average rating of 6.6, this heartfelt tale captures the resilience and strength of its protagonist as she navigates life's challenges in pursuit of a brighter future.

With a budget of 2.0 million dollars, "Waitress" went on to earn an impressive revenue of 22.2 million dollars. Garnering an average rating of 6.6, this heartfelt tale captures the resilience and strength of its protagonist as she navigates life's challenges in pursuit of a brighter future.

title = Red Ensign 
overview = David Barr is the manager and chief designer of a British shipyard in decline. The shipyard is in financial trouble but Barr has a design for a new ship that will save them all. Can he get the ship built in spite of the opposition from his own bankers as well as the rival shipbuilders and their infiltrated militants. 
average note = 0.0 
budget = 110.9 millions of dollars 
cast = Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Frank Vosper, Alfred Drayton 
tagline = not applicable 
Director = Michael Powell 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 0.0 

In "Red Ensign," directed by Michael Powell, we are taken into the world of David Barr, the manager and chief designer of a struggling British shipyard. With the shipyard facing financial difficulties, Barr holds the key to their salvation - a groundbreaking design for a new ship. However, he must navigate through obstacles such as opposition from his own bankers, rival shipbuilders, and their infiltrated militants. As tensions rise and challenges mount, Barr must race against time to see his vision come to life. Starring Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Frank Vosper, and Alfred Drayton, this high-stakes drama unfolds against the backdrop of a fading industry, highlighting the resilience and determination of one man against all odds. With a budget of 110.9 million dollars, "Red Ensign" is a riveting tale of ambition, betrayal, and the fight for survival.

Facts included in the final description:
- Title: Red Ensign
- Director: Michael Powell
- Overview: David Barr is the manager and chief designer of a British shipyard in decline. The shipyard is in financial trouble but Barr has a design for a new ship that will save them all. Can he get the ship built in spite of the opposition from his own bankers as well as the rival shipbuilders and their infiltrated militants.
- Average note: 0.0
- Budget: 110.9 million dollars
- Cast: Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Frank Vosper, Alfred Drayton

title = Supernova 
overview = A international science conference is held in Australia when Dr. Austin Shepard mysteriously disappears Dr. Shepard's colleague, Christopher Richardson and other people are soon faced with the reality of an impending crisis and an attempt to keep the information from the public. While a full-blown supernova does not occur, explosions on the sun cause massive damage in Australia, and is shown often in Sydney and in various other cities and countries of the world. 
date of release = the 5 of September 2005 
Director = John Harrison 
duration of the movie = 2h52 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 70.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 5 of September 2005 

In the thrilling sci-fi movie "Supernova," directed by John Harrison, a gripping tale unfolds at an international science conference in Australia. When renowned scientist Dr. Austin Shepard vanishes mysteriously, his colleague Christopher Richardson and others are thrust into a race against time to avert a looming crisis. As explosions on the sun wreak havoc across Australia, particularly in Sydney and other global cities, the team must grapple with the catastrophic aftermath while trying to conceal the impending danger from the public. Released on September 5, 2005, this English-language film with a runtime of 2 hours and 52 minutes delivers a high-stakes narrative against a backdrop of a $70.4 million budget.

In the thrilling sci-fi movie "Supernova," directed by John Harrison, a gripping tale unfolds at an international science conference in Australia. When renowned scientist Dr. Austin Shepard vanishes mysteriously, his colleague Christopher Richardson and others are thrust into a race against time to avert a looming crisis. As explosions on the sun wreak havoc across Australia, particularly in Sydney and other global cities, the team must grapple with the catastrophic aftermath while trying to conceal the impending danger from the public. Released on September 5, 2005, this English-language film with a runtime of 2 hours and 52 minutes delivers a high-stakes narrative against a backdrop of a $70.4 million budget.

['wrong']
fact : average note = 3.1

title = Hustle & Flow 
overview = With help from his friends, a Memphis pimp in a mid-life crisis attempts to become a successful hip-hop emcee. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.9 
tagline = The music will inspire them. The dream will unite them. This summer get crunk. 
date of release = the 22 of July 2005 
duration of the movie = 1h56 
production compagnie = MTV Films 
Producer = John Singleton 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 23.6 millions of dollars 
cast = Terrence Howard, Anthony Anderson, Taryn Manning, Taraji P. Henson 
budget = 8.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Craig Brewer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 2005 film "Hustle & Flow," directed by Craig Brewer and produced by John Singleton, viewers are taken on a journey with a Memphis pimp experiencing a mid-life crisis. With the support of his friends, he sets out to pursue a new dream of becoming a successful hip-hop emcee. Starring Terrence Howard, Anthony Anderson, Taryn Manning, and Taraji P. Henson, this English-language movie has an average rating of 6.9. Released on the 22nd of July 2005, the film runs for 1 hour and 56 minutes and was produced by MTV Films in the United States of America. Despite its $8.0 million budget, "Hustle & Flow" managed to generate $23.6 million in revenue. The tagline "The music will inspire them. The dream will unite them. This summer get crunk" sets the tone for this inspiring and gritty tale of chasing dreams against all odds.

title = Vincent 
overview = Young Vincent Malloy dreams of being just like Vincent Price and loses himself in macabre daydreams which annoys his mother. 
date of release = the 1 of January 1982 
Producer = Rick Heinrichs 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Productions 
cast = Vincent Price 
budget = 0.1 millions of dollars 
revenue = 244.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of January 1982 

In the dark and whimsical world of "Vincent," released on the 1st of January 1982 by Walt Disney Productions, young Vincent Malloy finds solace in his eerie daydreams inspired by his idol, the legendary Vincent Price. As he immerses himself in these macabre fantasies, much to the chagrin of his mother, Vincent's vivid imagination takes center stage. With a budget of only 0.1 million dollars, this hauntingly beautiful production, helmed by producer Rick Heinrichs, surpassed all expectations by raking in a staggering revenue of 244.1 million dollars. Staying true to its roots, the film features the iconic Vincent Price, adding an extra layer of authenticity to this captivating tale of dreams and darkness. Vincent was a short animated film.

title = The Poker House 
overview = Actress Lori Petty makes her directorial debut with this poignant, beautifully crafted film about a teenage girl trying to survive the dismal circumstances of her life with dignity, humor, and basketball. 
budget = 73.8 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = The Poker House 
average note = 6.1 
Producer = Stephen J. Cannell 
tagline = Lust, drugs and violence... no place for a kid. 
cast = Jennifer Lawrence, Selma Blair, Bokeem Woodbine, Chloë Grace Moretz 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 73.8 millions of dollars 

In "The Poker House," director Lori Petty makes her directorial debut with a poignant, beautifully crafted film about a teenage girl trying to survive the dismal circumstances of her life with dignity, humor, and basketball. With a budget of 73.8 million dollars, this movie is a powerful coming-of-age story that explores themes of resilience and survival. The production company behind the film is also named The Poker House. The average note for the movie is 6.1, indicating its impact on viewers. Producer Stephen J. Cannell played a key role in bringing this emotionally charged story to life. The tagline "Lust, drugs and violence... no place for a kid" sets the tone for the harsh realities depicted in the film. The talented cast includes Jennifer Lawrence, Selma Blair, Bokeem Woodbine, and Chloë Grace Moretz, who deliver compelling performances that bring depth to the characters and the narrative.

Cannell played a key role in bringing this emotionally charged story to life. The tagline "Lust, drugs and violence... no place for a kid" sets the tone for the harsh realities depicted in the film. The talented cast includes Jennifer Lawrence, Selma Blair, Bokeem Woodbine, and Chloë Grace Moretz, who deliver compelling performances that bring depth to the characters and the narrative.

title = If I Stay 
overview = Based on Gayle Forman's novel of the same name. "If I Stay" is the story of the gifted classical musician Mia and her boyfriend, Adam, an up and coming indie-rock star. Torn between two paths in life, her art or her relationship, Mia is forced to make an even starker choice between life and death when she is caught in a fatal car accident with her family one snowy morning in Oregon. 
tagline = Live for Love. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Live for Love. 

In the emotional film "If I Stay", based on Gayle Forman's novel, viewers are taken on a journey through the life of Mia, a talented classical musician, and her boyfriend Adam, a rising indie-rock star. As Mia grapples with the decision between pursuing her art or nurturing her relationship, a tragic car accident on a snowy morning in Oregon forces her to confront an even more harrowing choice between life and death. With the poignant tagline "Live for Love", this English-language movie beautifully captures the complexities of love, loss, and the power of decisions that shape our destinies.

title = The Interpreter 
overview = After Silvia Broome, an interpreter at United Nations headquarters, overhears plans of an assassination, an American Secret Service agent is sent to investigate. 
Director = Sydney Pollack 
Producer = Tim Bevan 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Sydney Pollack 

In the gripping political thriller "The Interpreter," directed by Sydney Pollack and produced by Tim Bevan, the story follows Silvia Broome, a skilled interpreter at the United Nations. When Silvia accidentally overhears a sinister plot to carry out an assassination, the tension escalates as an American Secret Service agent is tasked with unraveling the conspiracy. As the stakes rise and the clock ticks, the race to prevent a deadly attack intensifies, showcasing the power of language and the high-stakes world of international diplomacy. 

Facts included:
- Title: The Interpreter
- Overview: After Silvia Broome, an interpreter at United Nations headquarters, overhears plans of an assassination, an American Secret Service agent is sent to investigate.
- Director: Sydney Pollack
- Producer: Tim Bevan
