title = The Adventures of Tintin 
overview = Intrepid young reporter, Tintin and his loyal dog, Snowy are thrust into a world of high adventure when they discover a ship carrying an explosive secret. As Tintin is drawn into a centuries-old mystery, Ivan Ivanovitch Sakharine suspects him of stealing a priceless treasure. Tintin and Snowy, with the help of salty, cantankerous Captain Haddock and bumbling detectives, Thompson &amp; Thomson, travel half the world, one step ahead of their enemies as Tintin endeavors to find The Unicorn, a sunken ship that may hold a vast fortune, but also an ancient curse. 
revenue = 371.9 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.7 
budget = 130.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
date of release = the 25 of October 2011 
tagline = This year, discover how far adventure will take you. 
production countrie = New Zealand 
Producer = Steven Spielberg 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 371.9 millions of dollars 

Join intrepid young reporter Tintin and his loyal dog Snowy in "The Adventures of Tintin," a thrilling tale of high adventure and mystery. When Tintin discovers a ship with a dangerous secret, he is plunged into a centuries-old enigma that leads him on a globe-trotting quest to find the sunken ship, The Unicorn. Along the way, Tintin must outwit the villainous Ivan Ivanovitch Sakharine, who accuses him of stealing a priceless treasure. With the help of the eccentric Captain Haddock, the bumbling detectives Thompson & Thomson, and a dose of wit and courage, Tintin races against time to uncover the truth behind The Unicorn and its ancient curse. Directed by Steven Spielberg and produced by Paramount Pictures, this English-language film was released on the 25th of October 2011 in New Zealand, captivating audiences worldwide with its tagline, "This year, discover how far adventure will take you." With a stellar revenue of 371.9 million dollars and an average rating of 6.7, "The Adventures of Tintin" is a cinematic journey not to be missed. The film had a budget of 130.0 million dollars and was produced in New Zealand. The production company behind the movie is Paramount Pictures.

Along the way, Tintin must outwit the villainous Ivan Ivanovitch Sakharine, who accuses him of stealing a priceless treasure. With the help of the eccentric Captain Haddock, the bumbling detectives Thompson & Thomson, and a dose of wit and courage, Tintin races against time to uncover the truth behind The Unicorn and its ancient curse. Directed by Steven Spielberg and produced by Paramount Pictures, this English-language film was released on the 25th of October 2011 in New Zealand, captivating audiences worldwide with its tagline, "This year, discover how far adventure will take you." With a stellar revenue of 371.9 million dollars and an average rating of 6.7, "The Adventures of Tintin" is a cinematic journey not to be missed. The film had a budget of 130.0 million dollars and was produced in New Zealand. The production company behind the movie is Paramount Pictures.

title = Open Water 2: Adrift 
overview = A weekend cruise on a luxurious party yacht goes horribly wrong for a group of old high-school friends. They forget to let the ladder down before they jump into the ocean for a swim. The boat proves impossible to climb. They are stuck in the water many miles from shore, with baby Sara left alone on board. Sara's mother Amy must contend with her aqua-phobia as well as the group's increasing desperation, as the friends begin to turn on each other. Soon the exhaustion of keeping afloat and the struggle to get back on board begin to take a terrible toll. The happy reunion turns into a fight for survival... 
Director = Hans Horn 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Hans Horn 

In "Open Water 2: Adrift," director Hans Horn takes viewers on a thrilling and intense journey as a group of old high-school friends find themselves in a nightmare scenario during a weekend cruise on a luxurious party yacht. When they forget to lower the ladder before jumping into the ocean for a swim, they quickly realize they are unable to climb back onto the boat. Stranded many miles from shore, tensions rise as they struggle to stay afloat and come up with a plan to survive. With baby Sara left alone on board, Sara's mother Amy must face her aqua-phobia while also dealing with the group's increasing desperation and infighting. As exhaustion sets in and the battle to reboard the yacht becomes increasingly dire, what was supposed to be a joyous reunion turns into a fight for their lives.

Facts included:
- Title: Open Water 2: Adrift
- Director: Hans Horn
- A group of old high-school friends on a weekend cruise face a nightmare scenario.
- They forget to lower the ladder before jumping into the ocean for a swim.
- The boat proves impossible to climb back onto.
- The friends are stuck in the water many miles from shore.
- Baby Sara is left alone on board.
- Sara's mother Amy must deal with her aqua-phobia.
- The group's desperation increases as they struggle to survive.
- Tensions rise as the friends begin to turn on each other.
- The battle to get back on board takes a terrible toll on the group.
- The happy reunion turns into a fight for survival.

title = Winnie the Pooh 
overview = During an ordinary day in Hundred Acre Wood, Winnie the Pooh sets out to find some honey. Misinterpreting a note from Christopher Robin, Pooh convinces Tigger, Rabbit, Piglet, Owl, Kanga, Roo, and Eeyore that their young friend has been captured by a creature named "Backson" and they set out to save him. 
average note = 6.8 
revenue = 14.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Peter Del Vecho 
date of release = the 13 of April 2011 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.8 

In the heartwarming tale of "Winnie the Pooh," set in the charming Hundred Acre Wood, our beloved bear, Pooh, embarks on a quest for honey. When a note from Christopher Robin is misunderstood, Pooh rallies his friends - Tigger, Rabbit, Piglet, Owl, Kanga, Roo, and Eeyore - to rescue their missing companion from the clutches of the mysterious "Backson." Produced by Peter Del Vecho and released on April 13, 2011, in the United States of America, this English-language film by Walt Disney Pictures enchanted audiences worldwide, grossing a remarkable $14.5 million at the box office. With an average rating of 6.8, this heartwarming adventure is a timeless classic for all ages.

['correct']

In the heartwarming tale of "Winnie the Pooh," set in the charming Hundred Acre Wood, our beloved bear, Pooh, embarks on a quest for honey. When a note from Christopher Robin is misunderstood, Pooh rallies his friends - Tigger, Rabbit, Piglet, Owl, Kanga, Roo, and Eeyore - to rescue their missing companion from the clutches of the mysterious "Backson." Produced by Peter Del Vecho and released on April 13, 2011, in the United States of America, this English-language film by Walt Disney Pictures enchanted audiences worldwide, grossing a remarkable $14.5 million at the box office. With an average rating of 6.8, this heartwarming adventure is a timeless classic for all ages.

title = The Man from Nowhere 
overview = His only friend called him 'the man from nowhere'... Taesik, a former special agent becomes a loner after losing his wife in a miserable accident and lives a bitter life running a pawnshop. He only has a few customers and a friend named Somi, a little girl next door. As Taesik spends more and more time with Somi, he gets attached to her. Then Somi is kidnapped by a gang, and as Taesik tries to save Somi by becoming deeply associated with the gang his mysterious past is revealed... 
cast = Won Bin, Kim Sae-ron, Kim Tae-hoon, Kim Hee-won 
Director = Lee Jeong-Beom 
tagline = Nothing to lose, nothing to compromise. 
original language of the movie = Korean 
average note = 7.6 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Won Bin, Kim Sae-ron, Kim Tae-hoon, Kim Hee-won 

In "The Man from Nowhere," directed by Lee Jeong-Beom, we follow the story of Taesik, a former special agent who becomes a recluse after a tragic accident claims the life of his wife. Known as 'the man from nowhere,' Taesik leads a solitary life running a pawnshop with few customers, including his only friend, a young girl named Somi. When Somi is kidnapped by a ruthless gang, Taesik is forced to confront his past as he delves deep into the criminal underworld to rescue her. With a stellar cast including Won Bin, Kim Sae-ron, Kim Tae-hoon, and Kim Hee-won, this Korean-language film is a gripping tale of redemption and revenge. As the tagline suggests, Taesik has nothing to lose and nothing to compromise as he fights to save the one person he cares about. With an average rating of 7.6, "The Man from Nowhere" is a must-watch for fans of intense action and emotional storytelling.

title = Nine 1/2 Weeks 
overview = An erotic story about a woman, the assistant of an art gallery, who gets involved in an impersonal affair with a man. She barely knows about his life, only about the sex games they play, so the relationship begins to get complicated. 
Director = Adrian Lyne 
cast = Mickey Rourke, Kim Basinger, Margaret Whitton, David Margulies 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Adrian Lyne 

In the steamy and provocative film "Nine 1/2 Weeks," directed by Adrian Lyne, we are drawn into the seductive world of a woman working as an assistant at an art gallery. When she becomes entangled in a passionate yet detached affair with a mysterious man, played by Mickey Rourke, their relationship revolves solely around the intense and elaborate sexual games they engage in. As the lines between lust and emotion blur, portrayed by the talented Kim Basinger, Margaret Whitton, and David Margulies, the complexities of their unconventional connection begin to unravel. Will they be able to navigate the intricacies of their desires, or will their affair lead them down a path of no return?

Facts included in the description:
- Title: Nine 1/2 Weeks
- Overview: An erotic story about a woman, the assistant of an art gallery, who gets involved in an impersonal affair with a man. She barely knows about his life, only about the sex games they play, so the relationship begins to get complicated.
- Director: Adrian Lyne
- Cast: Mickey Rourke, Kim Basinger, Margaret Whitton, David Margulies

title = The Cannibal Man 
overview = A young man, Marco, working as a butcher, accidentally kills a taxi driver. His girlfriend Paula wants to go to the police so he has to kill her too. He then has to kill his brother, his brother’s fiancée and his father, who have become suspicious. He gets rid of the bodies by taking them to a slaughter house. 
tagline = When the butcher goes berserk.... 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
production compagnie = Atlas International Film 
cast = Vicente Parra, Emma Cohen, Eusebio Poncela, Charly Bravo 
average note = 6.4 
Producer = José Truchado 
Director = Eloy de la Iglesia 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
budget = 71.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 60.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Spain 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = When the butcher goes berserk.... 

In "The Cannibal Man," directed by Eloy de la Iglesia and produced by José Truchado for Atlas International Film, we are immersed in a chilling tale of a young butcher named Marco, portrayed by Vicente Parra. After accidentally killing a taxi driver, Marco's descent into madness begins as he is forced to eliminate anyone who becomes suspicious, including his girlfriend Paula, played by Emma Cohen, and even his own family members. As the bodies pile up, Marco's gruesome solution involves taking them to a slaughterhouse, all while trying to evade the authorities. With a tagline that ominously warns "When the butcher goes berserk...," this Spanish-language film from Atlas International Film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 38-minute duration. Despite a budget of 71.3 million dollars, the movie only managed to generate 60.7 million dollars in revenue. The stellar cast also includes Eusebio Poncela and Charly Bravo, delivering a performance that earned the film an average rating of 6.4. "The Cannibal Man" is a twisted thriller that showcases the dark consequences of one man's deadly actions in Spain. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h38 

In "The Cannibal Man," directed by Eloy de la Iglesia and produced by José Truchado for Atlas International Film, we are immersed in a chilling tale of a young butcher named Marco, portrayed by Vicente Parra. ['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Atlas International Film 

In "The Cannibal Man," directed by Eloy de la Iglesia and produced by José Truchado for Atlas International Film, we are immersed in a chilling tale of a young butcher named Marco, portrayed by Vicente Parra. After accidentally killing a taxi driver, Marco's descent into madness begins as he is forced to eliminate anyone who becomes suspicious, including his girlfriend Paula, played by Emma Cohen, and even his own family members. As the bodies pile up, Marco's gruesome solution involves taking them to a slaughterhouse, all while trying to evade the authorities. With a tagline that ominously warns "When the butcher goes berserk...," this Spanish-language film from Atlas International Film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 38-minute duration. Despite a budget of 71.3 million dollars, the movie only managed to generate 60.7 million dollars in revenue. The stellar cast also includes Eusebio Poncela and Charly Bravo, delivering a performance that earned the film an average rating of 6.4. "The Cannibal Man" is a twisted thriller that showcases the dark consequences of one man's deadly actions in Spain.

title = Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man 
overview = It's the lawless future, and renegade biker Harley Davidson (Mickey Rourke) and his surly cowboy buddy, Marlboro (Don Johnson), learn that a corrupt bank is about to foreclose on their friend's bar to further an expanding empire. Harley and Marlboro decide to help by robbing the crooked bank. But when they accidentally filch a drug shipment, they find themselves on the run from criminal financiers and the mob in this rugged action adventure. 
date of release = the 23 of August 1991 
cast = Mickey Rourke, Don Johnson, Chelsea Field, Daniel Baldwin 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 23 of August 1991 

In the lawless future, Harley Davidson, a renegade biker played by Mickey Rourke, and his cowboy buddy Marlboro, portrayed by Don Johnson, discover a corrupt bank's plan to foreclose on their friend's bar. Determined to help, they embark on a daring mission to rob the bank. However, their heist takes an unexpected turn when they inadvertently steal a drug shipment, leading them to become targets of criminal financiers and the mob. Released on the 23rd of August 1991, this rugged action adventure also stars Chelsea Field and Daniel Baldwin.

title = Drifter 
overview = A pair of outlaw brothers seek temporary refuge in a desolate town inhabited by a small family of psychotic cannibalistic lunatics 
production compagnie = Green Star Films 
Director = Chris von Hoffmann 
average note = 6.7 
revenue = 126.1 millions of dollars 
budget = 186.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = Live in fear. 
date of release = the 19 of October 2016 
duration of the movie = 1h26 
Producer = Chris von Hoffmann 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Aria Emory, Drew Harwood, Monique Rosario, James McCabe 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Green Star Films 

In the intense thriller "Drifter," directed by Chris von Hoffmann and produced by Green Star Films, we follow a pair of outlaw brothers portrayed by Aria Emory and Drew Harwood. Seeking temporary refuge, they stumble upon a desolate town inhabited by a small family of psychotic cannibalistic lunatics. As they navigate the eerie town, filled with danger at every turn, they must confront their own demons to survive. With an average rating of 6.7, "Drifter" was released on the 19th of October 2016 in the United States of America. The 1 hour and 26-minute film garnered a revenue of 126.1 million dollars against a budget of 186.0 million dollars. The tagline "Live in fear" perfectly encapsulates the chilling atmosphere of this English-language movie, featuring a talented cast including Monique Rosario and James McCabe. The production company behind the film is Green Star Films, and the producer is also Chris von Hoffmann.

title = The Magician 
overview = A young girl, Margaret Dauncey, is caught between the forces of a charlatan magician, Oliver Haddo, whom she is unable to resist, and the love of a young surgeon, Arthur Burdon, who has saved her from being a helpless cripple by performing a delicate operation on her spine which startled the medical world. 
tagline = THEY FOUGHT FOR A GIRL'S SOUL! 
budget = 190.2 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 273.1 millions of dollars 
cast = Alice Terry, Paul Wegener, Iván Petrovich, Firmin Gémier 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
Director = Rex Ingram 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn Pictures Corporation 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = THEY FOUGHT FOR A GIRL'S SOUL! 

In the mesmerizing film "The Magician," directed by Rex Ingram, we are drawn into a captivating tale set in the United States of America. The story follows the young girl Margaret Dauncey, whose life takes a dramatic turn when she becomes entangled between the enigmatic magician Oliver Haddo and the devoted surgeon Arthur Burdon. As Margaret grapples with her conflicting emotions, a battle ensues for her very soul. With a budget of 190.2 million dollars, this spellbinding production by Metro-Goldwyn Pictures Corporation showcases a stellar cast including Alice Terry, Paul Wegener, Iván Petrovich, and Firmin Gémier. The movie, with a runtime of 1 hour and 23 minutes, grossed an impressive 273.1 million dollars at the box office, leaving audiences spellbound till the very end. Don't miss "The Magician" - where love, magic, and destiny collide in a mesmerizing cinematic experience. And remember, THEY FOUGHT FOR A GIRL'S SOUL!

title = Across the Wide Missouri 
overview = In the 1830's beaver trapper Flint Mitchell and other white men hunt and trap in the then unnamed territories of Montana and Idaho. Flint marries a Blackfoot woman as a way to gain entrance into her people's rich lands, but finds she means more to him than a ticket to good beaver habitat. 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = The big M-G-M Pictures! 
cast = Clark Gable, Ricardo Montalban, John Hodiak, Adolphe Menjou 
revenue = 220.8 millions of dollars 
Director = William A. Wellman 
budget = 25.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h18 
date of release = the 1 of October 1951 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) 
Producer = Robert Sisk 
average note = 4.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the 1830's, beaver trapper Flint Mitchell, portrayed by Clark Gable, leads a group of white men on a hunting and trapping expedition in the uncharted territories of Montana and Idaho. Seeking to gain access to valuable beaver habitat, Flint strategically marries a Blackfoot woman, played by an unknown actress, only to realize that his feelings for her go beyond his initial intentions. Directed by William A. Wellman and produced by Robert Sisk, "Across the Wide Missouri" is a captivating tale of love, betrayal, and the pursuit of wealth in the American wilderness. With a star-studded cast including Ricardo Montalban, John Hodiak, and Adolphe Menjou, this MGM production, released on the 1st of October 1951, grossed an impressive $220.8 million at the box office. The film, with a runtime of 1 hour and 18 minutes, is presented in its original English language, showcasing the rugged beauty of the American frontier. As the tagline proudly declares, "The big M-G-M Pictures!" achieves an average rating of 4.9, solidifying its status as a classic Western film. The production company behind this movie is Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM), and it was filmed in the United States of America.

title = The Lift 
overview = A lift begins displaying some erratic behavior, like trapping some party goers and nearly suffocating them, and decapitating a security guard. Felix, the technician from the lift company, can't find anything wrong with the circuitry. When he and a nosy reporter begin asking questions of the lift company's electronics partner (Rising Sun Electronics) his boss puts him on a leave of absence. A subsequent visit to a professor leads them to believe that some evil experiments are being conducted. 
budget = 0.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
production compagnie = First Floor Features 
Producer = Matthijs van Heijningen 
Director = Dick Maas 
revenue = 155.3 millions of dollars 
cast = Huub Stapel, Willeke van Ammelrooy, Josine van Dalsum, Liz Snoyink 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 0.3 millions of dollars 

In the suspenseful thriller "The Lift," directed by Dick Maas and produced by Matthijs van Heijningen, a seemingly ordinary elevator takes a sinister turn when it starts behaving erratically, causing chaos and danger for unsuspecting passengers. As technician Felix, portrayed by Huub Stapel, investigates the malfunctioning lift, he uncovers a series of disturbing events, including trapping party-goers and even decapitating a security guard. Despite his efforts to find a logical explanation, Felix and a determined reporter, played by Willeke van Ammelrooy, are met with resistance from his superiors at the lift company, First Floor Features. With a budget of 0.3 million dollars, this gripping 1 hour and 35-minute film delves into the dark secrets of Rising Sun Electronics, hinting at sinister experiments and a chilling conspiracy. As the mystery unravels, Felix and his allies, including Josine van Dalsum and Liz Snoyink, must race against time to expose the truth before it's too late. "The Lift" not only captivates audiences with its intense storyline but also impresses at the box office, raking in a revenue of 155.3 million dollars. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']

As technician Felix, portrayed by Huub Stapel, investigates the malfunctioning lift, he uncovers a series of disturbing events, including trapping party-goers and even decapitating a security guard. Despite his efforts to find a logical explanation, Felix and a determined reporter, played by Willeke van Ammelrooy, are met with resistance from his superiors at the lift company, First Floor Features. With a budget of 0.3 million dollars, this gripping 1 hour and 35-minute film delves into the dark secrets of Rising Sun Electronics, hinting at sinister experiments and a chilling conspiracy. As the mystery unravels, Felix and his allies, including Josine van Dalsum and Liz Snoyink, must race against time to expose the truth before it's too late. "The Lift" not only captivates audiences with its intense storyline but also impresses at the box office, raking in a revenue of 155.3 million dollars.

['correct']

In the suspenseful thriller "The Lift," directed by Dick Maas and produced by Matthijs van Heijningen, a seemingly ordinary elevator takes a sinister turn when it starts behaving erratically, causing chaos and danger for unsuspecting passengers. As technician Felix, portrayed by Huub Stapel, investigates the malfunctioning lift, he uncovers a series of disturbing events, including trapping party-goers and even decapitating a security guard. title = Fan 
overview = The story of a fan whose world completely revolves around the movie star he adores. 
budget = 16.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 15 of April 2016 
production compagnie = Red Chillies Entertainment 
revenue = 29.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 16.0 millions of dollars 

In "Fan," released on the 15th of April 2016 by Red Chillies Entertainment, we are taken on a gripping journey into the life of a devoted fan whose entire world is consumed by his adoration for a famous movie star. With a budget of 16.0 million dollars, this film delves into the complexities of obsession and idolization, ultimately leading to unexpected and thrilling consequences. As the fan's infatuation intensifies, the line between reality and fantasy becomes blurred, culminating in a riveting tale that captivates audiences. Despite the financial investment of 16.0 million dollars, "Fan" managed to generate a revenue of 29.3 million dollars, proving to be both a critical and commercial success.

title = Riot on Sunset Strip 
overview = A police captain (Aldo Ray) is caught between businesses operating on the Los Angeles Sunset Strip who don't like the punks hanging out, and his belief in allowing the kids their rights. But when his daughter (Mimsy Farmer) gets involved with an unruly bunch, his attitude starts to change. 
Director = Arthur Dreifuss 
cast = Aldo Ray, Mimsy Farmer, Michael Evans, Laurie Mock 
Producer = Sam Katzman 
budget = 82.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Meet the Hippies...the Teenyboppers with their too-tight capris...and the Pot-Partygoers - out for a new thrill...a new kick! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Arthur Dreifuss 

In "Riot on Sunset Strip," directed by Arthur Dreifuss, a police captain (Aldo Ray) finds himself torn between the businesses on the bustling Los Angeles Sunset Strip and his belief in the rights of the youth who frequent the area. When his daughter (Mimsy Farmer) becomes involved with a rebellious group, his perspective begins to shift. The film, produced by Sam Katzman, delves into the clash between authority figures and the counterculture of the 1960s, all set against the backdrop of a rapidly changing society. With a budget of 82.5 million dollars, this English-language movie features a stellar cast including Michael Evans and Laurie Mock. As tensions rise and conflicts escalate, "Riot on Sunset Strip" explores the complexities of generational divides and the struggle for understanding in a time of social upheaval. Don't miss out on this explosive portrayal of a pivotal moment in history. And remember, as the tagline says, "Meet the Hippies...the Teenyboppers with their too-tight capris...and the Pot-Partygoers - out for a new thrill...a new kick!"

The movie is titled "Riot on Sunset Strip."
The director of the movie is Arthur Dreifuss.
The cast includes Aldo Ray, Mimsy Farmer, Michael Evans, and Laurie Mock.
The producer of the movie is Sam Katzman.
The original language of the movie is English.
The budget for the movie is 82.5 million dollars.
The tagline for the movie is "Meet the Hippies...the Teenyboppers with their too-tight capris...and the Pot-Partygoers - out for a new thrill...a new kick!"

In "Riot on Sunset Strip," directed by Arthur Dreifuss, a police captain (Aldo Ray) finds himself torn between the businesses on the bustling Los Angeles Sunset Strip and his belief in the rights of the youth who frequent the area. When his daughter (Mimsy Farmer) becomes involved with a rebellious group, his perspective begins to shift. The film, produced by Sam Katzman, delves into the clash between authority figures and the counterculture of the 1960s, all set against the backdrop of a rapidly changing society. With a budget of 82.5 million dollars, this English-language movie features a stellar cast including Michael Evans and Laurie Mock. As tensions rise and conflicts escalate, "Riot on Sunset Strip" explores the complexities of generational divides and the struggle for understanding in a time of social upheaval. Don't miss out on this explosive portrayal of a pivotal moment in history. And remember, as the tagline says, "Meet the Hippies...the Teenyboppers with their too-tight capris...and the Pot-Partygoers - out for a new thrill...a new kick!"

In "Ultramarines: A Warhammer 40,000 Movie," directed by Martyn Pick, a squad of Ultramarines, including notable actors Terence Stamp, John Hurt, Sean Pertwee, and Steven Waddington, respond to a distress call from an Imperial Shrine World. The planet was previously occupied by a full Company of Imperial Fists, but communication with them has been lost. The squad embarks on a mission to uncover the mystery behind the silence of the Imperial Fists. With a revenue of 262.2 million dollars, this action-packed sci-fi film delves into the grim and epic universe of Warhammer 40,000, where loyalty, duty, and honor are put to the ultimate test.

title = Scavenger Hunt 
overview = Old Mr. Parker has made millions inventing and selling games. At the beginning of the movie, he dies and his relatives gather for the reading of the will. However, Old Mr. Parker is a game player to the last, and his will stipulates a Scavenger Hunt to determine which relative will get the inheritance. The winner of the scavenger hunt gets all the money, the rest get nothing. 
date of release = the 21 of December 1979 
average note = 5.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 21 of December 1979 

In the classic comedy "Scavenger Hunt," the eccentric millionaire Mr. Parker leaves behind a unique challenge for his relatives upon his death. With millions at stake, the relatives must participate in a high-stakes scavenger hunt to determine who will inherit the fortune. Released on December 21, 1979, this film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats as the competitors race against time and each other to solve clues and emerge victorious. With an average rating of 5.9, "Scavenger Hunt" is a thrilling and entertaining ride from start to finish.

title = Dinner with Friends 
overview = A husband and wife reevaluate their marriage after their closest friends, another couple decide to split up after twelve years. 
Director = Norman Jewison 
cast = Dennis Quaid, Andie MacDowell, Toni Collette, Greg Kinnear 
average note = 5.2 
production compagnie = Nina Saxon Film Design 
Producer = Laura Ziskin 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
date of release = the 1 of January 2001 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 3.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Norman Jewison 

In "Dinner with Friends," directed by Norman Jewison, audiences are taken on an emotional journey as a husband and wife, portrayed by Dennis Quaid and Andie MacDowell, find themselves reevaluating their own marriage in the wake of their closest friends' decision to split up after twelve years. The stellar cast also includes Toni Collette and Greg Kinnear, who deliver powerful performances that delve into the complexities of relationships. Produced by Laura Ziskin under the Nina Saxon Film Design production company, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 34 minutes, captivating viewers with its raw and honest portrayal of love and friendship. Released on January 1, 2001, in the United States of America, "Dinner with Friends" garnered an average rating of 5.2 and grossed $3.8 million in revenue.

In the heartwarming drama "Marvin's Room," a leukemia patient, portrayed by Diane Keaton, embarks on a poignant journey to reconcile with her estranged sister, played by Meryl Streep, in hopes of receiving a life-saving bone marrow transplant. With an all-star cast including Leonardo DiCaprio and Robert De Niro, this emotional tale unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 38 minutes, courtesy of Miramax Films. Garnering an average note of 6.6, the film beautifully captures the essence of family bonds and the power of forgiveness, encapsulated by the tagline: "A story about the years that keep us apart... And the moments that bring us together."

In "The Blue Gardenia," directed by Fritz Lang, Norah Larkin, portrayed by Anne Baxter, finds herself in a nightmare scenario after a night of drinking with womanizer Harry Prebble. Waking up in his apartment, she is shocked to discover she is accused of his murder. With a stellar cast including Richard Conte, Ann Sothern, and Raymond Burr, this English-language film takes viewers on a gripping journey as Norah navigates the aftermath of the mysterious events. As the plot unfolds, Norah's character is put to the test, leading to a thrilling conclusion that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats. With a production company like Blue Gardenia Productions behind it, this suspenseful film grossed an impressive $80.6 million at the box office, despite having a budget of $109.3 million. The average rating of 6.2 reflects the captivating storytelling and stellar performances that make "The Blue Gardenia" a must-watch for fans of mystery and drama.

As the plot unfolds, Norah's character is put to the test, leading to a thrilling conclusion that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats. With a production company like Blue Gardenia Productions behind it, this suspenseful film grossed an impressive $80.6 million at the box office, despite having a budget of $109.3 million. The average rating of 6.2 reflects the captivating storytelling and stellar performances that make "The Blue Gardenia" a must-watch for fans of mystery and drama.

In "Beautiful Boy," directed by Shawn Ku and produced by First Point Entertainment, a married couple, portrayed by Michael Sheen and Maria Bello, are faced with unimaginable tragedy when they learn that their 18-year-old son committed a mass shooting at his college before taking his own life. As they grapple with this devastating news, they must also confront the cracks in their own relationship. With a talented cast including Alan Tudyk and Moon Bloodgood, this emotionally charged film delves into the complexities of grief, guilt, and ultimately, the power of facing the truth. The tagline "To confront the truth, first they had to face each other" encapsulates the heart-wrenching journey this family must endure. Despite its critical acclaim with an average rating of 6.1, "Beautiful Boy" struggled at the box office, earning only 0.1 million dollars in revenue against a budget of 38.8 million dollars. Set in the United States of America and spoken in English, this 1 hour and 40-minute film was released on September 12, 2010, leaving a lasting impact on audiences with its raw and poignant storytelling. The producer of the film is Lee Clay.

title = Jagged Edge 
overview = San Francisco heiress Page Forrester is brutally murdered in her remote beach house. Her husband Jack is devastated by the crime but soon finds himself accused of her murder. He hires lawyer Teddy Barnes to defend him, despite the fact she hasn't handled a criminal case for many years. There's a certain chemistry between them and Teddy soon finds herself defending the man she loves. 
Director = Richard Marquand 
date of release = the 4 of October 1985 
average note = 6.5 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Glenn Close, Jeff Bridges, Peter Coyote, Lance Henriksen 
tagline = When a murder case is this shocking, which do you trust... your emotions or the evidence? 
duration of the movie = 1h48 
Producer = Martin Ransohoff 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Richard Marquand 

In the gripping thriller "Jagged Edge," directed by Richard Marquand and released on the 4th of October 1985 by Columbia Pictures, San Francisco heiress Page Forrester is tragically murdered in her secluded beach house. Her devastated husband Jack, portrayed by Jeff Bridges, becomes the prime suspect in her brutal killing. Seeking justice, Jack enlists the help of lawyer Teddy Barnes, played by Glenn Close, despite her lack of recent experience in criminal cases. As Teddy delves into the case, a complex web of emotions and evidence unfolds, blurring the lines between love and legal duty. With a stellar cast including Peter Coyote and Lance Henriksen, this suspenseful drama keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 48-minute runtime. The tagline "When a murder case is this shocking, which do you trust... your emotions or the evidence?" encapsulates the heart-pounding tension of this $15.0 million production from the United States of America, earning an average rating of 6.5. The producer of the film is Martin Ransohoff.

With a stellar cast including Peter Coyote and Lance Henriksen, this suspenseful drama keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 48-minute runtime. The tagline "When a murder case is this shocking, which do you trust... your emotions or the evidence?" encapsulates the heart-pounding tension of this $15.0 million production from the United States of America, earning an average rating of 6.5. The producer of the film is Martin Ransohoff. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the gripping thriller "Jagged Edge," directed by Richard Marquand and released on the 4th of October 1985 by Columbia Pictures, San Francisco heiress Page Forrester is tragically murdered in her secluded beach house. Her devastated husband Jack, portrayed by Jeff Bridges, becomes the prime suspect in her brutal killing. Seeking justice, Jack enlists the help of lawyer Teddy Barnes, played by Glenn Close, despite her lack of recent experience in criminal cases. As Teddy delves into the case, a complex web of emotions and evidence unfolds, blurring the lines between love and legal duty. With a stellar cast including Peter Coyote and Lance Henriksen, this suspenseful drama keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 48-minute runtime. The tagline "When a murder case is this shocking, which do you trust... your emotions or the evidence?" encapsulates the heart-pounding tension of this $15.0 million production from the United States of America, earning an average rating of 6.5. The producer of the film is Martin Ransohoff. 
 
 

 
title = Body Shots 
overview = The Los Angeles club scene is a place of booze-fueled decadence and debauchery. In a night full of possibilities, eight 20-somethings take to the clubs seeking good times, companionship and maybe a little sex. But in the harsh light of the morning after, their worlds are thrown into a spin of confusion when hungover Sara accuses hard-partying Mike of date rape. Loyalties are tested as each among them is forced to take sides. 
average note = 4.7 
tagline = Tonight it's for sex. Tomorrow it's for real. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 4.7 

In the pulsating nightlife of Los Angeles, where booze flows freely and inhibitions are left at the door, "Body Shots" follows the intertwined lives of eight 20-somethings as they navigate a night of endless possibilities. Seeking fun, connection, and perhaps a hint of romance, they dive headfirst into the club scene, only to find themselves entangled in a web of blurred lines and shifting allegiances. When the morning light reveals a shocking accusation of date rape by hungover Sara against party animal Mike, the group is thrust into a whirlwind of uncertainty and moral dilemmas. As loyalties are tested and truths are uncovered, each individual must choose a side in a gripping tale of consequences. With an average note of 4.7, "Body Shots" delves into the raw realities of modern relationships and the aftermath of a night where desires collide with harsh realities. As the tagline suggests, tonight may be for sex, but tomorrow brings the reckoning of reality.

Facts included in the final description:

- The tagline is "Tonight it's for sex. Tomorrow it's for real."

title = The Killer 
overview = Mob assassin Jeffrey is no ordinary hired gun; the best in his business, he views his chosen profession as a calling rather than simply a job. So, when beautiful nightclub chanteuse Jennie is blinded in the crossfire of his most recent hit, Jeffrey chooses to retire after one last job to pay for his unintended victim's sight-restoring operation. But when Jeffrey is double-crossed, he reluctantly joins forces with a rogue policeman to make things right. 
budget = 11.6 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Film Workshop 
production countrie = Hong Kong 
average note = 7.6 
Producer = Tsui Hark 
revenue = 62.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 11.6 millions of dollars 

In the action-packed thriller "The Killer," produced by Tsui Hark and set in Hong Kong, we follow the story of Jeffrey, a skilled mob assassin who sees his work as more than just a job. When a hit gone wrong leaves nightclub singer Jennie blind, Jeffrey decides to retire after one final job to fund her sight-restoring surgery. However, things take a dangerous turn when he is betrayed, leading him to team up with a renegade cop to seek justice. With a budget of 11.6 million dollars, the film was produced by Film Workshop and went on to earn an impressive 62.0 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average rating of 7.6.

title = The Big Sick 
overview = Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner fall in love but struggle as their cultures clash. When Emily contracts a mysterious illness, Kumail finds himself forced to face her feisty parents, his family's expectations, and his true feelings. 
Producer = Barry Mendel 
duration of the movie = 2h00 
tagline = An awkward true story. 
revenue = 52.6 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.7 
cast = Kumail Nanjiani, Zoe Kazan, Holly Hunter, Ray Romano 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Michael Showalter 
date of release = the 23 of June 2017 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Barry Mendel 

In "The Big Sick," a heartwarming romantic comedy directed by Michael Showalter and produced by Barry Mendel, Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner navigate the complexities of their intercultural relationship. When Emily falls ill with a mysterious illness, Kumail must confront not only her parents but also his own family's expectations, all while coming to terms with his true emotions. With a tagline that promises "An awkward true story," this film delves into themes of love, family, and identity. Starring Kumail Nanjiani, Zoe Kazan, Holly Hunter, and Ray Romano, this 2-hour movie in English takes viewers on a journey of laughter, tears, and self-discovery. Released on the 23rd of June 2017 in the United States of America, "The Big Sick" garnered a revenue of 52.6 million dollars and an average rating of 7.7, making it a must-watch for those who enjoy heartfelt and authentic storytelling. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h00 

In "The Big Sick," a heartwarming romantic comedy directed by Michael Showalter and produced by Barry Mendel, Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner navigate the complexities of their intercultural relationship. When Emily falls ill with a mysterious illness, Kumail must confront not only her parents but also his own family's expectations, all while coming to terms with his true emotions. With a tagline that promises "An awkward true story," this film delves into themes of love, family, and identity. Starring Kumail Nanjiani, Zoe Kazan, Holly Hunter, and Ray Romano, this 2-hour movie in English takes viewers on a journey of laughter, tears, and self-discovery. Released on the 23rd of June 2017 in the United States of America, "The Big Sick" garnered a revenue of 52.6 million dollars and an average rating of 7.7, making it a must-watch for those who enjoy heartfelt and authentic storytelling.

title = Tinker Bell and the Lost Treasure 
overview = A blue harvest moon will rise, allowing the fairies to use a precious moonstone to restore the Pixie Dust Tree, the source of all their magic. But when Tinker Bell accidentally puts all of Pixie Hollow in jeopardy, she must venture out across the sea on a secret quest to set things right. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 6.4 

In "Tinker Bell and the Lost Treasure," a blue harvest moon is set to rise, giving the fairies the opportunity to utilize a valuable moonstone to revitalize the Pixie Dust Tree, the very essence of their magical abilities. However, when Tinker Bell mistakenly endangers all of Pixie Hollow, she embarks on a daring journey across the sea on a covert mission to correct her mistake. The movie features Tinker Bell as the main character and showcases her determination and bravery as she faces challenges to save Pixie Hollow. Additionally, Tinker Bell is joined by her friends, including Terence, a dust-keeper fairy, who supports her throughout the adventure. The film highlights themes of friendship, courage, and the importance of taking responsibility for one's actions.

['wrong']

title = Rogue River 
overview = When a young woman takes a trip down Rogue River, her car mysteriously disappears. Lost without transport or communication, she accepts the hospitality of a stranger who offers her shelter for the night at his cabin. With no other options available, she reluctantly accepts only to forever regret it. The ensuing hours yield nothing but torture, indescribable pain, and horrific agony. If you've seen Misery, you've seen nothing. This movie starts where horror films end and leaves viewers paralysed by fear and disgust. 
revenue = 191.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Vision Entertainment Group 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 191.4 millions of dollars 

In "Rogue River," a young woman's leisurely trip down Rogue River takes a terrifying turn when her car vanishes without a trace. Stranded and alone, she seeks refuge with a stranger at his remote cabin. What starts as a seemingly kind gesture quickly descends into a nightmare of unimaginable torment and unspeakable horror. With a revenue of 191.4 million dollars, a production company of Vision Entertainment Group, and a budget of 2.0 million dollars, this chilling tale by Vision Entertainment Group pushes the boundaries of fear, surpassing even the intensity of "Misery." Brace yourself as "Rogue River" plunges viewers into a realm of terror that will leave them paralyzed with fear and revulsion.

title = Neighbours 
overview = This film, shot in pixilation (a kind of stop-motion animation with actors), is about two neighbours who come to barbaric blows over a flower that straddles the property line. 
Director = Norman McLaren 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Norman McLaren 

In the visually captivating film "Neighbours," directed by Norman McLaren, the story unfolds through the unique technique of pixilation, creating a mesmerizing stop-motion animation with real actors. The plot revolves around two neighbors whose seemingly peaceful coexistence is shattered when a simple flower straddling the property line sparks a fierce and barbaric conflict between them. As tensions escalate, the once harmonious neighborhood descends into chaos, showcasing the destructive power of pride and possession. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : date of release = the 1 of January 1952 

In the visually captivating film "Neighbours," directed by Norman McLaren, the story unfolds through the unique technique of pixilation, creating a mesmerizing stop-motion animation with real actors. The plot revolves around two neighbors whose seemingly peaceful coexistence is shattered when a simple flower straddling the property line sparks a fierce and barbaric conflict between them. As tensions escalate, the once harmonious neighborhood descends into chaos, showcasing the destructive power of pride and possession.

In the visually captivating film "Neighbours," directed by Norman McLaren, the story unfolds through the unique technique of pixilation, creating a mesmerizing stop-motion animation with real actors. The plot revolves around two neighbors whose seemingly peaceful coexistence is shattered when a simple flower straddling the property line sparks a fierce and barbaric conflict between them. As tensions escalate, the once harmonious neighborhood descends into chaos, showcasing the destructive power of pride and possession.

title = Pom Poko 
overview = The Raccoons of the Tama Hills are being forced from their homes by the rapid development of houses and shopping malls. As it becomes harder to find food and shelter, they decide to band together and fight back. The Raccoons practice and perfect the ancient art of transformation until they are even able to appear as humans in hilarious circumstances. 
date of release = the 16 of July 1994 
cast = Shinchou Kokontei, Makoto Nonomura, Nijiko Kiyokawa, Shigeru Izumiya 
production compagnie = Studio Ghibli 
original language of the movie = Japanese 
Director = Isao Takahata 
Producer = Toshio Suzuki 
duration of the movie = 1h59 
production countrie = Japan 
budget = 6.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.2 
revenue = 212.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 16 of July 1994 

The Raccoons of the Tama Hills, led by their determination, unite to resist the encroaching forces threatening their homes in the enchanting world of "Pom Poko." Faced with the challenge of survival due to rapid development, they band together to fight back. In their struggle, they delve into the ancient art of transformation, mastering the ability to shape-shift, even taking on human forms in hilarious circumstances. Directed by Isao Takahata and produced by Studio Ghibli, this Japanese animated film was released on the 16th of July 1994. The stellar voice cast includes Shinchou Kokontei, Makoto Nonomura, Nijiko Kiyokawa, and Shigeru Izumiya. With a budget of 6.5 million dollars, "Pom Poko" went on to earn a remarkable revenue of 212.9 million dollars, captivating audiences worldwide. This visually stunning movie, with an average rating of 7.2, showcases the power of unity and the resilience of nature in the face of modernization.

title = The Seven-Per-Cent Solution 
overview = Concerned about his friend's cocaine use, Dr. Watson tricks Sherlock Holmes into travelling to Vienna, where Holmes enters the care of Sigmund Freud. Freud attemts to solve the mysteries of Holmes' subconscious, while Holmes devotes himself to solving a mystery involving the kidnapping of Lola Deveraux. 
Director = Herbert Ross 
average note = 7.1 
revenue = 32.9 millions of dollars 
budget = 38.5 millions of dollars 
tagline = Confounding! Sherlock Holmes meets Sigmund Freud 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
date of release = the 24 of October 1976 
cast = Alan Arkin, Vanessa Redgrave, Robert Duvall, Nicol Williamson 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Herbert Ross 

In "The Seven-Per-Cent Solution," directed by Herbert Ross, Sherlock Holmes finds himself in Vienna under the care of Sigmund Freud, played by Alan Arkin, as Dr. Watson becomes concerned about Holmes' cocaine use. As Freud delves into Holmes' subconscious, the detective becomes entangled in solving the mystery of Lola Deveraux's kidnapping, portrayed by Vanessa Redgrave. With a tagline that promises a confounding encounter between Holmes and Freud, this United Kingdom production by Universal Pictures captivates audiences with its intriguing premise. Despite an average note of 7.1, the film grossed 32.9 million dollars at the box office, falling slightly short of its 38.5 million dollar budget. Released on October 24, 1976, the stellar cast also includes Robert Duvall and Nicol Williamson.

title = The Deceivers 
overview = India, 1825: the country lives in mortal fear of cult members known as the “Deceivers." They commit robbery and ritualistic murder. Appalled by their activities, an English military man, Captain William Savage, conceives a hazardous plot to stop them. In disguise, he plans to himself become a “Deceiver” and infiltrate their numbers. Ever present in Savage’s adventures is a sense of dread; he is in constant fear of betrayal and vengeance and also undergoes a disturbing psychological transformation as he experiences the cult’s blood lust firsthand. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Tim Van Rellim 

In the thrilling movie "The Deceivers," set in India in 1825, the country is terrorized by a group of cult members known as the "Deceivers." Captain William Savage, an English military man, is determined to put an end to their heinous crimes. In a risky move, Savage decides to go undercover as a "Deceiver" to infiltrate their ranks and bring them down from within. As he delves deeper into the cult's dark world, Savage is consumed by fear of betrayal and revenge, leading to a harrowing psychological transformation. The sense of dread is palpable as Savage navigates through a world of robbery, ritualistic murder, and blood lust, making "The Deceivers" a gripping tale of deception and danger. 

Facts included in the final description:
- The movie is set in India in 1825.
- The country is terrorized by a group of cult members known as the "Deceivers."
- Captain William Savage, an English military man, decides to go undercover as a "Deceiver" to infiltrate their ranks.
- Savage is consumed by fear of betrayal and revenge.
- The movie involves robbery, ritualistic murder, and blood lust.

In the thrilling movie "The Deceivers," set in India in 1825, the country is terrorized by a group of cult members known as the "Deceivers." Captain William Savage, an English military man, is determined to put an end to their heinous crimes. In a risky move, Savage decides to go undercover as a "Deceiver" to infiltrate their ranks and bring them down from within. As he delves deeper into the cult's dark world, Savage is consumed by fear of betrayal and revenge, leading to a harrowing psychological transformation. The sense of dread is palpable as Savage navigates through a world of robbery, ritualistic murder, and blood lust, making "The Deceivers" a gripping tale of deception and danger. 

Facts included in the final description:
- The movie is set in India in 1825.
- The country is terrorized by a group of cult members known as the "Deceivers."
- Captain William Savage, an English military man, decides to go undercover as a "Deceiver" to infiltrate their ranks.
- Savage is consumed by fear of betrayal and revenge.
- The movie involves robbery, ritualistic murder, and blood lust.

title = House of Horrors 
overview = An unsuccessful sculptor saves a madman named "The Creeper" from drowning. Seeing an opportunity for revenge, he tricks the psycho into murdering his critics. 
budget = 260.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Ben Pivar 
cast = Rondo Hatton, Robert Lowery, Virginia Grey, Bill Goodwin 
average note = 6.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 260.9 millions of dollars 

In "House of Horrors," produced by Ben Pivar, an unsuccessful sculptor finds himself entangled in a twisted game of revenge after saving a madman named "The Creeper" from drowning. With a budget of 260.9 million dollars, the sculptor manipulates the psycho into carrying out his sinister plan of murdering his critics. Starring Rondo Hatton, Robert Lowery, Virginia Grey, and Bill Goodwin, this suspenseful thriller keeps viewers on the edge of their seats with an average rating of 6.3.

title = Carmen 
overview = In order to help her smuggler kinsmen, a sultry gypsy seduces and corrupts an officer of the Civil Guard turning him into a traitor and murderer. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 0h59 

In the thrilling movie "Carmen," a sultry gypsy uses her seductive charms to manipulate an officer of the Civil Guard, turning him into a traitor and murderer. As she becomes entangled in a dangerous world of smuggling, Carmen must navigate treacherous waters to help her kinsmen. Will her cunning ways lead to success, or will she ultimately pay the price for her deceitful actions? 

Facts included in the description:
- Title: Carmen
- Overview: In order to help her smuggler kinsmen, a sultry gypsy seduces and corrupts an officer of the Civil Guard turning him into a traitor and murderer.

title = The Glass Web 
overview = The ice-cold diva Paula ruthlessly exploits the guys she dates. While blackmailing the married Don with a recent one-night-stand, she has a secret affair with Henry, who works as researcher for the weekly authentic TV show "Crime of the Week", which Don writes for. When Henry fails to help her to a role, she insults him deadly... and ends up dead herself. Now Don desperately tries to hide his traces, but Henry sabotages his efforts and suggests he write the unsolved murder case for next week's show... 
average note = 6.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.2 

In "The Glass Web," the chilling tale unfolds as the manipulative Paula uses her charm to control the men in her life. Blackmailing a married man named Don while carrying on a secret affair with Henry, a researcher for a crime TV show. When Paula's manipulative ways catch up to her, she meets a deadly fate. As Don tries to cover up the murder, Henry sabotages his efforts, leading to a thrilling game of cat and mouse. With an average note of 6.2, this suspenseful film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end.

With an average note of 6.2, this suspenseful film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = Leningrad 
overview = When in 1941 Nazi Germany invaded the Soviet Union, their troops quickly besieged Leningrad. Foreign journalists are evacuated but one of them, Kate Davies, is presumed dead and misses the plane. Alone in the city she is helped by Nina Tsvetnova a young and idealist police officer and together they will fight for their own survival and the survival of the people in the besieged Leningrad. Written by Marcio Eduardo 
tagline = Some fight. Others fall. All are heroes. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Some fight. Others fall. All are heroes. 

In the gripping war drama "Leningrad," set in 1941 during the Nazi invasion of the Soviet Union, the city of Leningrad becomes a battleground for survival. When foreign journalists are evacuated, Kate Davies, presumed dead, finds herself stranded in the besieged city. Alone in the city, she is helped by Nina Tsvetnova, a young and idealistic police officer. Together, they embark on a harrowing journey to not only survive themselves but also to protect the people of Leningrad. As the city faces unimaginable challenges, some will fight, some will fall, but all will be remembered as heroes. Written by Marcio Eduardo, "Leningrad" is a testament to the indomitable human spirit in the face of adversity. With a tagline that encapsulates the spirit of resilience and courage, "Leningrad" portrays the bravery and sacrifices made during the siege of Leningrad in World War II.

title = The Beguiled 
overview = During the Civil War, at a Southern girls’ boarding school, young women take in an injured enemy soldier. As they provide refuge and tend to his wounds, the house is taken over with sexual tension and dangerous rivalries, and taboos are broken in an unexpected turn of events. 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
budget = 10.5 millions of dollars 
cast = Colin Farrell, Nicole Kidman, Kirsten Dunst, Elle Fanning 
tagline = Innocent, until betrayed. 
average note = 5.8 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Sofia Coppola 
date of release = the 23 of June 2017 
production compagnie = American Zoetrope 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Sofia Coppola 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h33 

In "The Beguiled," directed by Sofia Coppola, the Civil War sets the stage for a gripping tale at a Southern girls’ boarding school. When a wounded enemy soldier, played by Colin Farrell, seeks refuge, the young women, including Nicole Kidman, Kirsten Dunst, and Elle Fanning, find themselves entangled in a web of sexual tension and dangerous rivalries. As taboos are shattered, innocence is quickly replaced by betrayal in this unexpected turn of events. With a budget of 10.5 million dollars, this 1 hour and 33-minute film captivates audiences with its English dialogue and a tagline that reads, "Innocent, until betrayed." Released on June 23, 2017, by American Zoetrope in the United States of America, "The Beguiled" received an average rating of 5.8, making it a must-watch for those intrigued by historical dramas with a twist. The film was produced by Sofia Coppola.

title = S.W.A.T. 
overview = Hondo Harrelson recruits Jim Street to join an elite unit of the Los Angeles Police Department. Together they seek out more members, including tough Deke Kay and single mom Chris Sanchez. The team's first big assignment is to escort crime boss Alex Montel to prison. It seems routine, but when Montel offers a huge reward to anyone who can break him free, criminals of various stripes step up for the prize. 
tagline = You're either S.W.A.T. or you're not. 
cast = Samuel L. Jackson, Colin Farrell, Michelle Rodriguez, LL Cool J 
revenue = 116.6 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Original Film 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = You're either S.W.A.T. or you're not. 

In the action-packed movie "S.W.A.T.," Hondo Harrelson, played by Samuel L. Jackson, handpicks a team of elite officers from the Los Angeles Police Department, including the skilled Jim Street, tough Deke Kay, and single mom Chris Sanchez, portrayed by Colin Farrell, LL Cool J, and Michelle Rodriguez respectively. Their first mission is seemingly straightforward - escorting crime boss Alex Montel to prison. However, things take a dangerous turn when Montel offers a hefty reward for his rescue, attracting a slew of criminals vying for the prize. As tensions rise and loyalties are tested, the team must navigate a treacherous landscape to uphold justice. With a tagline like "You're either S.W.A.T. or you're not," this high-octane film, produced by Original Film, raked in a whopping $116.6 million at the box office.

['correct']

Jackson, handpicks a team of elite officers from the Los Angeles Police Department, including the skilled Jim Street, tough Deke Kay, and single mom Chris Sanchez, portrayed by Colin Farrell, LL Cool J, and Michelle Rodriguez respectively. Their first mission is seemingly straightforward - escorting crime boss Alex Montel to prison. However, things take a dangerous turn when Montel offers a hefty reward for his rescue, attracting a slew of criminals vying for the prize. As tensions rise and loyalties are tested, the team must navigate a treacherous landscape to uphold justice. With a tagline like "You're either S.W.A.T. or you're not," this high-octane film, produced by Original Film, raked in a whopping $116.6 million at the box office.

title = Jay And Silent Bob's Super Groovy Cartoon Movie 
overview = When they can no longer stomach the ever-growing weed of suburban crime, Jay and Silent Bob take on the mantles of costumed avengers Bluntman and Chronic, smashing the super-villains they accidentally create!  Can the Doobage Duo save their beloved Jersey 'burbs from their new arch enemies, The League of Shitters?  While clearly not the comic book movie the world wants, GROOVY MOVIE is the comic book movie the world needs! 
production compagnie = Phase 4 Films 
average note = 4.9 
revenue = 37.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 20 of April 2013 
duration of the movie = 1h03

fact : production compagnie = Phase 4 Films 

In "Jay And Silent Bob's Super Groovy Cartoon Movie," best friends Jay and Silent Bob transform into the crime-fighting duo Bluntman and Chronic to combat the rise of suburban crime in their beloved Jersey 'burbs. As they battle the super-villains they unintentionally unleash, including their new foes, The League of Shitters, the Doobage Duo must save the day in this unconventional comic book movie. Produced by Phase 4 Films and released in the United States on the 20th of April 2013, this 1 hour and 3 minutes film garnered an average rating of 4.9 and grossed an impressive $37.7 million at the box office. average note = 4.8 
revenue = 138.8 millions of dollars 
Producer = Jimmy Miller 
cast = Alexandra Breckenridge, Doug Jones, Jake McDorman, Alexandra Holden 
budget = 7.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h31 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 4.8 

In "Always Watching: A Marble Hornets Story", a group of student filmmakers embarks on the creation of "Project Marble Hornets", only to have their production disrupted by a series of chilling paranormal events. As tension mounts and shocks abound, the horror unfolds in this gripping tale. With a stellar cast including Alexandra Breckenridge, Doug Jones, Jake McDorman, and Alexandra Holden, the movie runs for 1 hour and 31 minutes, delivering a spine-tingling experience. Produced by Jimmy Miller, the film garnered an impressive revenue of 138.8 million dollars, surpassing its budget of 7.1 million dollars. With an average rating of 4.8, this horror flick is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat.

title = Stranded 
overview = The Lunar Base Ark explores ore and unexpectedly is hit by a meteor shower and has severe damages. Colonel Gerard Brauchman sends the crewwoman Ava Cameron to repair a wing that is full of CO2. Dr. Lance Krauss warns that the gas may cause paranoia and hallucinations. Ava brings a sample of the meteor for analysis and Dr. Krauss finds that there are spores attached to the meteor. Ava accidentally cuts her finger in a sample but she hides the cut from the doctor. Soon Ava gets pregnant and delivers an alien offspring. However, neither Col. Brauchman nor Dr. Kraus believes in her words and they believe that Ava is delusional. He offspring bites the crewman Bruce Johns and the crew discovers that Bruce has been cloned by the alien. Soon they find how dangerous the clone is. 
production countrie = Canada 
Producer = Mark Montague 
cast = Christian Slater, Brendan Fehr, Amy Matysio, Michael Therriault 
average note = 3.4 
Director = Roger Christian 
date of release = the 22 of May 2013 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Canada 

In the Canadian sci-fi thriller "Stranded," the Lunar Base Ark faces a catastrophic event when it is struck by a meteor shower, causing severe damage. Colonel Gerard Brauchman leads the crew, including crewwoman Ava Cameron, who is tasked with repairing a wing filled with CO2. As Dr. Lance Krauss warns of the gas's potential side effects of paranoia and hallucinations, Ava discovers mysterious spores on the meteor. When Ava becomes pregnant and gives birth to an alien offspring, she struggles to convince her skeptical colleagues of the impending danger. With a stellar cast including Christian Slater, Brendan Fehr, Amy Matysio, and Michael Therriault, "Stranded" delves into the terrifying consequences of alien encounters. Directed by Roger Christian and produced by Mark Montague, the film was released on May 22, 2013, in Canada. This gripping tale of survival and deception keeps viewers on the edge of their seats, earning an average rating of 3.4.

overview = A man named Farmer sets out to rescue his kidnapped wife and avenge the death of his son -- two acts committed by the Krugs, a race of animal-warriors who are controlled by the evil Gallian. 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Rise and fight 
production countrie = Canada 
Director = Uwe Boll 
revenue = 154.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 4.1 
date of release = the 29 of November 2007 
cast = Jason Statham, John Rhys-Davies, Ray Liotta, Leelee Sobieski 
Producer = Brandon Baker 
duration of the movie = 2h07 
production compagnie = Boll Kino Beteiligungs GmbH & Co. KG 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale is an English-language movie directed by Uwe Boll. The film follows a man named Farmer, portrayed by Jason Statham, on a quest to rescue his kidnapped wife and avenge the death of his son at the hands of the Krugs, a race of animal-warriors controlled by the evil Gallian. With a tagline urging viewers to "Rise and fight," this Canadian production, released on the 29th of November 2007, features a star-studded cast including John Rhys-Davies, Ray Liotta, and Leelee Sobieski. Produced by Brandon Baker, the movie garnered a revenue of 154.8 million dollars and holds an average rating of 4.1. Running for 2 hours and 7 minutes, this epic tale is brought to life by the production company Boll Kino Beteiligungs GmbH & Co. KG.

overview = 5 people trapped in a bunker after a nuclear and biological attack are forced to make an impossible decision - either one dies or they all die. 
production compagnie = 54 Days Productions

production countrie = Australia 
average note = 0.0 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Dianna La Grassa, Stephanie May, Matt James, Michela Carattini 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = 54 Days Productions 

In the intense thriller "54 Days," directed by Tim Lea and produced by 54 Days Productions, five individuals find themselves in a harrowing situation. After a devastating nuclear and biological attack, they are trapped in a bunker with no way out. As they struggle to survive, they are faced with an impossible decision - sacrifice one person to save the rest, or all perish together. Starring Dianna La Grassa, Stephanie May, Matt James, and Michela Carattini, this gripping tale unfolds in Australia, where the tension rises as the group grapples with their fate. With an average rating of 0.0, this English-language film will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end. The production company behind this film is 54 Days Productions.

After a devastating nuclear and biological attack, they are trapped in a bunker with no way out. As they struggle to survive, they are faced with an impossible decision - sacrifice one person to save the rest, or all perish together. Starring Dianna La Grassa, Stephanie May, Matt James, and Michela Carattini, this gripping tale unfolds in Australia, where the tension rises as the group grapples with their fate. With an average rating of 0.0, this English-language film will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end. The production company behind this film is 54 Days Productions.

title = A Cry in the Dark 
overview = Based on the true story of Lindy Chamberlain: During a camping trip to Ayers Rock in outback Australia, she claims she witnessed a dingo taking her baby daughter, Azaria, from the family tent. Azaria's body is never found. After investigations and two public inquests, she is charged with murder. The case attracts a lot of attention, turning it into a media sideshow. 
duration of the movie = 2h00 
date of release = the 11 of November 1988 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Verity Lambert 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = A family torn apart. A public filled with outrage. A woman accused of murder. 
cast = Meryl Streep, Sam Neill, Dale Reeves, David Hoflin 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h00 

In the gripping drama "A Cry in the Dark," based on a true story, Lindy Chamberlain finds herself at the center of a tragic mystery during a camping trip to Ayers Rock in outback Australia. Claiming to have seen a dingo snatch her baby daughter, Azaria, from their tent, Lindy's world is shattered when the child's body is never recovered. As the case unfolds through investigations and public inquests, Lindy is shockingly charged with murder, sparking a media frenzy and turning her ordeal into a spectacle. With a stellar cast including Meryl Streep and Sam Neill, this Warner Bros. production, produced by Verity Lambert, delves into the heart-wrenching tale that captivated the world. "A Cry in the Dark" runs for 2 hours and is presented in its original language, English. Released on November 11, 1988, with a budget of $15.0 million, this film is a haunting portrayal of a family torn apart, a public consumed by outrage, and a woman unjustly accused of a heinous crime. Don't miss this powerful and unforgettable cinematic experience.

title = 9th Company 
overview = The picture opens in Krasnoyarsk, Siberia, in late 1988, when military trainees Petrovsky, Ryaba, Chugun, Stas, Pinochet, Lyutev and Vorobyev are whipped into shape at a training camp by the brutal, sadistic commander, Warrant Officer Dygalo - prior to being sent off to the front lines. After several one-by-one dalliances with the local whore, Snow White, and a cautionary lecture on the history, geography and culture of Afghanistan (which most of the men sleep through), the trainees head off to battle - first to the Bagram air base, then to the Afghani province of Khost to secure supply lines. But nothing can begin to prepare them for the brutal devastation into which they are plunged, or the relentless tide of slaughter that scatters thousands of Soviet victims in its wake. 
production compagnie = Finnish Film Foundation 
budget = 9.5 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 19 of September 2005 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : production compagnie = Finnish Film Foundation 

In the gripping war drama "9th Company," set in late 1988 Siberia, a group of military trainees including Petrovsky, Ryaba, Chugun, Stas, Pinochet, Lyutev, and Vorobyev are subjected to intense training by the sadistic commander, Warrant Officer Dygalo. As they are sent to the front lines in Afghanistan, they experience the harsh realities of war and the brutal devastation it brings. Amidst battles and struggles to secure supply lines, the soldiers face the relentless tide of slaughter that marks their journey. The film opens in Krasnoyarsk, Siberia, where the trainees are whipped into shape at a training camp before deployment. They also have encounters with the local prostitute, Snow White, and receive a lecture on the history, geography, and culture of Afghanistan. Directed by the Finnish Film Foundation, this film, released on September 19, 2005, delves into the horrors of war with a budget of 9.5 million dollars.

title = Choke 
overview = A sex-addicted con-man pays for his mother's hospital bills by playing on the sympathies of those who rescue him from choking to death. 
average note = 6.0 
tagline = From the author of Fight Club 
budget = 3.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Fox Searchlight Pictures 
Director = Clark Gregg 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.0 

From the author of Fight Club comes "Choke," a gripping tale of a sex-addicted con-man who resorts to a unique method to pay for his mother's hospital bills. Directed by Clark Gregg and produced by Fox Searchlight Pictures, this film follows the protagonist as he manipulates the sympathies of his rescuers after choking incidents. With a budget of 3.0 million dollars, "Choke" delves into the dark and complex world of addiction and deception, earning an average note of 6.0. Get ready for a twisted journey where survival and manipulation intertwine in unexpected ways.

title = Splinter 
overview = When their plans for a nature trip go awry, Polly and boyfriend Seth decide to check into a motel. On their way, they're carjacked and kidnapped by low-rent crooks Dennis and Lacey, who take the victims and their SUV to a nearby gas station. Along the way, they encounter an increasingly terrifying horde of parasites, and if any of them intend to survive, they'll have to outsmart the deadly organisms. 
date of release = the 31 of October 2008

Forced to accompany them to a remote gas station, the group faces a new threat in the form of deadly parasites. Along the way, they encounter an increasingly terrifying horde of parasites. If any of them intend to survive, they'll have to outsmart the deadly organisms.

title = Raising Cain 
overview = When neighborhood kids begin vanishing, Jenny suspects her child psychologist husband, Carter, may be resuming the deranged experiments his father performed on Carter when he was young. Now, it falls to Jenny to unravel the mystery. And as more children disappear, she fears for her own child's safety. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Brian De Palma 
budget = 12.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 37.2 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.9 
date of release = the 7 of August 1992 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the psychological thriller "Raising Cain," directed by Brian De Palma, Jenny becomes increasingly concerned as neighborhood children start disappearing. She suspects her husband, Carter, a child psychologist, may be continuing the disturbing experiments his father once conducted on him. With a budget of 12.0 million dollars, the film grossed 37.2 million dollars at the box office. Released on the 7th of August 1992, this English-language movie keeps viewers on the edge of their seats with an average rating of 5.9. As Jenny delves deeper into the mystery, she fears for the safety of her own child, leading to a suspenseful and thrilling conclusion.

title = Spasms 
overview = A gigantic serpent is captured on a remote island and shipped to an American college for experimentation. 
cast = Peter Fonda, Oliver Reed, Kerrie Keane, Al Waxman 
tagline = You scream, you expand, you explode. A new source of evil is discovered and is out of control. 
budget = 47.3 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Hyperion Productions 
production countrie = Canada

revenue = 298.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.5 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Peter Fonda, Oliver Reed, Kerrie Keane, Al Waxman 

In "Spasms," produced by Hyperion Productions and set in Canada, a thrilling tale unfolds as a massive serpent is captured on a remote island and transported to an American college for scientific study. Starring Peter Fonda, Oliver Reed, Kerrie Keane, and Al Waxman, this horror film takes a terrifying turn as the experiment spirals out of control. With a budget of 47.3 million dollars, the movie managed to reel in a staggering revenue of 298.0 million dollars. The tagline "You scream, you expand, you explode. A new source of evil is discovered and is out of control" sets the tone for this suspenseful ride. As the tension rises and the average note stands at 5.5, audiences are left on the edge of their seats, wondering what monstrous horrors will be unleashed next. The original language of the movie is English, and the producer of "Spasms" is John G. Pozhke.
