With a budget of 47.3 million dollars, the movie managed to reel in a staggering revenue of 298.0 million dollars. The tagline "You scream, you expand, you explode. A new source of evil is discovered and is out of control" sets the tone for this suspenseful ride. As the tension rises and the average note stands at 5.5, audiences are left on the edge of their seats, wondering what monstrous horrors will be unleashed next. The original language of the movie is English, and the producer of "Spasms" is John G. Pozhke.

title = The Moon and Sixpence 
overview = Loosely inspired from Gauguin's life, the story of Charles Strickland, a middle-aged stockbrocker who abandons his middle-classed life, his family, his duties to start painting, what he has always wanted to do. He is from now on a awful human being, wholly devoted to his ideal: beauty. 
cast = George Sanders, Herbert Marshall, Doris Dudley, Eric Blore 
production compagnie = David L. Loew-Albert Lewin 
Director = Albert Lewin 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
tagline = Strange DREAMS - He had ideas he never told her about...He didn't dare! 
budget = 0.4 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 27 of October 1942 
average note = 6.2 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Stanley Kramer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = George Sanders, Herbert Marshall, Doris Dudley, Eric Blore 

In "The Moon and Sixpence," inspired by Gauguin's life, we follow the journey of Charles Strickland, a stockbroker who abruptly leaves behind his comfortable life to pursue his passion for painting. Portrayed by George Sanders, Strickland becomes consumed by his quest for beauty, transforming into a callous individual who forsakes his family and responsibilities. Directed by Albert Lewin and produced by David L. Loew-Albert Lewin, the film delves into Strickland's relentless pursuit of his artistic dreams, set against a backdrop of moral ambiguity. With a stellar cast including Herbert Marshall, Doris Dudley, and Eric Blore, this American production takes viewers on a mesmerizing 1 hour and 29-minute journey through Strickland's tumultuous artistic odyssey. Released on October 27, 1942, "The Moon and Sixpence" weaves a tale of passion, sacrifice, and the unyielding pursuit of one's ideals, earning an average rating of 6.2. The film's tagline, "Strange DREAMS - He had ideas he never told her about...He didn't dare!" hints at the enigmatic and captivating nature of Strickland's character, making this English-language movie a compelling exploration of artistic obsession. The production company behind the film is David L. Loew-Albert Lewin, and the producer is Stanley Kramer. The budget for the movie was 0.4 million dollars, and it was filmed in the United States of America.

In the action-packed movie "Backflash," a recently released woman returns home with a mission to outsmart a menacing local mob boss and execute the heist of a lifetime. Starring Robert Patrick, Jennifer Esposito, Mike Starr, and Melissa Joan Hart, this English-language film takes viewers on a thrilling journey filled with deception and high-stakes schemes. Directed by Philip J. Jones and produced by Paragon Film Group, the movie was released on the 22nd of January 2002 in the United States of America. With a budget of 227.5 million dollars, "Backflash" managed to rake in an impressive revenue of 107.5 million dollars, proving that sometimes, in a world where nothing is real except the money, the risk is worth the reward. title = Fox and His Friends 
overview = Fox, a former circus performer, wins the lottery of DM 500,000 and can now have the life and things that he has always wanted. While he wants to climb up the social ladder, it isn't without turmoil, and being torn between his old working class roots, and the shiny new facade of middle class consciousness. 
tagline = Survival of the fittest 
average note = 7.6 
duration of the movie = 2h03 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Survival of the fittest 

In "Fox and His Friends," we follow the journey of Fox, a former circus performer who strikes it rich by winning the lottery of DM 500,000. With newfound wealth, Fox sets out to pursue the life he has always dreamed of, navigating the complexities of social status and identity along the way. As he grapples with the tug-of-war between his working-class origins and aspirations for middle-class acceptance, Fox must confront the harsh realities of survival in a world where only the fittest thrive. With an average rating of 7.6, this captivating tale unfolds over a duration of 2 hours and 3 minutes, offering a poignant exploration of class struggle and personal transformation. Remember, in the game of life, it's all about survival of the fittest.

title = Basket Case 3 
overview = Henelotter up's the ante in the final part of his trilogy by introducing a new member to the family; the potentially monstrous fruit of hideously deformed Belial's loins. With the pair still enjoying relative anonymity and comfort in their new found home (presided over by Granny Roth), things however take a downward turn on a trip to the Georgia Clinic of Uncle Hal, which leads to an encounter with an especially nasty redneck sheriff and his similarly blinkered band of merry men. 
revenue = 107.0 millions of dollars 
budget = 274.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Edgar Ievins 
production compagnie = Shapiro-Glickenhaus Entertainment 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 107.0 millions of dollars 

In "Basket Case 3," director Henelotter concludes his trilogy by introducing a new addition to the family - the potentially monstrous offspring of the hideously deformed Belial. As Belial and his new family member enjoy a sense of anonymity in their new home under the watchful eye of Granny Roth, their peaceful existence is disrupted during a visit to the Georgia Clinic of Uncle Hal. This visit sets off a chain of events that leads to a dangerous encounter with a ruthless redneck sheriff and his narrow-minded group of followers. With a revenue of 107.0 million dollars and a budget of 274.7 million dollars, this American film, produced by Edgar Ievins under Shapiro-Glickenhaus Entertainment, takes viewers on a thrilling and twisted journey into the dark and bizarre world of the Bradley family.

title = Rocks 
overview = The stone-people Hew and Kew have seen a lot in their everlasting lives on top of their mountain. Therefore they're only mildly amazed by the ongoings in the valley below, they've got their own little problems to deal with - But all of a sudden, Mankind is discovering and inventing, instead of just woozeling, and this new behavior starts to threaten Hew's and Kew's stoic peacefulness... 
revenue = 77.4 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 5 of June 2003 
production countrie = Germany 
Director = Chris Stenner 
cast = Michael Habeck, Rainer Basedow 
duration of the movie = 0h08 
average note = 7.1 
budget = 290.8 millions of dollars 
tagline = Apparently, rocks are having conversations all around us, but they talk very, very slowly. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 77.4 millions of dollars 

In the movie "Rocks," directed by Chris Stenner and released on the 5th of June 2003 in Germany, we are introduced to the stone-people Hew and Kew who reside on a mountain and have witnessed countless events over their eternal existence. Despite the developments happening in the valley below, Hew and Kew are preoccupied with their own issues. However, their tranquility is disrupted when mankind's newfound curiosity and inventions pose a threat to their peaceful way of life. Starring Michael Habeck and Rainer Basedow, this unique 8-minute film explores the clash between ancient stoicism and modern progress. With a revenue of 77.4 million dollars and an average rating of 7.1, "Rocks" offers a thought-provoking perspective on the evolution of society. Remember, as the tagline suggests, rocks may be conversing all around us, but they do so very, very slowly.

Facts included in the description:
- Title: Rocks
- Overview of the movie
- Revenue: 77.4 million dollars
- Date of release: the 5th of June 2003
- Production country: Germany
- Director: Chris Stenner
- Cast: Michael Habeck, Rainer Basedow
- Duration of the movie: 8 minutes
- Average note: 7.1
- Budget: 290.8 million dollars
- Tagline: Apparently, rocks are having conversations all around us, but they talk very, very slowly.

Despite the developments happening in the valley below, Hew and Kew are preoccupied with their own issues. However, their tranquility is disrupted when mankind's newfound curiosity and inventions pose a threat to their peaceful way of life. Starring Michael Habeck and Rainer Basedow, this unique 8-minute film explores the clash between ancient stoicism and modern progress. With a revenue of 77.4 million dollars and an average rating of 7.1, "Rocks" offers a thought-provoking perspective on the evolution of society. Remember, as the tagline suggests, rocks may be conversing all around us, but they do so very, very slowly.

title = Bad Teacher 
overview = A lazy, incompetent middle school teacher who hates her job and her students is forced to return to her job to make enough money for a boob job after her rich fiancé dumps her. 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 16 of May 2011 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Jake Kasdan 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the comedy film "Bad Teacher," directed by Jake Kasdan and released on the 16th of May 2011 in the United States of America, we follow the story of a lazy and incompetent middle school teacher. Disliking her job and her students, she is compelled to go back to teaching in order to earn money for a cosmetic surgery after her wealthy fiancé ends their engagement. Will she be able to navigate the challenges of the classroom and achieve her goal? This English-language movie is a hilarious and entertaining look at one woman's unconventional journey to self-improvement.

title = A Lizard in a Woman's Skin 
overview = A young woman is accused of murdering her debauched neighbor after dreaming it. Was she set up, or did she really do it? 
average note = 7.0 
revenue = 15.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Italian 
duration of the movie = 1h44 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.0 

In the Italian film "A Lizard in a Woman's Skin," a gripping tale unfolds as a young woman finds herself at the center of a murder accusation against her debauched neighbor, all stemming from a haunting dream. As the mystery deepens, viewers are left questioning whether she was framed or if she is truly guilty. With an average rating of 7.0, this suspenseful thriller captivated audiences and raked in an impressive revenue of 15.6 million dollars. Set against a runtime of 1 hour and 44 minutes, this original Italian language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = The Dark Crystal 
overview = On another planet in the distant past, a Gelfling embarks on a quest to find the missing shard of a magical crystal and restore order to his world, before the grotesque race of Skeksis find and use the crystal for evil. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
Director = Jim Henson 
Producer = Jim Henson 
date of release = the 17 of December 1982 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 40.6 millions of dollars 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the mystical world of "The Dark Crystal," a brave Gelfling sets out on a perilous journey to recover a lost shard of a powerful crystal. Directed and produced by the legendary Jim Henson, this epic fantasy film takes viewers on a visually stunning adventure filled with magic and wonder. Set in a distant past on a planet far away, the Gelfling must act swiftly to prevent the sinister Skeksis from harnessing the crystal's dark powers for their own malevolent purposes. Released on the 17th of December 1982 in the United Kingdom, this captivating tale unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 33 minutes, captivating audiences with its intricate puppetry and captivating storytelling. With a budget of 15.0 million dollars, "The Dark Crystal" went on to earn an impressive revenue of 40.6 million dollars, solidifying its status as a beloved classic in English language cinema.

['correct']

With a budget of 15.0 million dollars, "The Dark Crystal" went on to earn an impressive revenue of 40.6 million dollars, solidifying its status as a beloved classic in English language cinema.

['correct']

title = Secretary 
overview = A young woman, recently released from a mental hospital, gets a job as a secretary to a demanding lawyer, where their employer-employee relationship turns into a sexual, sadomasochistic one. 
cast = James Spader, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jeremy Davies, Lesley Ann Warren 
average note = 6.8 
production compagnie = Slough Pond 
Director = Steven Shainberg 
budget = 4.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Amy Hobby 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = James Spader, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jeremy Davies, Lesley Ann Warren 

In the movie "Secretary," directed by Steven Shainberg and produced by Amy Hobby, a young woman, recently released from a mental hospital, lands a job as a secretary to a demanding lawyer. Portrayed by Maggie Gyllenhaal, she finds herself in a complex and unconventional relationship with her employer, played by James Spader. As their dynamic evolves into a sexual and sadomasochistic one, the boundaries between professional and personal become blurred. With a talented cast including Jeremy Davies and Lesley Ann Warren, this American film, produced by Slough Pond, delves into themes of power dynamics and personal liberation. Despite its controversial subject matter, the movie has garnered an average rating of 6.8. With a budget of 4.0 million dollars, "Secretary" is a compelling exploration of desire, control, and the complexities of human relationships, all presented in its original language, English. The production company behind the film is Slough Pond, and the production country is the United States of America. The movie stars James Spader, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jeremy Davies, and Lesley Ann Warren.

title = Island of Lost Women 
overview = A plane crash-lands on a jungle island inhabited by a scientist and his nubile young daughters. Complications ensue. 
tagline = A Secret Eden Turned into a Raging Hell! 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 105.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Jeff Richards, John Smith, Venetia Stevenson, Alan Napier 
date of release = the 1 of May 1959 
duration of the movie = 1h11 
budget = 160.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 4.7 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = A Secret Eden Turned into a Raging Hell! 

In the 1959 film "Island of Lost Women," a group of survivors from a plane crash find themselves stranded on a mysterious jungle island. Led by a scientist and his alluring young daughters, the group must navigate the dangers of their new surroundings. As tensions rise and secrets are revealed, the once idyllic paradise transforms into a treacherous landscape. Starring Jeff Richards, John Smith, Venetia Stevenson, and Alan Napier, this English-language movie was released on the 1st of May 1959 by Warner Bros. Despite a budget of 160.1 million dollars, the film managed to generate a revenue of 105.0 million dollars. With a runtime of 1 hour and 11 minutes, "Island of Lost Women" captivates audiences with its tale of survival, betrayal, and the dark side of human nature. As the tagline suggests, this secret Eden is indeed turned into a raging hell, leaving viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = Eddie 
overview = Eddie is a New York limo driver and a fanatical follower of the New York Knicks professional basketball team. The team is struggling with a mediocre record when, in mid-season, "Wild Bill" Burgess, the new owner, as a public relations gimmick, stages an 'honorary coach' contest, which Eddie wins. The fans love it, so "Wild Bill" fires the coach and hires her. She takes the bunch of overpaid prima 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 289.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Hollywood Pictures 
cast = Whoopi Goldberg, Frank Langella, Dennis Farina, Richard Jenkins 
Director = Steve Rash 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "Eddie," a heartwarming comedy set in New York City, we meet Eddie, a passionate New York Knicks fan and a dedicated limo driver. When the struggling basketball team's new owner, "Wild Bill" Burgess, holds an 'honorary coach' contest as a PR stunt, Eddie unexpectedly wins and is thrust into the spotlight. The fans adore her, leading to "Wild Bill" making a bold decision to hire Eddie as the team's new coach. With a star-studded cast including Whoopi Goldberg, Frank Langella, Dennis Farina, and Richard Jenkins, this film captures the essence of loyalty, determination, and the power of believing in oneself. Directed by Steve Rash and produced by Hollywood Pictures, "Eddie" grossed an impressive $289.4 million at the box office in the United States, solidifying its place as a beloved sports comedy classic. The production company behind the film is Hollywood Pictures, and it was filmed in the United States of America.

title = Love on the Run 
overview = Antoine Doinel is now more than thirty. He divorces from Christine. He is a proofreader, and is in love with Sabine, a record seller. Colette, his teenager love, is now a lawyer. She buys Antoine's first published autobiographical novel. They meet again in a station... 
average note = 6.9 
date of release = the 24 of January 1979 
cast = Jean-Pierre Léaud, Marie-France Pisier, Claude Jade, Dani 
production compagnie = Les Films du Carrosse 
tagline = Antoine Doinel. He's got four ladies...Nine lives...and Plenty of alibis! 
Producer = François Truffaut 
production countrie = France 
Director = François Truffaut 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
revenue = 282.7 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = French 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.9 

In "Love on the Run," directed by François Truffaut, we follow the life of Antoine Doinel, a man in his thirties who is going through a divorce with his wife, Christine. As a proofreader, Antoine finds himself falling in love with Sabine, a record seller, while also reconnecting with his teenage love, Colette, who is now a lawyer. Colette buys Antoine's first published autobiographical novel, leading to a fateful encounter between the two at a train station. With a stellar cast including Jean-Pierre Léaud, Marie-France Pisier, Claude Jade, and Dani, this French film explores themes of love, relationships, and second chances. Released on January 24, 1979, "Love on the Run" received an average rating of 6.9. Produced by Les Films du Carrosse and François Truffaut, the movie grossed an impressive $282.7 million at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 29 minutes, this captivating story is told in its original language, French. The tagline sums it up perfectly: Antoine Doinel. He's got four ladies...Nine lives...and Plenty of alibis!

title = Foxes 
overview = A group of friends come of age in the asphalt desert of the San Fernando Valley set to a blazing soundtrack and endless drinking, drugs and sex. 
Director = Adrian Lyne 
average note = 5.7 
Producer = David Puttnam 
budget = 214.4 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 29 of February 1980 
production compagnie = Casablanca Filmworks 
cast = Jodie Foster, Cherie Currie, Scott Baio, Marilyn Kagan 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 4.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h46 
tagline = The City Had It Coming. 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Adrian Lyne 

In the 1980 film "Foxes," directed by Adrian Lyne and produced by David Puttnam, a group of friends navigates the tumultuous journey of coming of age in the San Fernando Valley. Set against a backdrop of a blazing soundtrack, the friends indulge in endless drinking, drugs, and sex, embodying the rebellious spirit of youth. Starring Jodie Foster, Cherie Currie, Scott Baio, and Marilyn Kagan, the film captures the essence of teenage angst and friendship. With a budget of 214.4 million dollars, the movie was released on the 29th of February and received an average rating of 5.7. Despite its critical acclaim, "Foxes" only grossed 4.4 million dollars at the box office. The 1 hour and 46-minute film, in English, is a poignant portrayal of adolescence in the urban landscape, encapsulated by its tagline: "The City Had It Coming." Produced by Casablanca Filmworks in the United States of America, "Foxes" remains a timeless depiction of youthful rebellion and camaraderie.

With a budget of 214.4 million dollars, the movie was released on the 29th of February and received an average rating of 5.7. Despite its critical acclaim, "Foxes" only grossed 4.4 million dollars at the box office. The 1 hour and 46-minute film, in English, is a poignant portrayal of adolescence in the urban landscape, encapsulated by its tagline: "The City Had It Coming." Produced by Casablanca Filmworks in the United States of America, "Foxes" remains a timeless depiction of youthful rebellion and camaraderie.

title = The Silent House 
overview = Laura (Florencia Colucci) and her father Wilson (Gustavo Alonso) arrive at a cottage off the beaten path in order to repair it since its owner (Abel Tripaldi) will soon put the house on sale. They will spend the night there in order to start the repairs the following morning. Everything seems to go on smoothly until Laura hears a sound that comes from outside and gets louder and louder in the upper floor of the house. Wilson goes up to see what is going on while she remains downstairs on her own waiting for her father to come down. The plot is based on a true story that occurred in the 1940s in a small village in Uruguay. La casa muda focuses on the last seventy eight minutes, second by second, as Laura tries to leave the house unharmed and discovers the dark secret it hides. 
Director = Gustavo Hernández 
production countrie = Uruguay 
budget = 0.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Elle Driver 
revenue = 148.3 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 25 of August 2010 
cast = Florencia Colucci, Abel Tripaldi, Gustavo Alonso, María Salazar 
Producer = Gustavo Rojo 
duration of the movie = 1h26 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Gustavo Hernández 

In "The Silent House," Laura and her father Wilson arrive at a secluded cottage in Uruguay to repair it before it goes up for sale. As they spend the night, strange noises unsettle Laura, leading to a chilling discovery of the house's dark secret. Based on a true story from the 1940s, the film unfolds in real-time over seventy-eight intense minutes as Laura fights to escape unharmed. Directed by Gustavo Hernández, this suspenseful thriller stars Florencia Colucci, Abel Tripaldi, and Gustavo Alonso. Released on August 25, 2010, "The Silent House" was a box office success, grossing $148.3 million against its modest budget of 0.0 million dollars. With Elle Driver as the production company and a runtime of 1 hour and 26 minutes, this gripping tale will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end. The producer of the film is Gustavo Rojo.

title = The Driver 
overview = The Driver specializes in driving getaway cars for robberies. His exceptional talent has prevented him from being caught yet. After another successful flight from the police a self-assured detective makes it his primary goal to catch the Driver. He promises pardons to a gang if they help to convict him in a set-up robbery. The Driver seeks help from The Player to mislead the detective.

title = Maattrraan 
overview = Akilan and Vimalan are the conjoined twins of genetic scientist Ramachandran, whose company makes Energion, a dietary supplement that promises to make geniuses out of children. When Russian journalist Volga tells them that there is something fishy about Energion and is mysteriously found dead, their lives are turned topsy-turvy. 
budget = 11.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 2h48 
Producer = Kalpathi S Aghoram 
date of release = the 11 of October 2012 
production compagnie = Eros International 
tagline = Sometimes the end is just the beginning 
average note = 6.4 
Director = K. V. Anand 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 11.3 millions of dollars 

In the action-packed movie "Maattrraan," directed by K. V. Anand and produced by Kalpathi S Aghoram, we are introduced to the conjoined twins, Akilan and Vimalan. Their father, genetic scientist Ramachandran, runs a company that produces Energion, a revolutionary dietary supplement promising to enhance children's intelligence. However, when a Russian journalist named Volga raises suspicions about Energion and later ends up dead under mysterious circumstances, the twins' world is thrown into chaos. As they delve deeper into the dark secrets surrounding Energion, they uncover shocking truths that challenge everything they thought they knew. With a budget of 11.3 million dollars, a runtime of 2 hours and 48 minutes, and a release date of October 11, 2012, "Maattrraan" keeps viewers on the edge of their seats with its thrilling storyline. Eros International brings this gripping tale to life, leaving audiences questioning if "Sometimes the end is just the beginning." With an average rating of 6.4, this movie is a must-watch for those who enjoy a mix of mystery, suspense, and action.

In the action-packed movie "Maattrraan," directed by K. V. Anand and produced by Kalpathi S Aghoram, we are introduced to the conjoined twins, Akilan and Vimalan. Their father, genetic scientist Ramachandran, runs a company that produces Energion, a revolutionary dietary supplement promising to enhance children's intelligence. However, when a Russian journalist named Volga raises suspicions about Energion and later ends up dead under mysterious circumstances, the twins' world is thrown into chaos. As they delve deeper into the dark secrets surrounding Energion, they uncover shocking truths that challenge everything they thought they knew. With a budget of 11.3 million dollars, a runtime of 2 hours and 48 minutes, and a release date of October 11, 2012, "Maattrraan" keeps viewers on the edge of their seats with its thrilling storyline. Eros International brings this gripping tale to life, leaving audiences questioning if "Sometimes the end is just the beginning." With an average rating of 6.4, this movie is a must-watch for those who enjoy a mix of mystery, suspense, and action.

title = Nightmares 
overview = A collection of short stories. In one a woman who leaves her house late at night to drive to the store while a killer is loose encounters some problems. In the second an arcade whiz kid's obsession with a game leads to deadly consequences. In the third a small town priest loses his faith and decides to leave town, but in the desert is stalked by a mysterious black pick-up truck. In the final story, a family's problem with a rat is larger than they think. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 2 of September 1983 
budget = 32.9 millions of dollars 
revenue = 6.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Joseph Sargent 
tagline = Nightmares... is this year's sleeper. 
cast = Cristina Raines, Emilio Estevez, Lance Henriksen, Richard Masur 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
Producer = Christopher Crowe 
average note = 5.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 1983 film "Nightmares," directed by Joseph Sargent and produced by Christopher Crowe, viewers are taken on a chilling journey through a collection of short stories that will leave them on the edge of their seats. The movie, originally released on the 2nd of September 1983, unfolds in English and follows four distinct tales of terror. 

In one story, a woman braves the night to run errands, only to find herself in a deadly encounter with a killer on the loose. Another segment follows an arcade prodigy whose obsession with a game takes a sinister turn. The third story centers around a disillusioned small-town priest who faces a haunting presence in the desert. And in the final tale, a family's battle with a seemingly ordinary rat takes a terrifying twist.

Starring Cristina Raines, Emilio Estevez, Lance Henriksen, and Richard Masur, "Nightmares" weaves together these eerie narratives with a tagline that promises a spine-tingling experience: "Nightmares... is this year's sleeper." With a budget of 32.9 million dollars and a revenue of 6.7 million dollars, this 1 hour and 39-minute film received an average rating of 5.4. Get ready to be captivated by the horrors that lurk in the shadows in this unforgettable cinematic journey.

title = Regarding Henry 
overview = Henry is a lawyer who survives a shooting only to find he cannot remember anything. If that weren't enough, Henry also has to recover his speech and mobility, in a life he no longer fits into. Fortunately, Henry has a loving wife and daughter to help him. 
average note = 6.6 
cast = Harrison Ford, Annette Bening, Bill Nunn, Rebecca Miller 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
date of release = the 10 of July 1991 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = His life was based on power, success, and ruthlessness. Until a bullet made him think again. 
revenue = 137.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Mike Nichols 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h48 
budget = 58.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.6 

In the 1991 film "Regarding Henry," directed by Mike Nichols, we follow the story of Henry, a successful lawyer portrayed by Harrison Ford. After surviving a shooting that leaves him with amnesia, Henry must embark on a challenging journey to regain his memory, speech, and mobility. Despite the struggles of fitting back into his old life, Henry finds solace and support from his loving wife and daughter, played by Annette Bening and Rebecca Miller, respectively. As Henry navigates this new reality, he begins to question his previous values of power and ruthlessness. With a tagline that reads, "His life was based on power, success, and ruthlessness. Until a bullet made him think again," the film explores themes of redemption and self-discovery. "Regarding Henry" was produced by Paramount Pictures and was released on July 10, 1991, in the United States. The movie, with an average rating of 6.6, grossed $137.0 million at the box office against a budget of $58.4 million. The film is in English and has a runtime of 1 hour and 48 minutes. The cast includes Bill Nunn alongside Harrison Ford, Annette Bening, and Rebecca Miller.

In the 1991 film "Regarding Henry," directed by Mike Nichols, we follow the story of Henry, a successful lawyer portrayed by Harrison Ford. After surviving a shooting that leaves him with amnesia, Henry must embark on a challenging journey to regain his memory, speech, and mobility. Despite the struggles of fitting back into his old life, Henry finds solace and support from his loving wife and daughter, played by Annette Bening and Rebecca Miller, respectively. As Henry navigates this new reality, he begins to question his previous values of power and ruthlessness. With a tagline that reads, "His life was based on power, success, and ruthlessness. Until a bullet made him think again," the film explores themes of redemption and self-discovery. "Regarding Henry" was produced by Paramount Pictures and was released on July 10, 1991, in the United States. The movie, with an average rating of 6.6, grossed $137.0 million at the box office against a budget of $58.4 million. The film is in English and has a runtime of 1 hour and 48 minutes. The cast includes Bill Nunn alongside Harrison Ford, Annette Bening, and Rebecca Miller.

['correct']

title = Trauma 
overview = An anorexic young woman escapes from a psychiatric clinic and meets a young man who wants to help. She is caught and returned to her parents, who are soon beheaded by a garrotting stranger making the rounds about town, apparently striking only when it rains. The orphaned young woman and her new lover launch their own investigation and are endangered when a link is discovered with the victims and a particular operation performed years before. 
date of release = the 12 of March 1993 
duration of the movie = 1h46 
tagline = Some Nightmares Haunt You. Some... Can Kill You. 
average note = 5.8 
production countrie = Italy 
budget = 253.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Overseas FilmGroup 
cast = Christopher Rydell, Asia Argento, Piper Laurie, Frederic Forrest 
revenue = 266.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Italian 
Producer = Dario Argento 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 12 of March 1993 

In the 1993 Italian film "Trauma," an anorexic young woman escapes from a psychiatric clinic and forms a bond with a compassionate young man. However, their lives take a dark turn when she is apprehended and returned to her parents, who tragically meet a gruesome fate at the hands of a mysterious killer who strikes only in the rain. Left orphaned, the young woman and her newfound partner launch their own investigation, uncovering a chilling connection between the murders and a past medical procedure. As they delve deeper, they find themselves in grave danger. Directed by Dario Argento and featuring a talented cast including Christopher Rydell, Asia Argento, Piper Laurie, and Frederic Forrest, "Trauma" is a suspenseful thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Remember, some nightmares haunt you, and some can even kill you.

The movie "Trauma" was released on the 12th of March 1993 and has a duration of 1 hour and 46 minutes. The tagline for the film is "Some Nightmares Haunt You. Some... Can Kill You." It was produced in Italy with a budget of 253.4 million dollars and went on to generate a revenue of 266.6 million dollars. The original language of the movie is Italian, and it was produced by Overseas FilmGroup.

title = Stolen Face 
overview = A doctor changes a woman's face to match the one that broke his heart. Trouble starts when his love returns. 
production compagnie = Hammer Film Productions 
Director = Terence Fisher 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
budget = 234.8 millions of dollars 
cast = Paul Henreid, Lizabeth Scott, André Morell, Mary Mackenzie 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 3.5 
revenue = 136.6 millions of dollars 
Producer = Anthony Hinds 
date of release = the 1 of May 1952 
tagline = Treachery wears a stolen face! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Hammer Film Productions 

In the 1952 British film "Stolen Face," directed by Terence Fisher and produced by Hammer Film Productions, a doctor performs a drastic surgery to change a woman's face to resemble the one that broke his heart. Starring Paul Henreid, Lizabeth Scott, André Morell, and Mary Mackenzie, the movie explores the consequences of the doctor's actions when his lost love unexpectedly returns. With a budget of 234.8 million dollars, the film received an average rating of 3.5. Despite its intriguing premise, "Stolen Face" managed to generate a revenue of 136.6 million dollars upon its release on the 1st of May 1952. The tagline "Treachery wears a stolen face!" encapsulates the suspenseful and dramatic nature of this classic British thriller. The movie was produced by Anthony Hinds and the original language of the movie is English. The production country of "Stolen Face" is the United Kingdom.

The movie was produced by Anthony Hinds and the original language of the movie is English. The production country of "Stolen Face" is the United Kingdom.

overview = The film follows Grace, a young woman whose irresponsible mother blows her college fund on her younger sister's beauty pageant campaign.

fact : tagline = Life Without a Road Map... 

In the movie "Middle of Nowhere," directed by John Stockwell and produced by Bold Films, we are introduced to Grace, a young woman whose dreams of attending college are shattered when her irresponsible mother spends her college fund on her younger sister's beauty pageant campaign. As Grace navigates through life without a road map, she must find a way to overcome the obstacles in her path. With a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes, this American film has garnered a revenue of 175.5 million dollars and an average rating of 6.1. The production company behind the movie is Bold Films, and it was filmed in the United States of America. The tagline for the film is "Life Without a Road Map..."

title = The Next Three Days 
overview = A married couple's life is turned upside down when the wife is accused of a murder. Lara Brennan is arrested for murdering her boss with whom she had an argument. It seems she was seen leaving the scene of the crime and her fingerprints were on the murder weapon. Her husband, John would spend the next few years trying to get her released, but there's no evidence that negates the evidence against her. And when the strain of being separated from her family, especially her son, gets to her, John decides to break her out. So he does a lot of research to find a way. 
Director = Paul Haggis 
duration of the movie = 2h13 
revenue = 51.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Paul Haggis 

In "The Next Three Days," directed by Paul Haggis, a gripping tale unfolds as a married couple's life is shattered when the wife, Lara Brennan, is accused of a murder she claims she didn't commit. With overwhelming evidence stacked against her, including fingerprints on the murder weapon and eyewitness accounts of her presence at the crime scene, Lara is imprisoned, leaving her husband John desperate to prove her innocence. As the years pass with no hope in sight, John's determination reaches a breaking point when he decides to take matters into his own hands and orchestrate a daring prison break to free his wife. With a runtime of 2 hours and 13 minutes, this intense thriller grossed an impressive $51.1 million at the box office, captivating audiences with its heart-pounding suspense and unwavering love story.

['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h13

title = Fever Pitch 
overview = When relaxed and charming Ben Wrightman meets workaholic Lindsey Meeks she finds him sweet and charming, they hit it off and when it is winter Ben can spend every waking hour with Lindsey, but when summer comes around the corner Lindsey discovers Ben's obsession with the Boston Red Sox. She thinks it is perfect until everything goes downhill for them. 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Drew Barrymore, Jimmy Fallon, Jason Spevack, Jack Kehler 
tagline = A Comedy About The Game of Love. 
duration of the movie = 1h43 
Director = Bobby Farrelly 
average note = 5.9 
production compagnie = Fox 2000 Pictures 
Producer = Nancy Juvonen 
production countrie = Germany 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 

In the romantic comedy "Fever Pitch," directed by Bobby Farrelly and produced by Nancy Juvonen, we follow the story of Ben Wrightman, played by Jimmy Fallon, who is a charming and relaxed guy. When he meets the workaholic Lindsey Meeks, portrayed by Drew Barrymore, they instantly hit it off. However, their relationship faces a major challenge when Lindsey discovers Ben's intense obsession with the Boston Red Sox. As winter turns to summer, their love is put to the test as Ben's dedication to his favorite baseball team threatens to derail their romance. With a budget of 30 million dollars, a runtime of 1 hour and 43 minutes, and a tagline that promises "A Comedy About The Game of Love," "Fever Pitch" takes viewers on a rollercoaster of emotions as they witness the ups and downs of Ben and Lindsey's relationship. The film also stars Jason Spevack and Jack Kehler, and despite receiving an average rating of 5.9, it remains a fan favorite. Produced by Fox 2000 Pictures and filmed in Germany, "Fever Pitch" is a heartwarming tale of love, sports, and the challenges that come with balancing passion and relationships.

In the romantic comedy "Fever Pitch," directed by Bobby Farrelly and produced by Nancy Juvonen, we follow the story of Ben Wrightman, played by Jimmy Fallon, who is a charming and relaxed guy. When he meets the workaholic Lindsey Meeks, portrayed by Drew Barrymore, they instantly hit it off. However, their relationship faces a major challenge when Lindsey discovers Ben's intense obsession with the Boston Red Sox. As winter turns to summer, their love is put to the test as Ben's dedication to his favorite baseball team threatens to derail their romance. With a budget of 30 million dollars, a runtime of 1 hour and 43 minutes, and a tagline that promises "A Comedy About The Game of Love," "Fever Pitch" takes viewers on a rollercoaster of emotions as they witness the ups and downs of Ben and Lindsey's relationship. The film also stars Jason Spevack and Jack Kehler, and despite receiving an average rating of 5.9, it remains a fan favorite. Produced by Fox 2000 Pictures and filmed in Germany, "Fever Pitch" is a heartwarming tale of love, sports, and the challenges that come with balancing passion and relationships.

title = The Faculty 
overview = When some very creepy things start happening around school, the kids at Herrington High make a chilling discovery that confirms their worst suspicions: their teachers really are from another planet! As mind-controlling parasites rapidly begin spreading from the faculty to the students' bodies, it's ultimately up to the few who are left – an unlikely collection of loners, leaders, nerds and jocks – to save the world from alien domination. 
production compagnie = Dimension Films 
Director = Robert Rodriguez 
average note = 6.2 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h44 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Robert Rodriguez 
date of release = the 25 of December 1998 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Dimension Films 

In "The Faculty," directed by Robert Rodriguez and produced by Dimension Films, the students of Herrington High uncover a terrifying truth - their teachers are actually extraterrestrial beings. As a parasitic alien invasion threatens to take over the world, a diverse group of students must band together to fight back. With a budget of 15 million dollars, this sci-fi thriller was released on December 25, 1998, in the United States of America. The movie, with an average rating of 6.2, runs for 1 hour and 44 minutes in its original English language. Get ready for a chilling and action-packed battle for survival against alien domination. The production company behind "The Faculty" is Dimension Films.

title = Branded 
overview = In a dystopian future, where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man's effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy leads to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world. 

TN  -  TrueNegative

fact : production compagnie = Lionsgate 

title = Branded 
overview = In a dystopian future, where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man's effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy leads to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world. 

In the dystopian world of "Branded," corporate brands reign supreme, manipulating and deceiving the disillusioned population. When one man dares to uncover the truth behind the sinister conspiracy, he unwittingly sparks an epic battle against the hidden forces that wield control over the entire world. As he delves deeper into the dark underbelly of society, he must navigate a treacherous landscape of deceit and danger in order to expose the shocking reality that lies beneath the surface. Will he be able to break free from the chains of manipulation and lead a revolution, or will he become just another pawn in the grand scheme of those who pull the strings?

Facts included:
- Title: Branded
- Overview: In a dystopian future, where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man's effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy leads to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world.

As he delves deeper into the dark underbelly of society, he must navigate a treacherous landscape of deceit and danger in order to expose the shocking reality that lies beneath the surface. Will he be able to break free from the chains of manipulation and lead a revolution, or will he become just another pawn in the grand scheme of those who pull the strings?

Facts included:
- Title: Branded
- Overview: In a dystopian future, where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man's effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy leads to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world. 
 
 

 
title = Hide in Plain Sight 
overview = True story of a divorced father in search of his children when his ex-wife enters the witness relocation program. 
Director = James Caan 
cast = James Caan, Jill Eikenberry, Robert Viharo, Joe Grifasi 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = James Caan 

In "Hide in Plain Sight," directed by James Caan, we are taken on a gripping journey based on a true story. The film follows a divorced father on a relentless quest to find his children after his ex-wife joins the witness relocation program. James Caan leads the cast, supported by Jill Eikenberry, Robert Viharo, and Joe Grifasi. As the father navigates the complexities of the legal system and the dangers of the unknown, he must rely on his determination and love for his children to guide him through this heart-wrenching ordeal.

title = Children of a Lesser God 
overview = James is a new speech teacher at a school for the deaf. He falls for Sarah, a pupil who decided to stay on at the school rather than venture into the big bad world. She shuns him at first, refusing to read his lips and only using signs. Will her feelings change over time? 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
cast = William Hurt, Marlee Matlin, Piper Laurie, Philip Bosco 
Director = Randa Haines 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

In the heartwarming film "Children of a Lesser God," James, a new speech teacher at a school for the deaf, finds himself drawn to Sarah, a student who has chosen to remain within the familiar walls of the school instead of facing the challenges of the outside world. Despite his initial attempts to connect with her, Sarah initially rebuffs him, communicating solely through sign language and refusing to read his lips. As their relationship unfolds, James must navigate the complexities of communication and understanding in order to win over Sarah's heart. Directed by Randa Haines and featuring a stellar cast including William Hurt, Marlee Matlin, Piper Laurie, and Philip Bosco, this poignant tale explores the power of love and connection in a world where words are not always necessary. Produced by Paramount Pictures, "Children of a Lesser God" is a captivating exploration of the beauty found in silence and the profound impact of human connection.

title = Super 8 
overview = In 1979 Ohio, several youngsters are making a zombie movie with a Super-8 camera. In the midst of filming, the friends witness a horrifying train derailment and are lucky to escape with their lives. They soon discover that the catastrophe was no accident, as a series of unexplained events and disappearances soon follows. Deputy Jackson Lamb, the father of one of the kids, searches for the terrifying truth behind the crash. 
duration of the movie = 1h52 
Director = J.J. Abrams 
budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.6 
tagline = It Arrives. 
Producer = Steven Spielberg 
revenue = 260.1 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 8 of June 2011 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h52 

In the sci-fi thriller "Super 8," directed by J.J. Abrams and produced by Steven Spielberg, a group of young friends in 1979 Ohio inadvertently captures a catastrophic train derailment on their Super-8 camera while filming a zombie movie. As they delve deeper into the aftermath of the crash, they uncover a series of mysterious events and sudden disappearances plaguing their town. Deputy Jackson Lamb, one of the kids' fathers, embarks on a quest to unravel the terrifying truth behind the incident. With a budget of 50.0 million dollars, the film was released on the 8th of June 2011, in English, and received an average rating of 6.6. The tagline "It Arrives" sets the tone for the suspenseful and thrilling journey that unfolds over the 1 hour and 52-minute duration of the movie. Despite the challenges they face, the young protagonists must confront the unknown forces at play to survive the otherworldly mysteries that have descended upon their once-quiet town. The movie grossed 260.1 million dollars in revenue.

Abrams and produced by Steven Spielberg, a group of young friends in 1979 Ohio inadvertently captures a catastrophic train derailment on their Super-8 camera while filming a zombie movie. As they delve deeper into the aftermath of the crash, they uncover a series of mysterious events and sudden disappearances plaguing their town. Deputy Jackson Lamb, one of the kids' fathers, embarks on a quest to unravel the terrifying truth behind the incident. With a budget of 50.0 million dollars, the film was released on the 8th of June 2011, in English, and received an average rating of 6.6. The tagline "It Arrives" sets the tone for the suspenseful and thrilling journey that unfolds over the 1 hour and 52-minute duration of the movie. Despite the challenges they face, the young protagonists must confront the unknown forces at play to survive the otherworldly mysteries that have descended upon their once-quiet town. The movie grossed 260.1 million dollars in revenue. 
 
 

 
title = Trapped 
overview = A group of college students accidentally see a local redneck kill his wife. A deadly game of cat-and-mouse ensues, with the students trying to escape the area while the killer sets out to eliminate the witnesses who can tie him to the murder. 
Director = William Fruet 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = Canada 
production compagnie = Manson International 
date of release = the 28 of May 1982 
Producer = Herb Abramson 
revenue = 137.6 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.2 
tagline = When you're cornered like an animal, it's kill or be killed 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = William Fruet 

In "Trapped," directed by William Fruet, a chilling tale unfolds as a group of college students inadvertently witness a local redneck murdering his wife. What follows is a harrowing game of survival, with the students desperately trying to flee the dangerous situation while the killer is determined to silence them to cover up his crime. Set against the backdrop of the Canadian wilderness, the tension escalates as the cat-and-mouse chase intensifies. Released on the 28th of May 1982, this English-language thriller, produced by Manson International and Herb Abramson, captivated audiences worldwide. With a budget of 2.0 million dollars, the film went on to gross a staggering 137.6 million dollars, showcasing its widespread appeal. The tagline "When you're cornered like an animal, it's kill or be killed" perfectly encapsulates the high-stakes nature of this suspenseful movie, which received an average rating of 5.2. "Trapped" runs for 1 hour and 35 minutes, delivering a heart-pounding experience that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = Year of the Dog 
overview = A secretary's life changes in unexpected ways after her dog dies. 
budget = 113.6 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Black & White Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 113.6 millions of dollars 

In "Year of the Dog," produced by Black & White Productions with a budget of 113.6 million dollars, a secretary's life takes an unexpected turn following the death of her beloved dog. As she navigates through the grief of losing her furry companion, she embarks on a journey of self-discovery and personal growth, ultimately leading her to new and unforeseen paths in life. This heartwarming tale explores the profound impact that animals can have on our lives and the transformative power of love and loss.

title = Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life Is Calling 
overview = In this film that closely parallels his own life story, Richard Pryor plays Jo Jo Dancer, a popular stand-up comedian who has severely burned himself in a drug incident. As he lies unconscious in a hospital, his spiritual alter ego gets up and begins a journey of his own. He revisits his life, from growing up in a brothel as a child and struggling to beat the long odds to become a top rated comedian. However, his success brings new problems as he develops a tragic pattern of substance abuse that begins to screw up his life. All the while, Jo Jo's spirit watches these events and attempts to convince his past self to turn off from his path of self destruction. Written by Kenneth Chisholm 
average note = 6.8 
cast = Richard Pryor, Debbie Allen, Art Evans, Fay Hauser 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 179.1 millions of dollars 
revenue = 211.7 millions of dollars 
tagline = A comic with one eye on his audience and another eye on the truth. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.8 

In the film "Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life Is Calling," Richard Pryor stars as Jo Jo Dancer, a renowned stand-up comedian who faces a life-altering experience when he sustains severe burns in a drug-related incident. While Jo Jo remains unconscious in a hospital, his spiritual alter ego awakens and embarks on a reflective journey through Jo Jo's tumultuous life. From his challenging upbringing in a brothel to his relentless pursuit of success in comedy, Jo Jo's story unfolds with both triumphs and struggles. Despite achieving stardom, Jo Jo grapples with a destructive cycle of substance abuse that threatens to derail his career and personal life. Throughout the film, Jo Jo's spirit watches over these events, striving to steer his past self away from the path of self-destruction.

The movie features a talented cast including Richard Pryor, Debbie Allen, Art Evans, and Fay Hauser, who bring depth to the narrative with their compelling performances. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, the film captures the essence of Pryor's own experiences and challenges in the entertainment industry. With a budget of 179.1 million dollars and a revenue of 211.7 million dollars, "Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life Is Calling" resonates as a poignant exploration of fame, addiction, and the journey towards redemption.

The tagline "A comic with one eye on his audience and another eye on the truth" encapsulates the central theme of the movie, highlighting Jo Jo's struggle to balance his public persona with his inner turmoil. With an average note of 6.8, this film offers a compelling narrative that mirrors Pryor's own life story, making it a powerful and introspective viewing experience.

In the film "Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life Is Calling," Richard Pryor stars as Jo Jo Dancer, a renowned stand-up comedian who faces a life-altering experience when he sustains severe burns in a drug-related incident. While Jo Jo remains unconscious in a hospital, his spiritual alter ego awakens and embarks on a reflective journey through Jo Jo's tumultuous life. From his challenging upbringing in a brothel to his relentless pursuit of success in comedy, Jo Jo's story unfolds with both triumphs and struggles. Despite achieving stardom, Jo Jo grapples with a destructive cycle of substance abuse that threatens to derail his career and personal life. Throughout the film, Jo Jo's spirit watches over these events, striving to steer his past self away from the path of self-destruction.

The movie features a talented cast including Richard Pryor, Debbie Allen, Art Evans, and Fay Hauser, who bring depth to the narrative with their compelling performances. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, the film captures the essence of Pryor's own experiences and challenges in the entertainment industry. With a budget of 179.1 million dollars and a revenue of 211.7 million dollars, "Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life Is Calling" resonates as a poignant exploration of fame, addiction, and the journey towards redemption.

The tagline "A comic with one eye on his audience and another eye on the truth" encapsulates the central theme of the movie, highlighting Jo Jo's struggle to balance his public persona with his inner turmoil. With an average note of 6.8, this film offers a compelling narrative that mirrors Pryor's own life story, making it a powerful and introspective viewing experience.

title = The Giver 
overview = In a seemingly perfect community, without war, pain, suffering, differences or choice, a young boy is chosen to learn from an elderly man about the true pain and pleasure of the "real" world. 
revenue = 67.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Jeff Bridges, Meryl Streep, Brenton Thwaites, Odeya Rush 
Director = Phillip Noyce 
production compagnie = The Weinstein Company 
tagline = Search for truth. Find freedom. 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 11 of August 2014 
Producer = Jeff Bridges 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 67.0 millions of dollars 

In the thought-provoking film "The Giver," directed by Phillip Noyce and released on the 11th of August 2014 in the United States of America, viewers are transported to a seemingly utopian society devoid of war, pain, suffering, differences, or choice. The narrative follows a young boy who is selected to be mentored by an elderly man, portrayed by Jeff Bridges, to uncover the harsh realities of the "real" world. As the boy delves deeper into this eye-opening journey, led by an ensemble cast including Meryl Streep, Brenton Thwaites, and Odeya Rush, he grapples with the concepts of truth and freedom. With a revenue of 67.0 million dollars, this film, produced by Jeff Bridges under The Weinstein Company, challenges audiences to question the boundaries of a seemingly perfect existence. The tagline "Search for truth. Find freedom." encapsulates the core essence of this captivating cinematic experience, which runs for 1 hour and 34 minutes.

title = 711 Ocean Drive 
overview = The Horatio Alger parable gets the film noir treatment with the redoubtable Edmund O’Brien as a whip-smart telephone technician who moves up the ladder of a Syndicate gambling empire in Southern California until distracted by an inconveniently married Joanne Dru and his own greed. Ripped from the headlines of the 1950 Kevaufer Organized Crime Hearings, this fast-moving picture is laden with location sequences shot in Los Angeles, the Hoover Dam and Palm Springs including the famous Doll House watering hole on North Palm Canyon Drive! 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

title = 711 Ocean Drive 
overview = The Horatio Alger parable gets the film noir treatment with the redoubtable Edmund O’Brien as a whip-smart telephone technician who moves up the ladder of a Syndicate gambling empire in Southern California until distracted by an inconveniently married Joanne Dru and his own greed. Ripped from the headlines of the 1950 Kevaufer Organized Crime Hearings, this fast-moving picture is laden with location sequences shot in Los Angeles, the Hoover Dam and Palm Springs including the famous Doll House watering hole on North Palm Canyon Drive! 

In "711 Ocean Drive," Edmund O'Brien stars as a clever telephone technician who rises through the ranks of a Syndicate gambling empire in Southern California. Inspired by real events from the 1950 Kefauver Organized Crime Hearings, this film noir tale follows O'Brien's character as he navigates power, temptation, and a complicated romance with Joanne Dru. Shot on location in Los Angeles, the Hoover Dam, and Palm Springs, including the iconic Doll House bar on North Palm Canyon Drive, this fast-paced movie offers a thrilling glimpse into the underworld of organized crime.

In "711 Ocean Drive," Edmund O'Brien stars as a clever telephone technician who rises through the ranks of a Syndicate gambling empire in Southern California. Inspired by real events from the 1950 Kefauver Organized Crime Hearings, this film noir tale follows O'Brien's character as he navigates power, temptation, and a complicated romance with Joanne Dru. Shot on location in Los Angeles, the Hoover Dam, and Palm Springs, including the iconic Doll House bar on North Palm Canyon Drive, this fast-paced movie offers a thrilling glimpse into the underworld of organized crime.

['wrong']

title = It! The Terror from Beyond Space 
overview = In 1973, the first manned expedition to Mars is marooned; by the time a rescue mission arrives, there is only one survivor: the leader, Col. Edward Carruthers, who appears to have murdered the others! According to Carruthers, an unknown life form killed his comrades during a sandstorm. But the skeptical rescuers little suspect that "it" has stowed away for the voyage back to Earth... 
duration of the movie = 1h09 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 125.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.2 
budget = 213.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = The revelation shocker of things to come! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h09 

In "It! The Terror from Beyond Space," a harrowing tale unfolds as the first manned expedition to Mars in 1973 goes awry, leaving only one survivor, Col. Edward Carruthers, accused of murdering his crewmates. Amidst skepticism and suspicion, Carruthers claims an unknown life form was responsible for the deaths during a sandstorm. Unbeknownst to the rescue team, the true terror lurks as "it" stows away for the journey back to Earth. With a runtime of 1h09, this American production delivers a chilling narrative that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The film, with an average rating of 6.2, garnered a staggering revenue of 125.0 million dollars despite a budget of 213.6 million dollars. "It! The Terror from Beyond Space" is a sci-fi thriller in English, promising a revelation shocker of things to come. The production country of the movie is the United States of America.

title = L.A. Slasher 
overview = Incensed by the tabloid culture which celebrates it, the L.A. Slasher publicly abducts a series of reality TV stars, while the media and general public in turn begin to question if society is better off without them. A biting, social satire about reality TV and the glorification of people who are famous for simply being famous, "L.A. Slasher" explores why it has become acceptable and even admirable for people to become influential and wealthy based on no merit or talent - purely through notoriety achieved through shameful behavior. 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h26 
tagline = Death to Reality TV 
Producer = Daniel Sollinger 
Director = Martin Owen 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the dark and twisted world of "L.A. Slasher," the titular character takes justice into their own hands by targeting reality TV stars in a series of chilling abductions. As the media frenzy escalates, society is forced to confront its obsession with fame and the questionable value placed on those who are famous for simply existing. Director Martin Owen delivers a biting social satire that questions the very fabric of our reality TV-obsessed culture. With a runtime of 1 hour and 26 minutes, this English-language film produced by Daniel Sollinger cuts deep into the heart of celebrity worship, asking audiences to ponder: are we truly better off without these manufactured idols? Remember, in a world where the tagline is "Death to Reality TV," no one is safe from the L.A. Slasher's blade.

title = Doc Hollywood 
overview = After leaving Washington D.C. hospital, plastic surgeon Ben Stone heads for California, where a lucrative practice in Beverly Hills awaits. After a car accident, he's sentenced to perform as the community's general practitioner. 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
budget = 213.7 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h44 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Michael Caton-Jones 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 2 of August 1991 
Producer = Deborah D. Johnson 
average note = 5.9 
cast = Michael J. Fox, Julie Warner, Barnard Hughes, Woody Harrelson 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Warner Bros. 

In the 1991 film "Doc Hollywood," directed by Michael Caton-Jones and produced by Warner Bros., we follow the journey of plastic surgeon Ben Stone, played by Michael J. Fox. After a car accident on his way to a lucrative practice in Beverly Hills, Ben is sentenced to work as the general practitioner in a small California community. With a budget of 213.7 million dollars, this comedy-drama film has a runtime of 1 hour and 44 minutes. The star-studded cast includes Michael J. Fox, Julie Warner, Barnard Hughes, and Woody Harrelson. Released on August 2, 1991, in the United States, "Doc Hollywood" received an average rating of 5.9.

title = Air Force 
overview = The crew of an Air Force bomber arrives in Pearl Harbor in the aftermath of the Japanese attack and is sent on to Manila to help with the defense of the Philippines. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Howard Hawks 
average note = 6.3 
budget = 33.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Hal B. Wallis 
revenue = 262.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "Air Force," directed by Howard Hawks, the crew of an Air Force bomber finds themselves in Pearl Harbor following the Japanese attack. They are then deployed to Manila to aid in the defense of the Philippines. This English-language film, produced by Hal B. Wallis, garnered an average rating of 6.3. With a budget of 33.9 million dollars, "Air Force" soared to success, raking in an impressive revenue of 262.8 million dollars.

title = Beyond the Darkness 
overview = A young rich orphan loses his fiancée to voodoo doll mischief on the part of his housekeeper who is jealous of his attentions. He digs his girlfriend up, cleans her out, stuffs her, and puts her in bed at the mansion. Following this, he tries out and disposes of a series of young maidens, trying to find the right replacement for her, and the disapproving housekeeper helps him with the disposals. 
date of release = the 15 of November 1979 
production compagnie = D.R. Comunicazioni di massa 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 15 of November 1979 

In "Beyond the Darkness," released on the 15th of November 1979 by D.R. Comunicazioni di massa, a young rich orphan faces a twisted turn of events when his fiancée falls victim to voodoo doll mischief orchestrated by his jealous housekeeper. Determined to keep her by his side, he exhumed her body, cleansed her, and preserves her in their mansion. Desperate to find a replacement, he embarks on a disturbing quest, testing and disposing of young maidens with the reluctant assistance of the disapproving housekeeper. As the macabre tale unfolds, the boundaries between love and obsession blur in this chilling horror film.

title = The Golem: How He Came Into the World 
overview = In the 16th century, the Jews of Prague face persecution. Rabbi Loew creates a giant golem out of clay, to protect the people. This film should not be confused with  director Paul Wegener's  with Henrik Galeen 1915 mostly lost film The Golem (Der Golem) which was his  first film to explore the myth. 
Director = Paul Wegener 
duration of the movie = 1h25 
production countrie = Germany 
average note = 7.0 
original language of the movie = German 
cast = Paul Wegener, Albert Steinrück, Lyda Salmonova, Ernst Deutsch 
tagline = The 1920 Horror Masterpiece 
revenue = 85.9 millions of dollars 
budget = 247.8 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Projektions A-G Union (PAGU) 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Paul Wegener 

In the 16th century, the Jewish community in Prague faces relentless persecution. To defend his people, Rabbi Loew ingeniously crafts a colossal golem from clay, a formidable protector. Directed by the visionary Paul Wegener, this German production titled "The Golem: How He Came Into the World" is a captivating tale of faith, resilience, and the supernatural. Starring Paul Wegener, Albert Steinrück, Lyda Salmonova, and Ernst Deutsch, this 1 hour and 25-minute horror masterpiece unfolds in its original German language, captivating audiences with an average rating of 7.0. As the golem's towering presence looms large over the city, the film delves into the depths of myth and legend, showcasing Wegener's exploration of this iconic character. While not to be confused with Wegener's earlier work, this cinematic gem from Projektions A-G Union (PAGU) mesmerizes viewers with its stunning visuals and compelling narrative. With a staggering revenue of 85.9 million dollars against a budget of 247.8 million dollars, "The Golem: How He Came Into the World" stands as a testament to the enduring power of storytelling and the enduring legacy of a timeless legend.

fact : budget = 247.8 millions of dollars 

In the 16th century, the Jewish community in Prague faces relentless persecution. To defend his people, Rabbi Loew ingeniously crafts a colossal golem from clay, a formidable protector. Directed by the visionary Paul Wegener, this German production titled "The Golem: How He Came Into the World" is a captivating tale of faith, resilience, and the supernatural. Starring Paul Wegener, Albert Steinrück, Lyda Salmonova, and Ernst Deutsch, this 1 hour and 25-minute horror masterpiece unfolds in its original German language, captivating audiences with an average rating of 7.0. As the golem's towering presence looms large over the city, the film delves into the depths of myth and legend, showcasing Wegener's exploration of this iconic character. While not to be confused with Wegener's earlier work, this cinematic gem from Projektions A-G Union (PAGU) mesmerizes viewers with its stunning visuals and compelling narrative. With a staggering revenue of 85.9 million dollars against a budget of 247.8 million dollars, "The Golem: How He Came Into the World" stands as a testament to the enduring power of storytelling and the enduring legacy of a timeless legend.

title = Invitation to a Gunfighter 
overview = When Confederate soldier Matt Weaver returns to town after the Civil War, he finds that his home has been sold by town boss Sam Brewster. Brewster hires gunfighter Jules Gaspard d'Estaing to deal with Weaver, but d'Estaing's independent approach settles the town's problems in a very unorthodox manner. 
cast = Yul Brynner, Janice Rule, George Segal, Alfred Ryder 
production compagnie = Stanley Kramer Productions 
average note = 5.3 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 138.9 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 14 of October 1964 
Producer = Richard Wilson 
revenue = 127.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Richard Wilson 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
tagline = He Kills By Invitation 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Yul Brynner, Janice Rule, George Segal, Alfred Ryder 

In "Invitation to a Gunfighter," Confederate soldier Matt Weaver returns home after the Civil War to find it sold by town boss Sam Brewster. Desperate for justice, Brewster hires the notorious gunfighter Jules Gaspard d'Estaing to handle Weaver. However, d'Estaing's unconventional methods lead to unexpected resolutions for the town's conflicts. Starring Yul Brynner, Janice Rule, George Segal, and Alfred Ryder, this Western film, produced by Stanley Kramer Productions and directed by Richard Wilson, unfolds in a post-war United States setting. With a budget of 138.9 million dollars and a revenue of 127.0 million dollars, the movie was released on October 14, 1964, and received an average rating of 5.3. The tagline "He Kills By Invitation" sets the tone for the thrilling showdowns that await in this action-packed tale.

title = Ferocious Planet 
overview = A groundbreaking device is designed to glimpse alternate universes. But when the machine malfunctions and transports a group of observers into a nightmarish dimension of alien terrors, the travelers must use ingenuity to survive. 
revenue = 84.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 84.2 millions of dollars 

In the thrilling sci-fi film "Ferocious Planet," a revolutionary device capable of peering into alternate universes takes a terrifying turn when it malfunctions, hurling a team of explorers into a harrowing dimension filled with otherworldly horrors. As they navigate this nightmarish realm, the group must rely on their wits and resourcefulness to outsmart the alien threats and find a way back home. With a box office revenue of a staggering 84.2 million dollars, this pulse-pounding adventure is sure to keep audiences on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = Blood Games 
overview = A team of softball players get lost in the woods after their bus breaks down. They get attacked, beaten, raped and murdered by some psychotic men. The women fight back with baseball bats and bows and arrows. 
production compagnie = Epic Productions 
cast = Gregory Scott Cummins, Laura Albert, Shelley Abblett, Ken Carpenter 
budget = 167.8 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = America's favorite pastime just turned nasty! 
original language of the movie = French 
Producer = Yakov Bentsvi 
Director = Tanya Rosenberg 
duration of the movie = 1h30 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Epic Productions 

In the intense thriller "Blood Games," produced by Epic Productions and directed by Tanya Rosenberg, a team of softball players find themselves in a fight for survival after their bus breaks down in the woods. Led by the fearless cast including Gregory Scott Cummins, Laura Albert, Shelley Abblett, and Ken Carpenter, the women are brutally attacked by psychotic men. As they face unimaginable horrors of being beaten, raped, and murdered, they refuse to be victims and fight back using baseball bats and bows and arrows. With a staggering budget of 167.8 million dollars, this American production showcases the resilience and strength of the women as they take on their assailants. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, this French-language film runs for 1 hour and 30 minutes, delivering a chilling tale with the tagline: "America's favorite pastime just turned nasty!"

The production company behind "Blood Games" is Epic Productions, and the movie was produced by Yakov Bentsvi.

As they face unimaginable horrors of being beaten, raped, and murdered, they refuse to be victims and fight back using baseball bats and bows and arrows. With a staggering budget of 167.8 million dollars, this American production showcases the resilience and strength of the women as they take on their assailants. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, this French-language film runs for 1 hour and 30 minutes, delivering a chilling tale with the tagline: "America's favorite pastime just turned nasty!"

The production company behind "Blood Games" is Epic Productions, and the movie was produced by Yakov Bentsvi.

['correct']

title = Private Vices, Public Virtues 
overview = The son of Emperor Franz Josef of Austria, Crown Prince Rudolf, is believed to have shot his female lover and himself in a tragic suicide pact in 1882 in Mayerling. Due to Imperial cover-ups, the full story may never be known. This story has been filmed several times, in French in 1935 and in English in 1968. Hungarian director Miklos Jancso recreates those events for his own purposes, continuing his favored theme of the rejection of paternal authority. In the film, which has very little dialog, Rudolf is a good-natured pan-sexual golden boy, who cavorts on his rural estate with a host of beautiful, aristocratic lovers and friends of both sexes. He refuses to leave his country idyll even though he has been ordered to by the Emperor, his father. Despite the fact that for a large part of the film, attractive young people go about unclothed and engaging in erotic encounters, the mood is one of melancholy rather than prurience. 
date of release = the 6 of May 1976 
duration of the movie = 1h44 
original language of the movie = Italian 
revenue = 3.0 millions of dollars

cast = Balázsovits Lajos, Pamela Villoresi, Franco Branciaroli, Teresa Ann Savoy 
production compagnie = Jadran Film

cast = Brian De Palma 
average note = 7.3

Producer = Noah Baumbach

"De Palma" is a captivating documentary that delves into the illustrious 55-year career of filmmaker Brian De Palma. Directed and produced by Noah Baumbach, this film offers an intimate conversation with De Palma himself, providing insights into his life and unique filmmaking process. Through revealing anecdotes and a plethora of film clips, viewers are taken on a journey through the iconic director's cinematic legacy. With a stellar cast led by Brian De Palma, "De Palma" has garnered critical acclaim, reflected in its impressive revenue of 18.8 million dollars and an average rating of 7.3.
