title = The Boxtrolls 
overview = An orphaned boy raised by underground creatures called Boxtrolls comes up from the sewers and out of his box to save his family and the town from the evil exterminator, Archibald Snatcher. 
Director = Anthony Stacchi 
revenue = 108.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = Travis Knight 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
cast = Ben Kingsley, Isaac Hempstead-Wright, Elle Fanning, Dee Bradley Baker 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Laika Entertainment 
average note = 6.6 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = When troubles strikes friends stack together 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Anthony Stacchi 

The Boxtrolls is a whimsical animated film directed by Anthony Stacchi. The story follows a young orphan boy who is raised by underground creatures known as Boxtrolls. He emerges from the sewers and out of his box to save his family and the town from the evil exterminator, Archibald Snatcher, portrayed by Ben Kingsley. The stellar cast includes Ben Kingsley, Isaac Hempstead-Wright, Elle Fanning, and Dee Bradley Baker. The movie is in English and has a duration of 1 hour and 37 minutes. Produced by Travis Knight under Laika Entertainment, the film generated a revenue of 108.3 million dollars and received an average rating of 6.6. It is set in the United States of America and carries the tagline: "When troubles strikes friends stack together." 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 108.3 millions of dollars

title = Poltergeist 
overview = Legendary filmmaker Sam Raimi and director Gil Kenan reimagine and contemporize the classic tale about a family whose suburban home is invaded by angry spirits. When the terrifying apparitions escalate their attacks and take the youngest daughter, the family must come together to rescue her. 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
revenue = 95.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = They're Here. And They Know What Scares You. 
cast = Sam Rockwell, Rosemarie DeWitt, Saxon Sharbino, Kyle Catlett 
Director = Gil Kenan 
average note = 5.0 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Roy Lee 
date of release = the 20 of May 2015 
budget = 35.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h33 

In the supernatural thriller "Poltergeist," directed by Gil Kenan and produced by Roy Lee, a suburban family finds themselves under siege by vengeful spirits. When the malevolent entities target their youngest daughter, the family must unite to save her from the terrifying forces at play. Starring Sam Rockwell, Rosemarie DeWitt, Saxon Sharbino, and Kyle Catlett, this modern retelling of a classic tale keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 33 minutes. With a chilling tagline of "They're Here. And They Know What Scares You," the film, released on May 20, 2015, in English, grossed an impressive $95.4 million at the box office, surpassing its $35 million budget. Despite its success, the movie received an average rating of 5.0, proving that sometimes the scariest stories are the ones that hit closest to home.

['correct']
fact : revenue = 95.4 millions of dollars

title = Na Tum Jaano Na Hum 
overview = Romantic Esha calls up FM Radio's DJ Bingo to find out the identity of a male who had called during his program. While Bingo is unable to identify him, the male, Rahul Sharma, does call again, and a meeting is arranged. Esha does not show up, but instead decides to correspond with him via a post box numbered address without disclosing her name, to which Rahul agrees, arranges for a numbered postal address himself, and does not disclose his identity as well. Rahul has a friend, Akshaye, who is a womanizer, whose mother asks Rahul to check out a bride for her son. Rahul goes to check this young lady, Esha Malhotra, finds her suitable, and soon marriage preparations are underway. Rahul's romance for the unknown girl will be shattered after he finds out that she is none other than Esha. 
date of release = the 9 of May 2002 
cast = Saif Ali Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Esha Deol, Alok Nath 
revenue = 6.1 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = PFH Entertainment 
tagline = Sometimes you just leave it to God... 
duration of the movie = 2h31 
production countrie = India 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 9 of May 2002 

In the romantic movie "Na Tum Jaano Na Hum," Esha, a young woman, reaches out to FM Radio's DJ Bingo in hopes of uncovering the identity of a mysterious caller. When Esha and the caller, Rahul Sharma, finally arrange to meet, she decides to keep her identity hidden and communicates with him through anonymous post box addresses. Meanwhile, Rahul's friend Akshaye, a notorious womanizer, is urged by his mother to find a suitable bride, leading Rahul to unknowingly consider Esha for his friend. As their paths intertwine, Rahul's feelings for the unknown girl are put to the test when he discovers her true identity. Starring Saif Ali Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Esha Deol, and Alok Nath, this Indian production by PFH Entertainment was released on May 9, 2002, and grossed 6.1 million dollars. With a runtime of 2 hours and 31 minutes, "Na Tum Jaano Na Hum" reminds us that sometimes, fate is best left in the hands of a higher power. The tagline for the movie is "Sometimes you just leave it to God." The production country for the film is India. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Saif Ali Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Esha Deol, Alok Nath

In the romantic movie "Na Tum Jaano Na Hum," Esha, a young woman, reaches out to FM Radio's DJ Bingo in hopes of uncovering the identity of a mysterious caller. When Esha and the caller, Rahul Sharma, finally arrange to meet, she decides to keep her identity hidden and communicates with him through anonymous post box addresses. Meanwhile, Rahul's friend Akshaye, a notorious womanizer, is urged by his mother to find a suitable bride, leading Rahul to unknowingly consider Esha for his friend. As their paths intertwine, Rahul's feelings for the unknown girl are put to the test when he discovers her true identity. Starring Saif Ali Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Esha Deol, and Alok Nath, this Indian production by PFH Entertainment was released on May 9, 2002, and grossed 6.1 million dollars. With a runtime of 2 hours and 31 minutes, "Na Tum Jaano Na Hum" reminds us that sometimes, fate is best left in the hands of a higher power. The tagline for the movie is "Sometimes you just leave it to God." The production country for the film is India.

title = Housebound 
overview = When Kylie Bucknell is sentenced to home detention, she's forced to come to terms with her unsociable behaviour, her blabbering mother and a hostile spirit who seems less than happy about the new living arrangement. 
Director = Gerard Johnstone 
Producer = Luke Sharpe 
date of release = the 4 of September 2014 
tagline = Terror Gets Domesticated 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Morgana O'Reilly, Rima Te Wiata, Glen-Paul Waru, Cameron Rhodes 
budget = 30.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Semi-Professional 
average note = 6.5 
production countrie = New Zealand 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
revenue = 170.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Gerard Johnstone 

In the 2014 film "Housebound," directed by Gerard Johnstone and produced by Luke Sharpe, we follow the story of Kylie Bucknell as she is sentenced to home detention. Forced to confront her unsociable behavior, deal with her chatty mother, and navigate a hostile spirit in the house, Kylie's life takes a chilling turn. With a tagline that promises "Terror Gets Domesticated," this English-language movie from New Zealand features a talented cast including Morgana O'Reilly, Rima Te Wiata, Glen-Paul Waru, and Cameron Rhodes. With a budget of 30.2 million dollars, the film managed to captivate audiences and rake in an impressive revenue of 170.8 million dollars. The production company Semi-Professional delivers a thrilling 1 hour and 49-minute experience that has garnered an average rating of 6.5. "Housebound" was released on the 4th of September 2014.

title = The Benchwarmers 
overview = A trio of guys try and make up for missed opportunities in childhood by forming a three-player baseball team to compete against standard little league squads. 
revenue = 17.6 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.2 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 7 of April 2006 
Director = Dennis Dugan 
cast = Jon Heder, Rob Schneider, David Spade, Jon Lovitz 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 17.6 millions of dollars 

In "The Benchwarmers," directed by Dennis Dugan, a trio of guys, played by Jon Heder, Rob Schneider, and David Spade, embark on a nostalgic journey to make up for missed childhood opportunities. They form a three-player baseball team to compete against standard little league squads, leading to hilarious and heartwarming moments. Set in the United States of America, the film was released on the 7th of April 2006 and grossed 17.6 million dollars at the box office. With an average rating of 5.2, this English-language comedy is a must-watch for anyone looking for a mix of sports, humor, and friendship.

title = The Butcher, the Chef, and the Swordsman 
overview = A tale of revenge, honor and greed follows a group of misfits that gets involved with a kitchen cleaver made from the top five swords of the martial arts world in this wild and brash action comedy. 
average note = 5.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.0 

In "The Butcher, the Chef, and the Swordsman," a wild and brash action comedy unfolds, weaving together a tale of revenge, honor, and greed. The story follows a group of misfits who become entangled with a unique kitchen cleaver crafted from the top five swords of the martial arts world. As the characters navigate through a series of comedic and action-packed scenarios, the quest for vengeance and the pursuit of glory collide in unexpected ways. With an average note of 5.0, this film promises to deliver a thrilling and entertaining cinematic experience for audiences.

The story follows a group of misfits who become entangled with a unique kitchen cleaver crafted from the top five swords of the martial arts world. title = Malibu High 
overview = When a high school senior is dumped by her boyfriend, her grades fall drastically...to avoid failing, she begins seducing her male teachers. Thus begins her downward spiral into drug addiction and prostitution, and ultimately assassinations for a kingpin mob boss. 
revenue = 286.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 1 of May 1979 
tagline = Every teacher in school wanted to flunk her . . . but nobody dared! 
cast = Jill Lansing, Stuart Taylor, Katie Johnson , Wallace Earl Laven 
average note = 5.2 
budget = 0.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
Director = Irvin Berwick 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 286.3 millions of dollars 

In the 1979 American film "Malibu High," a high school senior's life takes a dark turn after being dumped by her boyfriend. Struggling with failing grades, she resorts to seducing her male teachers to avoid academic failure. This leads her down a dangerous path of drug addiction, prostitution, and eventually, carrying out assassinations for a kingpin mob boss. Directed by Irvin Berwick, the movie features a talented cast including Jill Lansing, Stuart Taylor, Katie Johnson, and Wallace Earl Laven. With a budget of only 0.1 million dollars, the film managed to gross an impressive 286.3 million dollars at the box office. Set against the backdrop of Malibu, this gritty tale unfolds in English, captivating audiences with its provocative storyline. The tagline "Every teacher in school wanted to flunk her . . . but nobody dared!" adds to the suspense of this 1 hour and 32-minute thriller, which received an average rating of 5.2. The movie was released on the 1st of May 1979 in the United States of America.

title = Star Trek Into Darkness 
overview = When the crew of the Enterprise is called back home, they find an unstoppable force of terror from within their own organization has detonated the fleet and everything it stands for, leaving our world in a state of crisis.  With a personal score to settle, Captain Kirk leads a manhunt to a war-zone world to capture a one man weapon of mass destruction. As our heroes are propelled into an epic chess game of life and death, love will be challenged, friendships will be torn apart, and sacrifices must be made for the only family Kirk has left: his crew. 
revenue = 467.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 467.4 millions of dollars 

In "Star Trek Into Darkness," Captain Kirk and his crew face their most dangerous mission yet when a devastating attack rocks the Enterprise and threatens the entire fleet. With the stakes higher than ever, Kirk embarks on a relentless pursuit to capture a ruthless weapon of mass destruction. As the crew navigates through a treacherous war-zone world, they are forced to confront their deepest fears and make unimaginable sacrifices to protect what they hold dear. With a personal vendetta driving him forward, Kirk must lead his team through a gripping game of life and death where loyalties are tested, friendships are strained, and love is pushed to its limits. Will they emerge victorious and save the world from impending doom? Find out in this thrilling sci-fi adventure that grossed a staggering 467.4 million dollars at the box office.

title = Pale Rider 
overview = A small gold mining camp is terrorised by a ruthless land owner wanting to take their land. Clint Eastwood arrives riding a pale horse just as a young girl is praying to God to help the miners. He is revealed to be a preacher with mysterious and possible otherworldly origins who teams up with the miners to defeat the land owner and the corrupt sheriff. 
Producer = Clint Eastwood 
average note = 7.0 
duration of the movie = 1h55 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Clint Eastwood 

In the classic Western film "Pale Rider," a small gold mining camp faces terror from a ruthless landowner set on taking their land. When Clint Eastwood arrives riding a pale horse, just as a young girl's prayer for help is answered, the mysterious preacher with possible otherworldly origins joins forces with the miners. Together, they take on the landowner and the corrupt sheriff to defend their home and livelihood. Produced by Clint Eastwood, this gripping tale unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 55 minutes, captivating audiences with an average note of 7.0.

title = The Isle 
overview = Mute Hee-Jin is working as a clerk in a fishing resort in the Korean wilderness; selling baits, food and occasionally her body to the fishing tourists. One day she falls in love to Hyun-Shik, who is on the run for the police and rescues him with a fish hook, when he tries to commit suicide. 
Director = Kim Ki-duk 
tagline = A beautiful yet dangerous place... 
cast = Jung Suh, Kim Yu-seok, Sung-hee Park, Jo Jae-hyeon 
production countrie = South Korea 
budget = 0.1 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Myung Film Company 
average note = 6.9 
date of release = the 22 of April 2000 
original language of the movie = Korean 
Producer = Lee Eun 
revenue = 0.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Kim Ki-duk 

The hauntingly beautiful yet treacherous setting of a fishing resort in the Korean wilderness is where "The Isle" takes place. The film follows the story of Hee-Jin, a mute clerk who spends her days selling bait, food, and even her own body to the fishing tourists. Her life takes a dramatic turn when she falls in love with Hyun-Shik, a fugitive evading the police, and ends up saving him from a suicide attempt using a fish hook. Directed by Kim Ki-duk and produced by Myung Film Company, the movie features a talented cast including Jung Suh, Kim Yu-seok, Sung-hee Park, and Jo Jae-hyeon. Against the backdrop of South Korea's stunning landscapes, the film explores themes of love, survival, and the complexities of human connection. Released on the 22nd of April 2000, "The Isle" is a Korean-language production with an average rating of 6.9. It delves into the fine line between love and sacrifice, showcasing a world where danger hides beneath the surface of beauty. The film's budget was 0.1 million dollars, and it was produced by Lee Eun. Despite its critical acclaim, the movie did not generate significant revenue, earning 0.0 million dollars at the box office. The tagline for the film is "A beautiful yet dangerous place."

title = Tender Mercies 
overview = Alchoholic former country singer Mac Sledge makes friends with a young widow and her son. The friendship enables him to find inspiration to resume his career. 
date of release = the 2 of April 1983 
tagline = Robert Duvall is Mac Sledge, down and out country singer. His struggle for fame was over. His fight for respect was just beginning. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 2 of April 1983 

In the heartfelt drama "Tender Mercies," released on the 2nd of April 1983, we follow the journey of Mac Sledge, a once-famous country singer who battles alcoholism. When he befriends a young widow and her son, Mac finds solace and inspiration to reignite his music career. Starring Robert Duvall as the down-and-out Mac Sledge, the film beautifully portrays his struggle for redemption and respect. As Mac navigates his way through personal demons and professional challenges, he discovers that sometimes, the greatest blessings come in the form of tender mercies. Robert Duvall is Mac Sledge, down and out country singer. His struggle for fame was over. His fight for respect was just beginning.

fact : cast = Robert Duvall, Tess Harper, Betty Buckley, Wilford Brimley 

In the heartfelt drama "Tender Mercies," released on the 2nd of April 1983, we follow the journey of Mac Sledge, a once-famous country singer who battles alcoholism. When he befriends a young widow and her son, Mac finds solace and inspiration to reignite his music career. Starring Robert Duvall as the down-and-out Mac Sledge, the film beautifully portrays his struggle for redemption and respect. As Mac navigates his way through personal demons and professional challenges, he discovers that sometimes, the greatest blessings come in the form of tender mercies. Robert Duvall is Mac Sledge, down and out country singer. His struggle for fame was over. His fight for respect was just beginning. 
 
 

 
title = How to Train Your Dragon 2 
overview = The thrilling second chapter of the epic How To Train Your Dragon trilogy brings back the fantastical world of Hiccup and Toothless five years later. While Astrid, Snotlout and the rest of the gang are challenging each other to dragon races (the island's new favorite contact sport), the now inseparable pair journey through the skies, charting unmapped territories and exploring new worlds. When one of their adventures leads to the discovery of a secret ice cave that is home to hundreds of new wild dragons and the mysterious Dragon Rider, the two friends find themselves at the center of a battle to protect the peace.

In the thrilling second chapter of the epic How To Train Your Dragon trilogy, "How to Train Your Dragon 2," we are reunited with Hiccup and Toothless five years after the events of the first movie. As Astrid, Snotlout, and the rest of the gang engage in dragon races, Hiccup and Toothless embark on exhilarating adventures through uncharted territories and new worlds. Their journey leads them to a secret ice cave housing hundreds of wild dragons and the enigmatic Dragon Rider, thrusting them into a battle to protect the peace they hold dear. With stunning animation from DreamWorks Animation, this film grossed an impressive $609.1 million at the box office. Released on June 12, 2014, in the United States, this 1 hour and 42-minute movie received an average rating of 7.6. As the tagline suggests, in "How to Train Your Dragon 2," the training is over, and the real challenges begin.

title = The Heavenly Body 
overview = The beautiful wife of a tweedy astronomer becomes convinced that her astrologer's prediction of a new dream man in her life will come true. 
budget = 117.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 23 of March 1944 
Producer = Arthur Hornblow Jr.

fact : budget = 117.8 millions of dollars 

In "The Heavenly Body," a stunning wife of a scholarly astronomer finds herself entranced by an astrologer's forecast of a new romantic interest entering her life. As she navigates this newfound belief, she is swept into a whirlwind of anticipation and excitement. Produced by Arthur Hornblow Jr. and directed by Alexander Hall, this enchanting tale unfolds against the backdrop of a $117.8 million budget and was released on the 23rd of March in 1944.

title = The Cell 
overview = A psychotherapist journeys inside a comatose serial killer in the hopes of saving his latest victim. 
revenue = 104.2 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.0

fact : revenue = 104.2 millions of dollars 

In the gripping psychological thriller "The Cell," a psychotherapist takes a daring leap into the mind of a comatose serial killer to rescue his most recent victim. As she navigates the twisted and haunting landscapes of his subconscious, she must race against time to unravel the killer's dark secrets before it's too late. With a revenue of 104.2 million dollars and an average rating of 6.0, this visually stunning and mind-bending film will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

title = Detour 
overview = A young law student, grieving for his dying mother, struggles to decide whether he should kill his unfaithful step-father. 
date of release = the 20 of January 2017 
average note = 5.9 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Head Gear Films 
budget = 270.7 millions of dollars 
Producer = Jason Newmark 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
production countrie = South Africa 
cast = Tye Sheridan, Bel Powley, Emory Cohen, Stephen Moyer 
Director = Christopher Smith 
revenue = 167.2 millions of dollars 
tagline = When you want someone dead, which road would you choose? 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 20 of January 2017 

In the 2017 film "Detour," directed by Christopher Smith and produced by Jason Newmark, a young law student finds himself at a crossroads as he grieves for his dying mother and contemplates whether to take action against his unfaithful step-father. Set in South Africa and primarily in English, the movie follows the protagonist's internal struggle as he navigates the difficult decision ahead. Starring Tye Sheridan, Bel Powley, Emory Cohen, and Stephen Moyer, the film delves into themes of morality, revenge, and family dynamics. With a budget of 270.7 million dollars, "Detour" garnered a revenue of 167.2 million dollars, receiving an average rating of 5.9. The tagline, "When you want someone dead, which road would you choose?" encapsulates the moral dilemma at the heart of this gripping thriller, which runs for 1 hour and 37 minutes. The movie was released on the 20th of January 2017 by the production company Head Gear Films.

['correct']

['correct']
fact : Producer = Jason Newmark 

In the 2017 film "Detour," directed by Christopher Smith and produced by Jason Newmark, a young law student finds himself at a crossroads as he grieves for his dying mother and contemplates whether to take action against his unfaithful step-father. Set in South Africa and primarily in English, the movie follows the protagonist's internal struggle as he navigates the difficult decision ahead. Starring Tye Sheridan, Bel Powley, Emory Cohen, and Stephen Moyer, the film delves into themes of morality, revenge, and family dynamics. With a budget of 270.7 million dollars, "Detour" garnered a revenue of 167.2 million dollars, receiving an average rating of 5.9. The tagline, "When you want someone dead, which road would you choose?" encapsulates the moral dilemma at the heart of this gripping thriller, which runs for 1 hour and 37 minutes. The movie was released on the 20th of January 2017 by the production company Head Gear Films.

title = Conan the Barbarian 
overview = A quest that begins as a personal vendetta for the fierce Cimmerian warrior soon turns into an epic battle against hulking rivals, horrific monsters, and impossible odds, as Conan (Jason Momoa) realizes he is the only hope of saving the great nations of Hyboria from an encroaching reign of supernatural evil. 
cast = 杰森·莫玛, Stephen Lang, Rachel Nichols, Ron Perlman 
tagline = Enter an age undreamed of 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = 杰森·莫玛, Stephen Lang, Rachel Nichols, Ron Perlman 

title = Conan the Barbarian 
overview = In a world where ancient civilizations clash and dark forces threaten to engulf the land, "Conan the Barbarian" follows the journey of the fierce Cimmerian warrior, Conan, portrayed by the formidable Jason Momoa. What begins as a personal vendetta soon transforms into a monumental quest to combat towering adversaries, nightmarish creatures, and insurmountable challenges. As Conan navigates through a treacherous landscape, he comes to a profound realization - he alone stands as the last hope for the great nations of Hyboria against the encroaching tyranny of supernatural malevolence. With a stellar supporting cast including Stephen Lang, Rachel Nichols, and Ron Perlman, this epic tale unfolds with breathtaking action and gripping suspense. Prepare to be transported to an age undreamed of, where the fate of civilizations hangs in the balance, and only one warrior can tip the scales towards victory. 
cast = 杰森·莫玛, Stephen Lang, Rachel Nichols, Ron Perlman 
tagline = Enter an age undreamed of

title = White Noise 
overview = An architect's desire to speak with his wife from beyond the grave using EVP (Electronic Voice Phenomenon), becomes an obsession with supernatural repercussions. 
budget = 10.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Paul Brooks 
tagline = The line separating the living from the dead has been crossed. 
average note = 5.6 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
revenue = 91.2 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 7 of January 2005 
production countrie = Canada 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Geoffrey Sax 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
cast = Michael Keaton, Chandra West, Deborah Kara Unger, Ian McNeice 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 10.0 millions of dollars 

In "White Noise," directed by Geoffrey Sax and produced by Paul Brooks, an architect's life takes a haunting turn when he becomes fixated on communicating with his deceased wife through EVP (Electronic Voice Phenomenon). As he delves deeper into the supernatural realm, the line between the living and the dead blurs, leading to unforeseen consequences. Starring Michael Keaton, Chandra West, Deborah Kara Unger, and Ian McNeice, this English-language film was released on January 7, 2005. With a budget of 10 million dollars, "White Noise" went on to generate a revenue of 91.2 million dollars, captivating audiences with its eerie exploration of the afterlife. The tagline, "The line separating the living from the dead has been crossed," perfectly encapsulates the chilling journey viewers embark on during the 1 hour and 41 minutes runtime. Produced by Universal Pictures and filmed in Canada, this supernatural thriller received an average rating of 5.6, solidifying its place in the realm of paranormal cinema.

The tagline, "The line separating the living from the dead has been crossed," perfectly encapsulates the chilling journey viewers embark on during the 1 hour and 41 minutes runtime. Produced by Universal Pictures and filmed in Canada, this supernatural thriller received an average rating of 5.6, solidifying its place in the realm of paranormal cinema.

title = Closed Circuit 
overview = A terrorist attack in London results in the capture of suspect Farroukh Erdogan (Denis Moschitto). The attorney general appoints Claudia Simmons-Howe (Rebecca Hall) as special advocate on Erdogan's legal team. On the eve of the trial, Erdogan's lawyer dies, and a new defense attorney, Martin Rose (Eric Bana), steps in. Martin and Claudia are former lovers, a fact which must remain hidden. As Martin assembles his case, he uncovers a sinister conspiracy, placing him and Claudia in danger. 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 49.2 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 28 of August 2013 
tagline = They see your every move 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
revenue = 5.8 millions of dollars 
cast = Eric Bana, Rebecca Hall, Ciarán Hinds, Jim Broadbent 
Producer = Tim Bevan 
production compagnie = Focus Features 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the gripping thriller "Closed Circuit," a terrorist attack in London leads to the arrest of Farroukh Erdogan, played by Denis Moschitto. The attorney general assigns Claudia Simmons-Howe, portrayed by Rebecca Hall, as a special advocate on Erdogan's legal team. Just before the trial, Erdogan's defense attorney unexpectedly dies, and Martin Rose, played by Eric Bana, takes over the case. Unbeknownst to many, Martin and Claudia share a complicated past as former lovers, a secret that must be kept hidden. As Martin delves into building Erdogan's defense, he stumbles upon a dark conspiracy that puts both him and Claudia in grave danger. With a budget of 49.2 million dollars, this English-language film was released on August 28, 2013, under the tagline "They see your every move." The movie, with a runtime of 1 hour and 36 minutes, features a stellar cast including Ciarán Hinds and Jim Broadbent. Produced by Tim Bevan and under the production company Focus Features in the United Kingdom, "Closed Circuit" grossed 5.8 million dollars at the box office.

['correct']
fact : budget = 49.2 millions of dollars

title = Comanche Station 
overview = A man saves a woman who had been kidnapped by Comanches, then struggles to get both of them home alive. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Randolph Scott 
cast = Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins, Skip Homeier 
revenue = 114.4 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 1 of March 1960 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the classic Western film "Comanche Station," produced by Randolph Scott, a courageous man embarks on a perilous journey to rescue a woman abducted by Comanches. As they traverse the treacherous terrain, the duo faces numerous challenges and dangers, testing their will to survive. Starring Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins, and Skip Homeier, the film captures the essence of the Wild West with its gripping storyline and memorable performances. Released on the 1st of March 1960, "Comanche Station" garnered a remarkable revenue of 114.4 million dollars, solidifying its status as a timeless cinematic masterpiece. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Missing in Action 2: The Beginning 
overview = Prequel to the first Missing In Action, set in the early 1980s it shows the capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam war in the 1970s, and his captivity with other American POWs in a brutal prison camp, and his plans to escape. 
production compagnie = Golan-Globus Productions 
date of release = the 1 of March 1985 
revenue = 10.8 millions of dollars 
Director = Lance Hool 
cast = Chuck Norris, Soon-Tek Oh, Steven Williams, Bennett Ohta 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Golan-Globus Productions 

In "Missing in Action 2: The Beginning," a prequel to the first film, viewers are taken back to the early 1980s to witness the harrowing capture of Colonel Braddock during the Vietnam War in the 1970s. Alongside other American POWs, Braddock endures the brutal conditions of a prison camp, sparking his determination to devise a daring escape plan. Directed by Lance Hool and featuring a stellar cast including Chuck Norris, Soon-Tek Oh, Steven Williams, and Bennett Ohta, this action-packed film, released on March 1, 1985, under the production company Golan-Globus Productions, grossed an impressive $10.8 million at the box office. The movie unfolds in English, delivering a gripping tale of resilience and heroism in the face of adversity.

The movie unfolds in English, delivering a gripping tale of resilience and heroism in the face of adversity.

title = An American Werewolf in London 
overview = Two American tourists in England are attacked by a werewolf that none of the locals will admit exists. 
Director = John Landis 
cast = David Naughton, Jenny Agutter, Griffin Dunne, John Woodvine 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = John Landis 

In the chilling horror-comedy "An American Werewolf in London," directed by John Landis, two American tourists, David Naughton and Griffin Dunne, find themselves in the midst of a terrifying ordeal during their visit to England. After being viciously attacked by a mysterious creature, they soon realize that they have encountered a werewolf, a creature that the locals, including Jenny Agutter and John Woodvine, refuse to acknowledge. As they grapple with their horrifying transformation, they must navigate a world where the supernatural lurks in the shadows. Joined by a stellar cast, this film delivers a blend of suspense, humor, and unforgettable thrills that will leave audiences howling for more.

title = A Dog's Purpose 
overview = A dog goes on quest to discover his purpose in life over the course of several lifetimes with multiple owners. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h40 

In "A Dog's Purpose," we follow the heartwarming journey of a loyal canine who embarks on a quest to uncover the true meaning of his existence. Through a series of reincarnations and with the love and companionship of various owners, this special dog learns valuable lessons about loyalty, love, and the unique bond between humans and their furry friends. As he navigates through different lifetimes, each with its own set of challenges and joys, the dog's unwavering determination to find his purpose ultimately leads to a touching and uplifting revelation. The movie portrays the emotional and heartwarming story of the dog's impact on the lives of the humans he encounters, highlighting the profound effect pets can have on their owners.

title = Forever Female 
overview = Ginger Rogers stars as an aging stage actress in this 1953 comedy set in the theatre world. Call it "All About Eve Lite". TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the 1953 comedy "Forever Female", Ginger Rogers shines as an aging stage actress navigating the complexities of the theatre world. Directed by Irving Rapper, this film offers a delightful glimpse into the life of a seasoned performer. Alongside Rogers, the star-studded cast includes William Holden, Paul Douglas, and a host of talented actors such as Pat Crowley, James Gleason, and Jesse White. With a touch of "All About Eve Lite", "Forever Female" promises laughter, drama, and a captivating portrayal of the entertainment industry. The movie also features Marjorie Rambeau, George Reeves, King Donovan, Marion Ross, Kathryn Grant, Maidie Norman, and Almira Sessions.

Alongside Rogers, the star-studded cast includes William Holden, Paul Douglas, and a host of talented actors such as Pat Crowley, James Gleason, and Jesse White. With a touch of "All About Eve Lite", "Forever Female" promises laughter, drama, and a captivating portrayal of the entertainment industry. The movie also features Marjorie Rambeau, George Reeves, King Donovan, Marion Ross, Kathryn Grant, Maidie Norman, and Almira Sessions. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 28.7 millions of dollars

The movie also features Marjorie Rambeau, George Reeves, King Donovan, Marion Ross, Kathryn Grant, Maidie Norman, and Almira Sessions.

title = I Shot Andy Warhol 
overview = Based on the true story of Valerie Solanas who was a 60s radical preaching hatred toward men in her "Scum" manifesto. She wrote a screenplay for a film that she wanted Andy Warhol to produce, but he continued to ignore her. So she shot him. This is Valerie's story. 
date of release = the 1 of May 1996 
average note = 6.1 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of May 1996 

In the gripping film "I Shot Andy Warhol," released on the 1st of May 1996, viewers are taken on a journey through the true story of Valerie Solanas. A 60s radical known for her "Scum" manifesto, Valerie's life takes a dark turn as she becomes consumed by her desire for Andy Warhol to produce her screenplay. Despite his continuous dismissal, Valerie's obsession reaches a breaking point, leading her to commit a shocking act - she shoots Andy Warhol. This English-language film delves deep into Valerie's psyche, offering a raw and unflinching portrayal of her motivations and actions. With an average rating of 6.1, "I Shot Andy Warhol" is a compelling exploration of one woman's descent into violence and obsession.

Using his abilities, he creates gruesome on-stage illusions that shock and terrify audiences. The film, released in English in the United States of America on the 23rd of October 1970, has a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes. Starring Ray Sager, Judy Cler, Wayne Ratay, and Phil Laurenson, the movie had a budget of 0.1 million dollars but went on to earn a staggering 97.7 million dollars at the box office, with an average rating of 5.1.

title = Mayday at 40,000 Feet! 
overview = The co-pilot and engineer of a passenger jet struggle to keep the plane airborne until it can reach an open airfield after a killer aboard the plane fires a gun at an engine and pilot of the plane. 
average note = 8.0 
revenue = 51.6 millions of dollars 
Director = Robert Butler 
tagline = A crippled plane. A crazed convict... 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. Television 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 8.0 

In "Mayday at 40,000 Feet!", directed by Robert Butler, a gripping tale unfolds as the co-pilot and engineer of a passenger jet face a life-threatening situation when a killer onboard the plane sabotages an engine and injures the pilot. With the plane crippled and time running out, they must work together to keep the aircraft airborne until they can reach an open airfield. As tension rises and danger looms, the passengers and crew are pushed to their limits in a race against time. With an average rating of 8.0, this intense thriller captivated audiences worldwide, grossing a staggering $51.6 million at the box office. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, "Mayday at 40,000 Feet!" is a high-stakes, adrenaline-pumping film that will keep you on the edge of your seat from takeoff to landing. Don't miss this heart-pounding ride from Warner Bros. Television, where a crippled plane and a crazed convict set the stage for a nail-biting showdown at 40,000 feet.

title = Dirty Grandpa 
overview = Jason Kelly is one week away from marrying his boss's uber-controlling daughter, putting him on the fast track for a partnership at the law firm. However, when the straight-laced Jason is tricked into driving his foul-mouthed grandfather, Dick, to Daytona for spring break, his pending nuptials are suddenly in jeopardy. Between riotous frat parties, bar fights, and an epic night of karaoke, Dick is on a quest to live his life to the fullest and bring Jason along for the ride. 
budget = 11.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h42 
revenue = 94.1 millions of dollars 
tagline = This is Jason. He's a little worried about his grandpa. 
cast = Zac Efron, Robert De Niro, Julianne Hough, Aubrey Plaza 
production compagnie = Lionsgate 
date of release = the 21 of January 2016 
Producer = Barry Josephson 
average note = 5.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 11.5 millions of dollars 

In the hilarious comedy "Dirty Grandpa," Jason Kelly finds himself in a wild adventure just before his upcoming marriage to his boss's daughter. When he is unexpectedly roped into taking his raunchy grandfather, Dick, on a road trip to Daytona Beach for spring break, chaos ensues. Amidst frat parties, bar brawls, and unforgettable karaoke nights, Dick is determined to live life to the fullest, dragging Jason along for the ride. With a stellar cast including Zac Efron, Robert De Niro, Julianne Hough, and Aubrey Plaza, this film produced by Lionsgate and released on January 21, 2016, is a rollercoaster of laughs and unexpected twists. Will Jason make it to the altar unscathed, or will his grandpa's antics derail everything? Find out in this uproarious comedy that grossed over $94.1 million, surpassing its $11.5 million budget. Remember, as the tagline suggests, "This is Jason. He's a little worried about his grandpa."

The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 42 minutes. 
Barry Josephson is one of the producers of the film. 
The average note for the movie is 5.7.

Will Jason make it to the altar unscathed, or will his grandpa's antics derail everything? Find out in this uproarious comedy that grossed over $94.1 million, surpassing its $11.5 million budget. Remember, as the tagline suggests, "This is Jason. He's a little worried about his grandpa."

The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 42 minutes. 
Barry Josephson is one of the producers of the film. 
The average note for the movie is 5.7.

title = RiP!: A Remix Manifesto 
overview = RiP!: A Remix Manifesto is a 2008 open source documentary film about the "the changing concept of copyright" directed by Brett Gaylor. 
budget = 259.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Brett Gaylor 
average note = 6.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 259.0 millions of dollars 

In "RiP!: A Remix Manifesto," director Brett Gaylor explores the changing concept of copyright in this 2008 open source documentary film. With a budget of 259.0 million dollars, the film delves into the world of remix culture and the impact it has on creativity and intellectual property. Audiences are taken on a thought-provoking journey as they witness the clash between traditional copyright laws and the evolving digital landscape. Directed by Brett Gaylor, this documentary challenges viewers to rethink their views on ownership and originality in the age of remixing. With an average rating of 6.7, "RiP!: A Remix Manifesto" is a compelling exploration of the complexities surrounding copyright in the digital age.

title = North 
overview = Eleven-year-old North has had it with his parents. They are always busy with their careers and don't give North the attention he needs, so he files a lawsuit against them. The judge rules that North should either find new parents or return to his own parents within two months. Thus north starts off on an hilarious journey around the world to find the parents that really care about him. 
revenue = 131.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 4.8 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 131.7 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming comedy "North," eleven-year-old North decides he's had enough of his neglectful parents and takes matters into his own hands by filing a lawsuit against them. With the court's ruling giving him two months to find new parents or reconcile with his own, North embarks on a hilarious global adventure to seek out the loving parents he's always longed for. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, this film grossed an impressive $131.7 million at the box office. With an average rating of 4.8, "North" is a delightful tale of family, love, and the search for belonging.

title = A Band Called Death 
overview = Before Bad Brains, the Sex Pistols or even the Ramones, there was Death. Formed in the early '70s by three teenage brothers from Detroit, Death is credited as being the first black punk band, and the Hackney brothers, David, Bobby, and Dannis, are now considered pioneers in their field. But it wasn’t until recently — when a dusty 1974 demo tape made its way out of Bobby’s attic nearly 30 years after Death’s heyday — that anyone outside a small group of punk enthusiasts had even heard of them. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 7.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the realm of punk rock history, "A Band Called Death" stands out as a groundbreaking tale of musical innovation and resilience. This English-language documentary delves into the remarkable story of Death, a band formed by three teenage brothers from Detroit in the early '70s. Led by the Hackney brothers - David, Bobby, and Dannis - Death defied conventions as the first black punk band, paving the way for future generations. Despite their obscurity for decades, a serendipitous discovery of a 1974 demo tape in Bobby's attic brought Death's raw and powerful sound to a wider audience. With an average note of 7.1, this film celebrates the unsung heroes of punk rock and their enduring legacy.

Facts included:
- Title: A Band Called Death
- Overview provided
- Original language of the movie: English
- Average note: 7.1 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.1 

In the realm of punk rock history, "A Band Called Death" stands out as a groundbreaking tale of musical innovation and resilience. This English-language documentary delves into the remarkable story of Death, a band formed by three teenage brothers from Detroit in the early '70s. Led by the Hackney brothers - David, Bobby, and Dannis - Death defied conventions as the first black punk band, paving the way for future generations. Despite their obscurity for decades, a serendipitous discovery of a 1974 demo tape in Bobby's attic brought Death's raw and powerful sound to a wider audience. With an average note of 7.1, this film celebrates the unsung heroes of punk rock and their enduring legacy.

In the realm of punk rock history, "A Band Called Death" stands out as a groundbreaking tale of musical innovation and resilience. This English-language documentary delves into the remarkable story of Death, a band formed by three teenage brothers from Detroit in the early '70s. Led by the Hackney brothers - David, Bobby, and Dannis - Death defied conventions as the first black punk band, paving the way for future generations. Despite their obscurity for decades, a serendipitous discovery of a 1974 demo tape in Bobby's attic brought Death's raw and powerful sound to a wider audience. With an average note of 7.1, this film celebrates the unsung heroes of punk rock and their enduring legacy.

Facts included:
- Title: A Band Called Death
- Overview provided
- Original language of the movie: English
- Average note: 7.1

['wrong']

title = A Man Called Horse 
overview = In 1825 an English aristocrat is captured by Indians. He lives with them and begins to understand/accept their lifestyles. Eventually he is accepted as part of the tribe and becomes their leader. 
date of release = the 1 of May 1970 
production compagnie = Cinema Center Films 
Producer = Sandy Howard 
revenue = 53.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Elliot Silverstein 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of May 1970 

In the 1970 film "A Man Called Horse," an English aristocrat is taken captive by Native Americans in 1825. As he immerses himself in their culture, he gains a deep understanding and acceptance of their way of life. Over time, he earns his place within the tribe and eventually rises to become their respected leader. Directed by Elliot Silverstein and produced by Sandy Howard, this cinematic masterpiece was released on the 1st of May 1970 by Cinema Center Films. With a revenue of 53.5 million dollars, this English-language movie, set in the United States of America, showcases a compelling tale of cultural exchange and leadership. The production company behind the film is Cinema Center Films.

title = Tillie's Punctured Romance 
overview = Chaplin plays a womanizing city man who meets Tillie (Dressler) in the country after a fight with his girlfriend (Normand). When he sees that Tillie's father has a very large bankroll for his workers, he persuades her to elope with him. In the city, he meets the woman he was seeing already, and tries to work around the complication to steal Tillie's money. 
Director = Mack Sennett 
average note = 6.6 
date of release = the 14 of November 1914 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Mack Sennett 

In "Tillie's Punctured Romance," directed by Mack Sennett, Charlie Chaplin portrays a charming yet deceitful city man who crosses paths with Tillie, played by Marie Dressler, in the countryside following a quarrel with his current girlfriend, played by Mabel Normand. Intrigued by Tillie's wealthy father, he convinces her to run away with him. However, their plans take a turn when he encounters his other lover in the city, leading to a comedic series of events as he tries to navigate the situation and abscond with Tillie's fortune. Released on November 14, 1914, in the United States of America, this classic film blends humor, romance, and deception, earning an average rating of 6.6.

title = Countdown 
overview = A madman captures a young boy and rigs him with explosives. Ray Fitzpatrick, still haunted by the loss of his own son, will defy orders to stop the clock and save a life 
average note = 5.0 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 5 of April 2016 
cast = Nick Nemeth, Katharine Isabelle, Josh Blacker, Glenn Thomas Jacobs 
revenue = 51.7 millions of dollars 
tagline = The Race To Save A Life Begins Now 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
Director = John Stockwell 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 5.0 

In the heart-pounding thriller "Countdown," director John Stockwell takes viewers on a gripping journey as a madman kidnaps a young boy and straps him with explosives. Ray Fitzpatrick, portrayed by Nick Nemeth, is a man tormented by the tragic loss of his own son. Despite orders to stand down, Ray is determined to defy authority and race against time to save a life. Set in the United States of America, this intense film, released on April 5, 2016, keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 30-minute duration. With a stellar cast including Katharine Isabelle, Josh Blacker, and Glenn Thomas Jacobs, "Countdown" grossed an impressive $51.7 million at the box office. The tagline "The Race To Save A Life Begins Now" perfectly encapsulates the high-stakes tension and adrenaline-fueled action that unfolds in this thrilling movie.

['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America

Ray Fitzpatrick, portrayed by Nick Nemeth, is a man tormented by the tragic loss of his own son. Despite orders to stand down, Ray is determined to defy authority and race against time to save a life. Set in the United States of America, this intense film, released on April 5, 2016, keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 30-minute duration. With a stellar cast including Katharine Isabelle, Josh Blacker, and Glenn Thomas Jacobs, "Countdown" grossed an impressive $51.7 million at the box office. The tagline "The Race To Save A Life Begins Now" perfectly encapsulates the high-stakes tension and adrenaline-fueled action that unfolds in this thrilling movie.

title = Dead in Tombstone 
overview = An outlaw named Guerrero Hernandez is shot in the back and killed whilst attempting to free his half-brother from a small-town prison. Making a deal with the devil, Hernandez returns from the dead to take his revenge. 
date of release = the 1 of October 2013 
cast = Danny Trejo, Mickey Rourke, Anthony Michael Hall, Dina Meyer 
tagline = A Blast With Both Barrels Blazing! 
budget = 5.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = CC Capital Arts Entertainment SRL 
Director = Roel Reiné 
Producer = Mike Elliott 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 4.8 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 215.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of October 2013 

In the action-packed movie "Dead in Tombstone," released on the 1st of October 2013, outlaw Guerrero Hernandez, portrayed by Danny Trejo, is fatally shot while trying to free his half-brother from a small-town prison. Striking a deal with the devil, Hernandez defies death and rises from the grave to seek vengeance. With a stellar cast including Mickey Rourke, Anthony Michael Hall, and Dina Meyer, this film delivers a thrilling tale of retribution. Directed by Roel Reiné and produced by Mike Elliott under CC Capital Arts Entertainment SRL, the movie boasts a budget of 5.2 million dollars. Set in the United States of America, the film's tagline "A Blast With Both Barrels Blazing!" captures the intense action and drama within its 1 hour and 40-minute runtime. Despite receiving an average rating of 4.8, "Dead in Tombstone" proved to be a commercial success, raking in a revenue of 215.1 million dollars.

title = Coin Locker Girl 
overview = A child abandoned in a subway coin locker is sold to a ruthless and calculating loan shark and gangster boss dubbed “Mother” (Kim Hye-soo), who runs an organ-harvesting ring in Incheon’s Chinatown. Named Il-Young (Kim Go-Eun), the baby girl grows into Mother’s loyal right-hand enforcer and is groomed to be her eventual successor. But when Il-Young’s loyalty to Mother wavers, the clash between the two unleashes a merciless tidal wave of blood-soaked retribution and strife. 
cast = Kim Hye-soo, Kim Go-eun, Um Tae-goo, Park Bo-geom 
Producer = Yoon Gyeong-hwan 
production compagnie = Pollux Pictures 
budget = 252.5 millions of dollars 
tagline = Survival is no longer a choice 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Kim Hye-soo, Kim Go-eun, Um Tae-goo, Park Bo-geom 

In the gritty and intense thriller "Coin Locker Girl," a chilling tale unfolds as a baby girl, Il-Young, is abandoned in a subway coin locker and taken in by the ruthless loan shark and gangster boss known as "Mother" (played by Kim Hye-soo). Raised within Mother's organ-harvesting ring in Incheon's Chinatown, Il-Young (portrayed by Kim Go-eun) grows up to become Mother's fiercely loyal enforcer, groomed to eventually take over her empire. However, when doubts begin to plague Il-Young's allegiance, a brutal power struggle erupts between her and Mother, leading to a relentless and bloody clash of retribution and turmoil. With stellar performances by Kim Hye-soo, Kim Go-eun, Um Tae-goo, and Park Bo-geom, "Coin Locker Girl" delves into the dark underbelly of crime and loyalty, leaving viewers on the edge of their seats. Produced by Yoon Gyeong-hwan and brought to life by Pollux Pictures with a staggering budget of 252.5 million dollars, this film's tagline rings true: "Survival is no longer a choice."

['correct']

Produced by Yoon Gyeong-hwan and brought to life by Pollux Pictures with a staggering budget of 252.5 million dollars, this film's tagline rings true: "Survival is no longer a choice."

['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h50 

In the gritty and intense thriller "Coin Locker Girl," a chilling tale unfolds as a baby girl, Il-Young, is abandoned in a subway coin locker and taken in by the ruthless loan shark and gangster boss known as "Mother" (played by Kim Hye-soo). Raised within Mother's organ-harvesting ring in Incheon's Chinatown, Il-Young (portrayed by Kim Go-eun) grows up to become Mother's fiercely loyal enforcer, groomed to eventually take over her empire. However, when doubts begin to plague Il-Young's allegiance, a brutal power struggle erupts between her and Mother, leading to a relentless and bloody clash of retribution and turmoil. With stellar performances by Kim Hye-soo, Kim Go-eun, Um Tae-goo, and Park Bo-geom, "Coin Locker Girl" delves into the dark underbelly of crime and loyalty, leaving viewers on the edge of their seats. title = Banking on Bitcoin 
overview = Not since the invention of the Internet has there been such a disruptive technology as Bitcoin. Bitcoin's early pioneers sought to blur the lines of sovereignty and the financial status quo. After years of underground development Bitcoin grabbed the attention of a curious public, and the ire of the regulators the technology had subverted. After landmark arrests of prominent cyber criminals Bitcoin faces its most severe adversary yet, the very banks it was built to destroy. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h30 

The film "Banking on Bitcoin" explores the tumultuous history of the revolutionary cryptocurrency, Bitcoin. Bitcoin, a disruptive technology challenging traditional financial systems, has attracted both public intrigue and controversy since its inception. Originally developed by early pioneers to challenge the financial status quo and blur the lines of sovereignty, Bitcoin eventually gained mainstream attention after years of underground development. However, this attention also brought scrutiny from regulators and law enforcement, resulting in the arrest of prominent cyber criminals associated with the cryptocurrency. As Bitcoin continues to gain popularity, it faces its most severe adversary yet - the traditional banking system it was created to disrupt. Through a gripping narrative, "Banking on Bitcoin" delves into the power struggles and challenges encountered by Bitcoin, offering viewers a compelling insight into the world of digital currency.

Facts included in the final description:
1. Bitcoin is a disruptive technology challenging traditional financial systems.
2. Bitcoin gained mainstream attention after years of underground development.
3. Bitcoin faced scrutiny from regulators and law enforcement, leading to the arrest of prominent cyber criminals.
4. Bitcoin faces the traditional banking system as its most severe adversary.

title = The Grey Fox 
overview = Old West highwayman Bill Miner, known to Pinkertons as "The Gentleman Bandit," is released in 1901 after 33 years in prison, a genial and charming old man. He goes to Washington to live and work with his sister's family. But the world has changed much while he has been away, and he just can't adjust. So he goes to Canada and returns to the only thing familiar to him -- robbery (with stagecoaches changed to trains). 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 158.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 220.9 millions of dollars 
cast = Richard Farnsworth, Jackie Burroughs, Ken Pogue, Wayne Robson 
duration of the movie = 1h50 
average note = 7.2 
production compagnie = Canadian Film Development Corporation (CFDC) 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Grey Fox," we follow the story of Bill Miner, a legendary Old West highwayman who is released from prison after 33 years. Despite being known as "The Gentleman Bandit," he struggles to adapt to the changing world upon his release. Played by Richard Farnsworth, Miner decides to return to his life of crime, this time targeting trains instead of stagecoaches. Set in Canada, this English-language film beautifully captures Miner's journey as he navigates a world that has moved on without him. With a stellar cast including Jackie Burroughs, Ken Pogue, and Wayne Robson, "The Grey Fox" received an average rating of 7.2. Produced by the Canadian Film Development Corporation (CFDC), this captivating movie had a budget of 158.3 million dollars and went on to earn 220.9 million dollars at the box office.

title = Eden Lake 
overview = Eden Lake is a relentlessly tense and immaculately paced horror-thriller about modern youth gone wild. When a young couple goes to a remote wooded lake for a romantic getaway, their quiet weekend is shattered by an aggressive group of local kids. Rowdiness quickly turns to rage as the teens terrorize the couple in unimaginable ways, and a weekend outing becomes a bloody battle for survival. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

Eden Lake is a relentlessly tense and immaculately paced horror-thriller about modern youth gone wild. When a young couple goes to a remote wooded lake for a romantic getaway, their quiet weekend is shattered by an aggressive group of local kids. Rowdiness quickly turns to rage as the teens terrorize the couple in unimaginable ways, and a weekend outing becomes a bloody battle for survival.

In "Eden Lake," a young couple's romantic getaway to a remote wooded lake takes a terrifying turn when they encounter a group of aggressive local kids. What starts as rowdiness escalates into unimaginable terror as the teens unleash their rage on the couple. As the weekend outing descends into chaos, the couple must fight for their lives in a bloody battle for survival. With relentless tension and immaculate pacing, this horror-thriller explores the dark side of modern youth gone wild.

Eden Lake is a relentlessly tense and immaculately paced horror-thriller about modern youth gone wild. When a young couple goes to a remote wooded lake for a romantic getaway, their quiet weekend is shattered by an aggressive group of local kids. Rowdiness quickly turns to rage as the teens terrorize the couple in unimaginable ways, and a weekend outing becomes a bloody battle for survival.

In "Eden Lake," a young couple's romantic getaway to a remote wooded lake takes a terrifying turn when they encounter a group of aggressive local kids. What starts as rowdiness escalates into unimaginable terror as the teens unleash their rage on the couple. As the weekend outing descends into chaos, the couple must fight for their lives in a bloody battle for survival. With relentless tension and immaculate pacing, this horror-thriller explores the dark side of modern youth gone wild.

title = Clifford 
overview = When his brother asks him to look after his young son, Clifford, Martin Daniels agrees, taking the boy into his home and introducing him to his future wife, Sarah. Clifford is fixated on the idea of visiting a famed theme park, and Martin, an engineer who helped build the park, makes plans to take him. But, when Clifford reveals himself to be a first-rate brat, his uncle goes bonkers, and a loony inter-generational standoff ensues. 
revenue = 7.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Orion Pictures 
cast = Martin Short, Charles Grodin, Mary Steenburgen, Dabney Coleman 
Director = Paul Flaherty 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = What's the difference between Clifford and a pit bull? One will tear your heart out, scare your friends and wreck your house. The other one is a dog. 
average note = 5.3 
Producer = Pieter Jan Brugge 
date of release = the 1 of April 1994 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 7.4 millions of dollars 

In the comedy film "Clifford," directed by Paul Flaherty and produced by Pieter Jan Brugge, we follow the story of Martin Daniels, played by Martin Short, who reluctantly agrees to look after his nephew, the mischievous and bratty Clifford, portrayed by Charles Grodin. When Clifford becomes obsessed with visiting a famous theme park, Martin, an engineer involved in its construction, decides to take him. However, things take a chaotic turn as Clifford's behavior tests Martin's patience to the limit, leading to a hilarious inter-generational showdown. Co-starring Mary Steenburgen and Dabney Coleman, this United States production by Orion Pictures grossed 7.4 million dollars at the box office upon its release on April 1, 1994. With an average rating of 5.3, the tagline humorously teases, "What's the difference between Clifford and a pit bull? One will tear your heart out, scare your friends and wreck your house. The other one is a dog."

title = Nightmare 
overview = A drug-treated schizophrenic plagued by horrible nightmares escapes from the hospital and goes on a killing spree. 
production compagnie = Goldmine Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Goldmine Productions 

In the chilling thriller "Nightmare," produced by Goldmine Productions, we are taken on a terrifying journey into the mind of a drug-treated schizophrenic. Plagued by horrifying nightmares, this troubled individual manages to escape from the confines of a hospital and embarks on a deadly killing spree. As the line between reality and hallucination blurs, the audience is left on the edge of their seats, questioning what is truly happening and what is a product of the protagonist's disturbed psyche. Brace yourself for a pulse-pounding experience as "Nightmare" delves into the darkest corners of the human mind.

Plagued by horrifying nightmares, this troubled individual manages to escape from the confines of a hospital and embarks on a deadly killing spree. As the line between reality and hallucination blurs, the audience is left on the edge of their seats, questioning what is truly happening and what is a product of the protagonist's disturbed psyche. Brace yourself for a pulse-pounding experience as "Nightmare" delves into the darkest corners of the human mind.

title = The Mystery of Sintra 
overview = Summer of 1870. Two writers, Eça de Queiroz and Ramalho Ortigão, decide to write a four-handed whodunit for the daily "Diário de Notícias". Could it be that the story they wrote as fiction is based on a real case? This question fuels the conflict between the two writers and drives them to a nearly fatal duel. Lisbon is in commotion. One crime follows another in a story in which love is stronger than tradition. Everything happens at frenzied pace, as in a game.

title = Reap the Wild Wind 
overview = Clipper ships taking the shortest route between the Mississippi and the Atlantic often end up on the shoals of Key West in the 1840s. Salvaging the ships' cargos has become a lucrative business for two companies -- one headed by a feisty young woman. Then she falls in love with the captain of a wrecked ship while he recuperates at her home. She travels to Charleston and is charming to the man most likely to be head of the captain's company, thinking she will be able to get the captain the position he wants on the company's first steam ship. 
tagline = Cecil B. DeMille's GREATEST TRIUMPH! OUT-THRILLS ALL OTHER SCREEN SPECTACLES! 
Director = Cecil B. DeMille 
revenue = 62.5 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 18 of March 1942

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : tagline = Cecil B. DeMille's GREATEST TRIUMPH! OUT-THRILLS ALL OTHER SCREEN SPECTACLES! 

In Cecil B. DeMille's "Reap the Wild Wind," set in the 1840s, clipper ships navigating between the Mississippi and the Atlantic often meet peril at the shoals of Key West. Amidst the lucrative salvage business, a spirited young woman leads one of the companies. When she falls for the captain of a wrecked ship, a tale of love and ambition unfolds. Traveling to Charleston, she strategically charms a key figure to secure a position for her beloved captain. Starring Ray Milland, John Wayne, Paulette Goddard, and Raymond Massey, this epic spectacle showcases DeMille's greatest triumph, promising thrills beyond compare. With a revenue of 62.5 million dollars and an average rating of 6.9, this English-language film was released on the 18th of March 1942 in the United States of America. The 2-hour and 3-minute runtime captures the essence of adventure, romance, and ambition, making it a timeless classic. The movie was produced by Cecil B. DeMille and had a budget of 120.5 million dollars. Cecil B. DeMille also served as the producer and director of the film.

title = Just the Ticket 
overview = Gary Starke is one of the best ticket scalpers in New York City. His girlfriend, Linda, doesn't approve of his criminal lifestyle, though, and dumps him when she gets the opportunity to study cooking in Paris. Gary realizes that he has to give up scalping if he has any chance of winning her back. But before he does, he wants to cash out on one last big score. He gets his chance when the pope announces he'll be performing Easter Mass at Yankee Stadium. 
budget = 12.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Andy García 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.8 
date of release = the 26 of February 1999 
duration of the movie = 1h55 
production compagnie = Canal+ 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 12.0 millions of dollars 

In the bustling streets of New York City, Gary Starke is known as one of the top ticket scalpers, mastering the art of the deal with finesse. However, his girlfriend Linda is not a fan of his shady dealings and decides to leave him for Paris to pursue her passion for cooking. Determined to win her back, Gary realizes he must leave his scalping days behind. But just as he's about to turn over a new leaf, a golden opportunity presents itself - the chance to score big by scalping tickets for the pope's Easter Mass at Yankee Stadium. Produced by Andy García and released on February 26, 1999, "Just the Ticket" is a thrilling tale of love, redemption, and one last shot at a major payday. With a budget of $12 million, this English-language film from Canal+ runs for 1 hour and 55 minutes, captivating audiences with an average rating of 5.8.

title = Surrogates 
overview = Set in a futuristic world where humans live in isolation and interact through surrogate robots, a cop is forced to leave his home for the first time in years in order to investigate the murders of others' surrogates. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the futuristic world of "Surrogates," humans have chosen to live in isolation, relying on surrogate robots to interact with the outside world. When a series of murders targeting these surrogates occurs, a cop who has been confined to his home for years is compelled to step outside and investigate. As he delves into the case, he unravels a web of deception and danger that challenges everything he thought he knew about his society. The movie is directed by Jonathan Mostow and stars Bruce Willis in the lead role.

title = The Stranger 
overview = Wilson of the War Crimes Commission is seeking Franz Kindler, mastermind of the Holocaust, who has effectively erased his identity. Wilson releases Kindler's former comrade Meinike and follows him to Harper, Connecticut, where he is killed before he can identify Kindler. Now Wilson's only clue is Kindler's fascination with antique clocks; but, though Kindler seems secure in his new identity, he feels his past closing in. 
revenue = 177.1 millions of dollars 
cast = Edward G. Robinson, Loretta Young, Orson Welles, Philip Merivale 
Director = Orson Welles 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 177.1 millions of dollars 

In "The Stranger," directed by Orson Welles, the story follows Wilson of the War Crimes Commission as he hunts down Franz Kindler, a mastermind of the Holocaust who has successfully hidden his true identity. With a revenue of 177.1 million dollars, the film features a stellar cast including Edward G. Robinson, Loretta Young, Orson Welles, and Philip Merivale. As Wilson delves deeper into the mystery, he discovers Kindler's obsession with antique clocks, leading to a thrilling chase in Harper, Connecticut. Despite Kindler's attempts to blend in, his dark past begins to catch up with him, creating a suspenseful and gripping narrative. The original language of the movie is English.

title = The Subject Was Roses 
overview = When Timmy Cleary (Sheen), comes home from soldiering, he's greeted by the open but strained arms of his two parents, John and Nettie, (Neal and Albertson). Once considered sickly and weak, he has now distinguished himself in the service and is ready to begin a new life. His parents, however, are still trapped in the bygone days of early and unresolved marital strife and begin emotionally deteriorating through several drama packed encounters. Now mature, the young Tim Cleary finally understands the family dynamics that has played all throughout his boyhood. By the simple act of bringing his mother roses on behalf of his father, Tim realizes he may have destroyed his family, but is helpless to obtain resolution which must come from both his parents. 
budget = 230.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h47 
average note = 7.0 
Director = Ulu Grosbard 
revenue = 281.7 millions of dollars 
cast = Patricia Neal, Jack Albertson, Martin Sheen, Don Saxon 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 230.3 millions of dollars 

In the critically acclaimed film "The Subject Was Roses," directed by Ulu Grosbard, we are taken on a poignant journey into the complexities of family dynamics. Returning home from his time in the military, Timmy Cleary, portrayed by the talented Martin Sheen, is met with a mix of emotions from his parents, John and Nettie, played by Patricia Neal and Jack Albertson. As the story unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 47 minutes, we witness the unraveling of long-held tensions and unresolved issues within the family.

Despite Tim's newfound maturity and understanding of his family's history, he finds himself caught in the middle of his parents' emotional turmoil. Through a series of intense and dramatic encounters, the Cleary family is forced to confront their past and the impact it has had on their relationships.

One pivotal moment in the film involves Tim's gesture of bringing roses to his mother on behalf of his father, a seemingly simple act that sets off a chain of events leading to a deeper exploration of love, loss, and forgiveness. As the story reaches its climax, Tim realizes the fragility of his family's bonds and the need for both his parents to find resolution.

With a stellar cast including Patricia Neal, Jack Albertson, and Martin Sheen delivering powerful performances, "The Subject Was Roses" captivates audiences with its emotional depth and compelling storytelling. Garnering an average note of 7.0, the film not only resonated with critics but also found success at the box office, grossing $281.7 million against a budget of $230.3 million. This timeless tale of family, love, and reconciliation is a must-watch for those seeking a thought-provoking cinematic experience.

Through a series of intense and dramatic encounters, the Cleary family is forced to confront their past and the impact it has had on their relationships.

One pivotal moment in the film involves Tim's gesture of bringing roses to his mother on behalf of his father, a seemingly simple act that sets off a chain of events leading to a deeper exploration of love, loss, and forgiveness. As the story reaches its climax, Tim realizes the fragility of his family's bonds and the need for both his parents to find resolution.

With a stellar cast including Patricia Neal, Jack Albertson, and Martin Sheen delivering powerful performances, "The Subject Was Roses" captivates audiences with its emotional depth and compelling storytelling. Garnering an average note of 7.0, the film not only resonated with critics but also found success at the box office, grossing $281.7 million against a budget of $230.3 million. This timeless tale of family, love, and reconciliation is a must-watch for those seeking a thought-provoking cinematic experience.

Returning home from his time in the military, Timmy Cleary, portrayed by the talented Martin Sheen, is met with a mix of emotions from his parents, John and Nettie, played by Patricia Neal and Jack Albertson. As the story unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 47 minutes, we witness the unraveling of long-held tensions and unresolved issues within the family.

title = A Tale of Two Sisters 
overview = A recently released patient from a mental institution returns home with her sister, only to face disturbing events between her stepmother and the ghosts haunting their house- all of which are connected to a dark past in the family's history. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : date of release = the 13 of June 2003 

In "A Tale of Two Sisters," a recently released patient from a mental institution reunites with her sister at their family home, where they encounter unsettling occurrences involving their stepmother and the lingering presence of ghosts. As they navigate through these eerie events, they uncover a sinister connection to a dark chapter in their family's past. The sisters must confront the chilling secrets that have haunted their household for years, leading to a gripping and suspenseful tale of psychological horror.

title = Get Him to the Greek 
overview = Pinnacle records has the perfect plan to get their sinking company back on track: a comeback concert in LA featuring Aldous Snow, a fading rockstar who has dropped off the radar in recent years. Record company intern Aaron Green is faced with the monumental task of bringing his idol, out of control rock star Aldous Snow, back to LA for his comeback show. 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
Producer = Judd Apatow 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 4 of June 2010 
Director = Nicholas Stoller 
tagline = Aaron Green has 72 hours to get a Rock Star from London to L.A. Pray for him. 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Jonah Hill, Russell Brand, Rose Byrne, Elisabeth Moss 
revenue = 90.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Universal Pictures 

In "Get Him to the Greek," produced by Universal Pictures and Judd Apatow, director Nicholas Stoller brings to life a high-stakes mission to revive a fading rockstar's career. When Pinnacle Records plans a comeback concert in LA featuring the elusive Aldous Snow, it's up to record company intern Aaron Green to bring the out-of-control rockstar from London to L.A. in just 72 hours. With a star-studded cast including Jonah Hill, Russell Brand, Rose Byrne, and Elisabeth Moss, this English-language film released on June 4, 2010, takes viewers on a wild ride filled with music, comedy, and unexpected twists. As the clock ticks down, will Aaron succeed in his mission and save the sinking company, or will chaos reign supreme? Pray for him in this hilarious and heartwarming journey that grossed a whopping $90.0 million at the box office in the United States of America.

The tagline of the movie is "Aaron Green has 72 hours to get a Rock Star from London to L.A. Pray for him."
