title = Three Kings 
overview = A group of American soldiers stationed in Iraq at the end of the Gulf War find a map they believe will take them to a huge cache of stolen Kuwaiti gold hidden near their base, and they embark on a secret mission that's destined to change everything. 
date of release = the 27 of September 1999 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Ice Cube, Spike Jonze 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Village Roadshow Pictures 
revenue = 108.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h54 
Director = David O. Russell 
budget = 75.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 27 of September 1999 

In "Three Kings," a gripping tale set in post-Gulf War Iraq, a group of American soldiers stumbles upon a map leading to a hidden cache of stolen Kuwaiti gold near their base. Led by a stellar cast including George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Ice Cube, and Spike Jonze, they embark on a covert mission that promises to alter their fates. Directed by David O. Russell and released on September 27, 1999, this English-language film from the United States of America's Village Roadshow Pictures captivated audiences with its thrilling narrative. With a runtime of 1 hour and 54 minutes, the movie grossed an impressive $108.0 million, surpassing its $75.0 million budget.

In "Three Kings," a gripping tale set in post-Gulf War Iraq, a group of American soldiers stumbles upon a map leading to a hidden cache of stolen Kuwaiti gold near their base. Led by a stellar cast including George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Ice Cube, and Spike Jonze, they embark on a covert mission that promises to alter their fates. Directed by David O. Russell and released on September 27, 1999, this English-language film from the United States of America's Village Roadshow Pictures captivated audiences with its thrilling narrative. With a runtime of 1 hour and 54 minutes, the movie grossed an impressive $108.0 million, surpassing its $75.0 million budget.

title = The Help 
overview = Aibileen Clark is a middle-aged African-American maid who has spent her life raising white children and has recently lost her only son; Minny Jackson is an African-American maid who has often offended her employers despite her family's struggles with money and her desperate need for jobs; and Eugenia "Skeeter" Phelan is a young white woman who has recently moved back home after graduating college to find out her childhood maid has mysteriously disappeared. These three stories intertwine to explain how life in Jackson, Mississippi revolves around "the help"; yet they are always kept at a certain distance because of racial lines. 
Director = Tate Taylor 
budget = 25.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.9 
duration of the movie = 2h26 
revenue = 124.3 millions of dollars 
cast = Emma Stone, Viola Davis, Octavia Spencer, Bryce Dallas Howard 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Tate Taylor 

In "The Help," directed by Tate Taylor, viewers are immersed in the lives of Aibileen Clark, a middle-aged African-American maid grieving the loss of her son, Minny Jackson, a feisty maid struggling to secure jobs despite financial hardships, and Skeeter Phelan, a young white woman returning home to discover her childhood maid has vanished. Set in Jackson, Mississippi, the film intricately weaves together these three narratives to shed light on the dynamics of race and class in the 1960s South. With a stellar cast including Emma Stone, Viola Davis, Octavia Spencer, and Bryce Dallas Howard, the movie beautifully captures the complexities of relationships between "the help" and their employers. With a budget of 25 million dollars, "The Help" garnered critical acclaim with an average rating of 7.9 and raked in an impressive revenue of 124.3 million dollars. This 2-hour and 26-minute film, spoken in its original English language, is a poignant and powerful exploration of societal norms and the bonds that defy them.

['correct']

title = Love, Wedding, Marriage 
overview = A happy newlywed marriage counselor's views on wedded bliss get thrown for a loop when she finds out her parents are getting divorced. 
Producer = Michelle Chydzik Sowa 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Mandy Moore, Kellan Lutz, Jessica Szohr, Autumn Federici 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
date of release = the 3 of June 2011 
original language of the movie = English

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Michelle Chydzik Sowa 

In the romantic comedy "Love, Wedding, Marriage," produced by Michelle Chydzik Sowa and directed by Dermot Mulroney, we follow a newlywed marriage counselor whose belief in wedded bliss is shattered when she discovers her own parents are getting divorced. Played by a talented cast including Mandy Moore, Kellan Lutz, Jessica Szohr, and Autumn Federici, this heartwarming film takes us on a journey of love, family, and the complexities of relationships. Set in the United States of America and released on the 3rd of June 2011, this 1 hour and 30-minute movie is a delightful exploration of the challenges and joys of marriage, all delivered in the original English language.

Set in the United States of America and released on the 3rd of June 2011, this 1 hour and 30-minute movie is a delightful exploration of the challenges and joys of marriage, all delivered in the original English language.

title = Embryo 
overview = A scientist doing experiments on a human fetus discovers a method to accelerate the fetus into a mature adult in just a few days. However, the "adult" fetus turns into a homicidal psycho and looks for a new formula to prevent her from aging further. 
Producer = Anita Doohan 
Director = Ralph Nelson 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 21 of May 1976 
production compagnie = Sandy Howard Productions 
revenue = 271.6 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h44 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Anita Doohan 

In the thrilling science fiction film "Embryo," directed by Ralph Nelson and produced by Anita Doohan, a scientist makes a groundbreaking discovery while experimenting on a human fetus. The scientist unlocks a method to rapidly age the fetus into a full-grown adult within days. However, the accelerated adult fetus takes a dark turn, becoming a homicidal maniac on a quest to find a new formula to halt her aging process. Set in the English language, the movie was released on the 21st of May 1976, under the production company Sandy Howard Productions. With a runtime of 1 hour and 44 minutes, "Embryo" grossed a staggering $271.6 million at the box office.

In the heartwarming comedy "You Can't Take It With You," Alice finds herself caught between love and family when she falls for Tony Kirby, the son of wealthy banker Anthony P. Kirby. Set in the United States of America, this 2-hour and 6-minute film grossed an impressive $7.4 million at the box office. title = Aamir 
overview = A doctor of Indian origin returning to Mumbai from London is forced to participate in a terrorist plot. 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
production compagnie = UTV Motion Pictures 
Director = Raj Kumar Gupta 
tagline = Who says that man scripts his own destiny by himself? 
cast = Rajeev Khandelwal, Vasan Bala, Gajraj Rao 
Producer = Ronnie Screwvala 
revenue = 137.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h39 

In the gripping thriller "Aamir," directed by Raj Kumar Gupta and produced by UTV Motion Pictures and Ronnie Screwvala, we follow the intense journey of a doctor of Indian origin, played by Rajeev Khandelwal, who is returning to Mumbai from London only to find himself unwillingly entangled in a terrorist plot. As he navigates through this dangerous situation, questioning the concept of destiny with the tagline "Who says that man scripts his own destiny by himself?," he must make difficult choices that will ultimately determine the fate of many. With a runtime of 1 hour and 39 minutes, the film also features stellar performances by Vasan Bala and Gajraj Rao. "Aamir" not only captivates audiences with its suspenseful storyline but also achieved remarkable success, grossing a staggering $137.4 million at the box office.

As he navigates through this dangerous situation, questioning the concept of destiny with the tagline "Who says that man scripts his own destiny by himself?," he must make difficult choices that will ultimately determine the fate of many. With a runtime of 1 hour and 39 minutes, the film also features stellar performances by Vasan Bala and Gajraj Rao. "Aamir" not only captivates audiences with its suspenseful storyline but also achieved remarkable success, grossing a staggering $137.4 million at the box office.

title = The Lost 
overview = A charismatic psycho suspected of killing two innocent campers in a cold-blooded double homicide grows increasingly unstable as his suburban empire starts to crack at the foundations. 
Producer = Chris Sivertson 
production compagnie = Silver Web Productions 
average note = 6.1 
cast = Marc Senter, Shay Astar, Alex Frost, Megan Henning 
budget = 79.5 millions of dollars 
tagline = What's the worst thing you've ever done? 
duration of the movie = 1h59 
date of release = the 11 of March 2006 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 72.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Chris Sivertson 

In "The Lost," produced by Chris Sivertson under Silver Web Productions, a charismatic psycho is suspected of a cold-blooded double homicide of two innocent campers. As his suburban empire begins to crumble, he descends into increasing instability. Starring Marc Senter, Shay Astar, Alex Frost, and Megan Henning, the film delves into the chilling question: "What's the worst thing you've ever done?" Released on the 11th of March 2006, in English, the movie runs for 1 hour and 59 minutes. With a budget of $79.5 million, it garnered a revenue of $72.0 million, receiving an average rating of 6.1.

title = Florence Foster Jenkins 
overview = The story of Florence Foster Jenkins, a New York heiress, who dreamed of becoming an opera singer, despite having a terrible singing voice. 
revenue = 48.9 millions of dollars 
Director = Stephen Frears 
tagline = People may say I couldn't sing, but no one can say I didn't sing 
Producer = Michael Kuhn 
cast = Meryl Streep, Hugh Grant, Rebecca Ferguson, Simon Helberg 
duration of the movie = 1h50 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 48.9 millions of dollars 

In "Florence Foster Jenkins," directed by Stephen Frears and produced by Michael Kuhn, audiences are taken on a captivating journey into the life of Florence Foster Jenkins, a New York heiress with a passion for opera singing. Despite her dream of becoming an opera singer, Florence faces a unique challenge - she has a terrible singing voice. Played by the talented Meryl Streep, Florence's determination and unwavering spirit shine through as she pursues her passion, supported by her loyal husband portrayed by Hugh Grant. With a stellar cast including Rebecca Ferguson and Simon Helberg, this heartwarming film grossed an impressive $48.9 million at the box office. As the tagline suggests, "People may say I couldn't sing, but no one can say I didn't sing," encapsulating the essence of Florence's inspiring story. With a runtime of 1 hour and 50 minutes, this movie is a testament to the power of following one's dreams, no matter the obstacles faced.

title = 2 Fast 2 Furious 
overview = It's a major double-cross when former police officer Brian O'Conner teams up with his ex-con buddy Roman Pearce to transport a shipment of "dirty" money for shady Miami-based import-export dealer Carter Verone. But the guys are actually working with undercover agent Monica Fuentes to bring Verone down. 
Producer = Neal H. Moritz 
duration of the movie = 1h47 
production compagnie = Mikona Productions GmbH & Co. KG 
revenue = 236.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Neal H. Moritz 

In "2 Fast 2 Furious," produced by Neal H. Moritz, the action-packed thriller follows former police officer Brian O'Conner as he joins forces with his ex-con friend Roman Pearce for a risky mission. Tasked with transporting illicit funds for Miami's shady dealer Carter Verone, the duo finds themselves entangled in a web of betrayal and deceit. With the help of undercover agent Monica Fuentes, they must navigate dangerous waters to bring down Verone. This high-octane adventure, with a runtime of 1 hour and 47 minutes, was a commercial success, grossing a whopping $236.4 million. The production company behind the film is Mikona Productions GmbH & Co. KG. Get ready for a pulse-pounding ride filled with fast cars, thrilling chases, and unexpected twists.

This high-octane adventure, with a runtime of 1 hour and 47 minutes, was a commercial success, grossing a whopping $236.4 million. The production company behind the film is Mikona Productions GmbH & Co. KG. Get ready for a pulse-pounding ride filled with fast cars, thrilling chases, and unexpected twists.

title = Kung Fu Panda 2 
overview = Po is now living his dream as The Dragon Warrior, protecting the Valley of Peace alongside his friends and fellow kung fu masters, The Furious Five - Tigress, Crane, Mantis, Viper and Monkey. But Po’s new life of awesomeness is threatened by the emergence of a formidable villain, who plans to use a secret, unstoppable weapon to conquer China and destroy kung fu. It is up to Po and The Furious Five to journey across China to face this threat and vanquish it. But how can Po stop a weapon that can stop kung fu? He must look to his past and uncover the secrets of his mysterious origins; only then will he be able to unlock the strength he needs to succeed. 
budget = 150.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Melissa Cobb 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 150.0 millions of dollars 

In "Kung Fu Panda 2", Po, the lovable Dragon Warrior, finds himself facing his biggest challenge yet when a formidable villain threatens to conquer China with an unstoppable weapon that can destroy kung fu. Alongside his friends, The Furious Five - Tigress, Crane, Mantis, Viper, and Monkey, Po embarks on a journey across China to confront this danger. As Po grapples with how to defeat this new enemy, he realizes that the key to his success lies in uncovering the secrets of his mysterious origins. With a budget of 150 million dollars and produced by Melissa Cobb in the United States of America, this action-packed sequel is a thrilling adventure that will test Po's strength and determination like never before.

title = Imitation of Life 
overview = A widow and her housekeeper go into business together but almost lose their daughters. 
tagline = Claudette Colbert at her finest in Imitation of Life 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Claudette Colbert, Warren William, Rochelle Hudson, Ned Sparks 
date of release = the 26 of November 1934 
Producer = Carl Laemmle Jr. 
revenue = 8.8 millions of dollars 
Director = John M. Stahl 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Claudette Colbert at her finest in Imitation of Life 

In the 1934 American film "Imitation of Life," directed by John M. Stahl and produced by Carl Laemmle Jr., audiences are taken on an emotional journey following a widow and her housekeeper who join forces in a business venture. Starring the talented cast including Claudette Colbert, Warren William, Rochelle Hudson, and Ned Sparks, the movie showcases Claudette Colbert at her finest. As the story unfolds, the two women face challenges that put their relationship to the test, risking the well-being of their daughters. With a release date of November 26, 1934, "Imitation of Life" grossed an impressive $8.8 million at the box office, solidifying its place as a classic American drama. The film is set in the United States of America.

title = Ladies of Leisure 
overview = Jerry Strong is the son of a rich businessman, but wants to be a painter. He hires Kay Arnold, a good girl with a bad past, as a model. They fall in love, and plan to get married. But Jerry's parents raise strong objections. 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 255.1 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 119.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.4 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
cast = Barbara Stanwyck, Ralph Graves, Lowell Sherman, Marie Prevost 
tagline = ALL TALKING DRAMA OF NEW YORK'S NIGHT LIFE 
Director = Frank Capra 
Producer = Harry Cohn 
date of release = the 5 of April 1930 
duration of the movie = 1h39 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the 1930 film "Ladies of Leisure," directed by Frank Capra and produced by Harry Cohn, we are introduced to Jerry Strong, a wealthy businessman's son who dreams of becoming a painter. When he hires Kay Arnold, a model with a troubled past portrayed by Barbara Stanwyck, as his muse, their professional relationship blossoms into a forbidden romance. Despite their plans to marry, Jerry's parents vehemently oppose the union, setting the stage for a dramatic confrontation. Set against the backdrop of New York's vibrant nightlife, this all-talking drama unfolds with a mix of love, ambition, and societal expectations. With a star-studded cast including Ralph Graves, Lowell Sherman, and Marie Prevost, "Ladies of Leisure" captures the complexities of class divide and personal aspirations. This English-language film, released on April 5, 1930, by Columbia Pictures Corporation, garnered a revenue of 255.1 million dollars against a budget of 119.1 million dollars, with an average rating of 5.4. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 39 minutes. The tagline for the film is "ALL TALKING DRAMA OF NEW YORK'S NIGHT LIFE." The production country of the movie is the United States of America.

['correct']

In the 1930 film "Ladies of Leisure," directed by Frank Capra and produced by Harry Cohn, we are introduced to Jerry Strong, a wealthy businessman's son who dreams of becoming a painter. When he hires Kay Arnold, a model with a troubled past portrayed by Barbara Stanwyck, as his muse, their professional relationship blossoms into a forbidden romance. Despite their plans to marry, Jerry's parents vehemently oppose the union, setting the stage for a dramatic confrontation. Set against the backdrop of New York's vibrant nightlife, this all-talking drama unfolds with a mix of love, ambition, and societal expectations. With a star-studded cast including Ralph Graves, Lowell Sherman, and Marie Prevost, "Ladies of Leisure" captures the complexities of class divide and personal aspirations. This English-language film, released on April 5, 1930, by Columbia Pictures Corporation, garnered a revenue of 255.1 million dollars against a budget of 119.1 million dollars, with an average rating of 5.4. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 39 minutes. The tagline for the film is "ALL TALKING DRAMA OF NEW YORK'S NIGHT LIFE." The production country of the movie is the United States of America.

title = Gorillas in the Mist 
overview = The story of Dian Fossey, a scientist who came to Africa to study the vanishing mountain gorillas, and later fought to protect them. 
average note = 6.7 
duration of the movie = 2h09 
date of release = the 23 of September 1988 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
Producer = Terence A. Clegg 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.7 

In the 1988 film "Gorillas in the Mist," viewers are taken on a captivating journey following the life of Dian Fossey, a dedicated scientist who travels to Africa to study the endangered mountain gorillas. As she delves deeper into her research, Fossey becomes a fierce advocate for the protection of these majestic creatures, facing numerous challenges along the way. Produced by Terence A. Clegg and released by Universal Pictures on the 23rd of September 1988, this English-language film runs for 2 hours and 9 minutes, offering audiences a poignant and insightful look into the world of gorillas and the remarkable woman who fought to save them. With an average rating of 6.7, "Gorillas in the Mist" is a must-see for nature enthusiasts and those passionate about wildlife conservation.

title = The Flight of the Phoenix 
overview = A cargo plane goes down in a sandstorm in the Sahara with less than a dozen men on board. One of the passengers is an airplane designer who comes up with the idea of ripping off the undamaged wing and using it as the basis for an airplane they will build to escape before their food and water run out. 
tagline = Theirs was the triumph - yours, the excitement! 
budget = 45.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 82.8 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
duration of the movie = 2h22 
date of release = the 15 of December 1965 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : tagline = Theirs was the triumph - yours, the excitement! 

In "The Flight of the Phoenix," a gripping tale unfolds as a cargo plane crashes in the unforgiving Sahara desert during a fierce sandstorm, leaving only a handful of men on board. Among the passengers is an ingenious airplane designer who proposes a daring plan to salvage the situation - by utilizing the undamaged wing to construct a new aircraft for their escape before essential supplies dwindle. As tensions rise and resources diminish, the group must band together to defy the odds and survive in the harsh desert landscape. With a budget of 45.0 million dollars, this thrilling American production by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation soared to success, grossing 82.8 million dollars at the box office. Clocking in at 2 hours and 22 minutes, this cinematic masterpiece was released on the 15th of December 1965, captivating audiences with its tale of resilience and ingenuity. "The Flight of the Phoenix" - where triumph meets excitement!

title = Unfaithfully Yours 
overview = Dudley Moore plays a composer who suspects his wife of cheating. He plots to kill her and frame it on her lover. The whole movie sort of compares his expectations of a perfect result to reality. In the end nothing turns out as planned. 
average note = 5.8 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
Director = Howard Zieff 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.8 

In "Unfaithfully Yours," directed by Howard Zieff, Dudley Moore portrays a talented composer who becomes suspicious of his wife's infidelity. As he concocts a devious plan to murder her and pin the blame on her supposed lover, the film delves into the stark contrast between his idealized fantasies and the harsh truths of reality. With an average rating of 5.8, this dark comedy unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 36 minutes, culminating in a twisted and unexpected conclusion where nothing goes according to plan.

With an average rating of 5.8, this dark comedy unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 36 minutes, culminating in a twisted and unexpected conclusion where nothing goes according to plan.

title = My Teacher's Wife 
overview = Todd Boomer is a college student aspiring to get into University. His chances are looking poor when his maths teacher, fails him in every maths test. Help arrives in the guise of the gorgeous Vicki, a mathematical genius who decides to tutor Todd. As the relationship develops,Todd finds himself in an affair with Vicki unknowing of her marriage to his math teacher. 
date of release = the 10 of November 1999 
average note = 5.6 
budget = 98.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Trimark Pictures 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
tagline = Todd Boomer is embracing his homework like never before! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 10 of November 1999 

In the romantic comedy "My Teacher's Wife," college student Todd Boomer is struggling to pass his math tests until he receives help from the stunning Vicki, a math genius who also happens to be married to his math teacher. As Todd's tutoring sessions with Vicki progress, their relationship takes an unexpected turn towards an affair. Released on November 10, 1999, by Trimark Pictures in the United States, this film runs for 1 hour and 29 minutes. With a budget of $98 million, "My Teacher's Wife" received an average rating of 5.6. The tagline "Todd Boomer is embracing his homework like never before!" adds a playful touch to this tale of academic challenges and romantic entanglements.

title = My Favorite Brunette 
overview = Baby photographer Ronnie Jackson, on death row in San Quentin, tells reporters how he got there: taking care of his private-eye neighbor's office, Ronnie is asked by the irresistible Baroness Montay to find the missing Baron. There follow confusing but sinister doings in a gloomy mansion and a private sanatorium, with every plot twist a parody of thriller cliches. 
average note = 6.6 
production compagnie = Hope Enterprises 
tagline = He's a hilarious hawkshaw... with a case on Dottie! 
date of release = the 4 of April 1947 
duration of the movie = 1h27 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.6 

In "My Favorite Brunette," released on the 4th of April 1947 by Hope Enterprises, we follow the misadventures of Ronnie Jackson, a baby photographer turned unwitting detective. When asked by the alluring Baroness Montay to locate her missing husband, Ronnie finds himself embroiled in a series of perplexing and ominous events at a dark mansion and a secluded sanatorium. As he navigates through a maze of parody thriller cliches, Ronnie must use his wit and charm to unravel the mystery. With an average rating of 6.6, this comedic film keeps audiences entertained for 1 hour and 27 minutes. Don't miss out on the laughs and thrills as Ronnie Jackson becomes a hilarious hawkshaw with a case on Dottie in "My Favorite Brunette."

title = Furry Vengeance 
overview = When real estate developer Dan Sanders finalizes plans to level a swath of pristine Oregon forest to make way for a soulless housing subdivision, a band of woodland creatures rises up to throw a monkey wrench into the greedy scheme. Just how much mischief from the furry critters can the businessman take before he calls it quits? 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = United Arab Emirates 

In "Furry Vengeance," real estate developer Dan Sanders is on a mission to clear a beautiful Oregon forest for a new housing subdivision. However, his plans are thwarted by a group of feisty woodland creatures who are determined to protect their home. As the animals unleash a series of hilarious pranks and antics on Dan, he must decide how much chaos he can handle before giving up on his destructive project. Will the furry critters succeed in their mission to save the forest, or will Dan find a way to outsmart them and continue with his greedy scheme?

The facts included in the description are:
- The movie is titled "Furry Vengeance."
- The setting is a pristine Oregon forest.
- The main character is a real estate developer named Dan Sanders.
- Dan's plan is to level the forest for a housing subdivision.
- A group of woodland creatures rises up to stop Dan's plans.
- The animals create mischief and chaos to thwart Dan's project.
- The movie involves a battle between Dan and the furry critters over the fate of the forest.

- The movie involves a battle between Dan and the furry critters over the fate of the forest.

['wrong']
fact : Producer = Robert Simonds 

In "Furry Vengeance," real estate developer Dan Sanders is on a mission to clear a beautiful Oregon forest for a new housing subdivision. However, his plans are thwarted by a group of feisty woodland creatures who are determined to protect their home. As the animals unleash a series of hilarious pranks and antics on Dan, he must decide how much chaos he can handle before giving up on his destructive project. Will the furry critters succeed in their mission to save the forest, or will Dan find a way to outsmart them and continue with his greedy scheme?

The facts included in the description are:
- The movie is titled "Furry Vengeance."
- The setting is a pristine Oregon forest.
- The main character is a real estate developer named Dan Sanders.
- Dan's plan is to level the forest for a housing subdivision.
- A group of woodland creatures rises up to stop Dan's plans.
- The animals create mischief and chaos to thwart Dan's project.
- The movie involves a battle between Dan and the furry critters over the fate of the forest.

title = Letters to Juliet 
overview = An American girl on vacation in Italy finds an unanswered "letter to Juliet" -- one of thousands of missives left at the fictional lover's Verona courtyard, which are typically answered by a the "secretaries of Juliet" -- and she goes on a quest to find the lovers referenced in the letter. 
Producer = Ellen Barkin 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 14 of May 2010 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Summit Entertainment 
Director = Gary Winick 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Ellen Barkin 

In the romantic movie "Letters to Juliet," produced by Ellen Barkin and directed by Gary Winick, a young American girl embarks on a journey in Italy after discovering an unanswered "letter to Juliet" in Verona. Released on the 14th of May 2010 by Summit Entertainment, this heartwarming tale follows her quest to find the lovers mentioned in the letter, set against the backdrop of the beautiful Italian countryside. With a budget of 30.0 million dollars, this film captures the essence of love, hope, and the magic of unexpected connections. The production country for "Letters to Juliet" is the United States of America.

title = The Fly II 
overview = Martin Brundle, born of the human/fly, is adopted by his father's place of employment (Bartok Inc.) while the employees simply wait for his mutant chromosomes to come out of their dormant state. 
cast = Eric Stoltz, Daphne Zuniga, Lee Richardson, John Getz 
production countrie = Canada 
date of release = the 10 of February 1989 
revenue = 38.9 millions of dollars 
tagline = Like Father Like Son 
budget = 134.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h45 
average note = 5.2 
Producer = Steven-Charles Jaffe 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Brooksfilms 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Eric Stoltz, Daphne Zuniga, Lee Richardson, John Getz 

The Fly II is a Canadian production released on the 10th of February 1989. The movie follows Martin Brundle, the son of the human/fly hybrid, who is raised by Bartok Inc., his father's workplace, in anticipation of his mutant genes emerging. The film stars Eric Stoltz, Daphne Zuniga, Lee Richardson, and John Getz. Despite a budget of $134.1 million, it grossed $38.9 million at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 45 minutes, the movie holds an average rating of 5.2. The tagline for the film is "Like Father Like Son." Produced by Steven-Charles Jaffe and under the production company Brooksfilms, The Fly II explores the consequences of genetic experimentation in the realm of science fiction horror. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Two for the Road 
overview = The ten-year marriage of Mark and Joanna Wallace is on the rocks. In flashback they recall their first meeting, memorable moments in their courtship and early wedded life, their travels through Europe, their broken vow never to have children, and their increasing tensions that led to both of them having extra-marital affairs. 
cast = Audrey Hepburn, Albert Finney, Georges Descrières, Claude Dauphin 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
tagline = They make something wonderful out of being alive! 
average note = 7.2 
budget = 200.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Audrey Hepburn, Albert Finney, Georges Descrières, Claude Dauphin 

In the British film "Two for the Road," Audrey Hepburn and Albert Finney star as the troubled couple, Mark and Joanna Wallace, whose ten-year marriage is on the verge of collapse. Through a series of flashbacks, viewers witness the ups and downs of their relationship - from their first meeting to memorable moments in their courtship, travels through Europe, and their broken vow to remain childless. As tensions rise, both Mark and Joanna find themselves entangled in extramarital affairs, further straining their bond. Set against the backdrop of Europe, this poignant tale explores love, betrayal, and the complexities of marriage. With a tagline that promises they make something wonderful out of being alive, "Two for the Road" captivates audiences with its emotional depth and stellar performances by Hepburn and Finney. The film was produced in the United Kingdom and has an average rating of 7.2. The supporting cast includes Georges Descrières and Claude Dauphin. The budget for the movie was 200.3 million dollars, and it was originally filmed in English.

['correct']

As tensions rise, both Mark and Joanna find themselves entangled in extramarital affairs, further straining their bond. Set against the backdrop of Europe, this poignant tale explores love, betrayal, and the complexities of marriage. With a tagline that promises they make something wonderful out of being alive, "Two for the Road" captivates audiences with its emotional depth and stellar performances by Hepburn and Finney. The film was produced in the United Kingdom and has an average rating of 7.2. The supporting cast includes Georges Descrières and Claude Dauphin. The budget for the movie was 200.3 million dollars, and it was originally filmed in English.

Through a series of flashbacks, viewers witness the ups and downs of their relationship - from their first meeting to memorable moments in their courtship, travels through Europe, and their broken vow to remain childless. title = Satanás - Profile of a Killer 
overview = Based on the Mario Mendoza's book and inspired by true events, tells three interconnected stories happening in the eve of the infamous Pozzetto Massacre. 
Producer = Rodrigo Guerrero 
average note = 7.8 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
cast = Damián Alcázar, Blas Jaramillo, Marcela Mar, Marcela Valencia 
production compagnie = Proyecto Tucan 
date of release = the 4 of March 2007 
production countrie = Colombia 
budget = 118.9 millions of dollars 
tagline = Do you believe in pain, in forgiveness, in fate? No matter what you believe in. You'll end up facing it 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
revenue = 229.4 millions of dollars 
Director = Andrés Baiz 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Rodrigo Guerrero 

In "Satanás - Profile of a Killer," directed by Andrés Baiz and produced by Rodrigo Guerrero, viewers are taken on a gripping journey through three interconnected stories set on the eve of the notorious Pozzetto Massacre. Inspired by true events and based on Mario Mendoza's book, this Spanish-language film delves into themes of pain, forgiveness, and fate. Starring Damián Alcázar, Blas Jaramillo, Marcela Mar, and Marcela Valencia, the movie explores the dark and haunting events leading up to the tragic incident. With a budget of 118.9 million dollars, the film's release on March 4, 2007, captivated audiences in Colombia and beyond. Despite its intense subject matter, "Satanás" received an average rating of 7.8 and grossed an impressive 229.4 million dollars in revenue. As the tagline suggests, no matter what you believe in, you'll end up facing the chilling realities portrayed in this thought-provoking thriller.

title = Homebodies 
overview = When a quiet group of pensioners learn that their homes are to be torn down to make way for a block of flats, they decide to take action. What starts as an attempt to discourage the developers soon escalates into wholesale murder of both the developers and the construction workers. 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Peter Brocco, Frances Fuller, William Hansen, Ruth McDevitt 
budget = 294.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Cinema Entertainment 
date of release = the 1 of September 1974 
Director = Larry Yust 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Do You Know Where Your Grandmother Is Tonight? 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
revenue = 139.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = Marshall Backlar 
average note = 7.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the thrilling movie "Homebodies," a group of quiet pensioners find themselves facing the threat of their homes being demolished to make way for a new development. What begins as a peaceful protest quickly spirals into a series of shocking events, as the pensioners take matters into their own hands with deadly consequences. Directed by Larry Yust and released on the 1st of September 1974, this English-language film features a talented cast including Peter Brocco, Frances Fuller, William Hansen, and Ruth McDevitt. Produced by Marshall Backlar under Cinema Entertainment, the movie captivates audiences with its dark humor and unexpected twists. With a budget of 294.0 million dollars, "Homebodies" managed to generate a revenue of 139.1 million dollars, proving to be a success at the box office. The tagline "Do You Know Where Your Grandmother Is Tonight?" adds an eerie touch to this 1 hour and 36 minutes long film, which received an average rating of 7.3.

title = The King and I 
overview = Mrs. Anna Leonowens and her son Louis arrive in Bangkok, where she has contracted to teach English to the children of the royal household. She threatens to leave when the house she had been promised is not available, but falls in love with the children. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 7.3 

In "The King and I," Mrs. Anna Leonowens and her son Louis journey to Bangkok, where she is set to teach English to the royal children. Despite facing initial challenges such as the unavailability of the promised house, Mrs. Anna forms a deep bond with the children. As the story unfolds, viewers witness a heartwarming tale of love, cultural exchange, and the transformative power of education in a foreign land. The musical also explores the complex relationship that develops between Mrs. Anna and the King of Siam, King Mongkut, as they navigate their differences and learn from each other. Additionally, the iconic songs and elaborate costumes in the production have captivated audiences for generations, making "The King and I" a timeless classic in the world of musical theater.

Additionally, the iconic songs and elaborate costumes in the production have captivated audiences for generations, making "The King and I" a timeless classic in the world of musical theater.

title = On Golden Pond 
overview = The loons are back again on Golden Pond and so are Norman Thayer, a retired professor, and Ethel who have had a summer cottage there since early in their marriage. This summer their daughter Chelsea -- whom they haven't seen for years -- feels she must be there for Norman's birthday. She and her fiance are on their way to Europe the next day but will be back in a couple of weeks to pick up the fiance's son. When she returns Chelsea is married and her stepson has the relationship with her father that she always wanted. Will father and daughter be able to communicate at last? 
revenue = 19.3 millions of dollars 
Director = Mark Rydell 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 4 of December 1981 
average note = 7.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 19.3 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming film "On Golden Pond," directed by Mark Rydell, viewers are transported to the serene setting of Golden Pond where Norman Thayer, a retired professor, and his wife Ethel spend their summers. Their peaceful retreat is interrupted when their estranged daughter Chelsea makes a surprise visit for Norman's birthday, bringing along her fiance and his son. As the family navigates past resentments and new dynamics, a touching bond forms between Chelsea's stepson and Norman, mirroring the relationship Chelsea always longed for with her father. Against the backdrop of the loons returning to Golden Pond, will this summer bring healing and reconciliation for the Thayer family? Released on December 4, 1981, by Universal Pictures, this emotional tale resonated with audiences, earning $19.3 million at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes, "On Golden Pond" is a poignant exploration of family, communication, and the enduring power of love. The movie was produced in the United States of America and is in English. The average note for the film is 7.3.

title = Foster 
overview = Some years after their son is killed, a married couple decide to adopt a child. One day a 7-year-old boy, Eli, unexpectedly arrives on their doorstep and things take a strange turn. 
production compagnie = Kintop Pictures 
budget = 212.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 97.2 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
tagline = A family opens its door to a miracle. 
average note = 6.7 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Toni Collette, Ioan Gruffudd, Maurice Cole, Richard E. Grant 
Producer = Deepak Nayar 
Director = Jonathan Newman 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Kintop Pictures 

In the heartwarming film "Foster," produced by Kintop Pictures and directed by Jonathan Newman, a married couple, portrayed by Toni Collette and Ioan Gruffudd, grapple with the loss of their son. Their lives take an unexpected turn when a 7-year-old boy named Eli, played by Maurice Cole, shows up on their doorstep. As they navigate this new reality, with the support of Richard E. Grant's character, they discover that family can come in unexpected forms. With a budget of 212.0 million dollars and a revenue of 97.2 million dollars, the film beautifully captures the emotional journey of adoption and the resilience of the human spirit. Set in the United Kingdom and with an average rating of 6.7, "Foster" runs for 1 hour and 30 minutes in its original English language. The tagline "A family opens its door to a miracle" perfectly encapsulates the heartwarming essence of this touching story. The cast also includes Toni Collette, Ioan Gruffudd, Maurice Cole, and Richard E. Grant. The producer of the film is Deepak Nayar.

In the heartwarming film "Foster," produced by Kintop Pictures and directed by Jonathan Newman, a married couple, portrayed by Toni Collette and Ioan Gruffudd, grapple with the loss of their son. Their lives take an unexpected turn when a 7-year-old boy named Eli, played by Maurice Cole, shows up on their doorstep. As they navigate this new reality, with the support of Richard E. Grant's character, they discover that family can come in unexpected forms. With a budget of 212.0 million dollars and a revenue of 97.2 million dollars, the film beautifully captures the emotional journey of adoption and the resilience of the human spirit. Set in the United Kingdom and with an average rating of 6.7, "Foster" runs for 1 hour and 30 minutes in its original English language. The tagline "A family opens its door to a miracle" perfectly encapsulates the heartwarming essence of this touching story. The cast also includes Toni Collette, Ioan Gruffudd, Maurice Cole, and Richard E. Grant. The producer of the film is Deepak Nayar.

title = Smash Palace 
overview = Al Shaw's life revolves around motor racing and his back country junkyard, the "Smash Palace". His French wife, Jacqui, doesn't appreciate the lack of attention due to Al's obsession with cars. When Al finds her in the arms of another man, he takes his daughter, Georgie and heads for the bush, desperately hoping to hold on to the only family he has left. Written by Evan Yates 
production compagnie = New Zealand Film Commission 
date of release = the 30 of April 1982 
Director = Roger Donaldson 
average note = 5.4 
revenue = 208.7 millions of dollars 
budget = 39.7 millions of dollars 
cast = Bruno Lawrence, Anna Maria Monticelli, Greer Robson, Keith Aberdein 
production countrie = New Zealand 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = New Zealand Film Commission 

In the 1982 film "Smash Palace," directed by Roger Donaldson and produced by New Zealand Film Commission, we are introduced to Al Shaw, a man whose life revolves around motor racing and his junkyard known as the "Smash Palace." His marriage to his French wife, Jacqui, becomes strained due to his obsession with cars, leading to a heartbreaking discovery that pushes him to take drastic action. After finding Jacqui with another man, Al flees into the bush with his daughter, Georgie, in a desperate attempt to salvage what remains of his family. Starring Bruno Lawrence, Anna Maria Monticelli, Greer Robson, and Keith Aberdein, this emotionally charged drama explores themes of love, loss, and the lengths one will go to protect their loved ones. With an average rating of 5.4, "Smash Palace" managed to generate a revenue of 208.7 million dollars against a budget of 39.7 million dollars, solidifying its place as a noteworthy film from New Zealand. The film was released on the 30th of April 1982 and was produced in New Zealand.

title = Xtro 
overview = Tony's father Sam, abducted by aliens three years earlier, returns to earth and seeks out his wife and son, but Rachel has since been living with Joe and the reunion is awkward. Joe doesn't trust Sam, and Rachel can't quite decide what her feelings are for her two men. Sam is not the same as when he left, and he begins affecting Tony in frightening ways. 
production compagnie = Amalgamated Film Enterprises 
tagline = Some extra-terrestrials aren't friendly. 
cast = Bernice Stegers, Philip Sayer, Simon Nash, Maryam d'Abo 
budget = 272.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Amalgamated Film Enterprises 

In the sci-fi horror film "Xtro," directed by Amalgamated Film Enterprises, Tony's world is turned upside down when his father, Sam, who was abducted by aliens, mysteriously returns to Earth after three years. As Sam tries to reconnect with his wife, Rachel, and son, Tony, tensions arise as Rachel has moved on with another man, Joe. The reunion is fraught with unease as Joe distrusts Sam, and Rachel grapples with conflicting emotions towards both men. However, it becomes clear that Sam is not the same person he once was, and his presence begins to have terrifying effects on Tony. As the family dynamic unravels, they must confront the sinister truth behind Sam's alien encounter. With a budget of 272.0 million dollars, "Xtro," delivers a chilling tale of extraterrestrial terror where some visitors from beyond the stars are anything but friendly. Starring Bernice Stegers, Philip Sayer, Simon Nash, and Maryam d'Abo, this film will leave audiences questioning the true nature of the unknown.

As Sam tries to reconnect with his wife, Rachel, and son, Tony, tensions arise as Rachel has moved on with another man, Joe. The reunion is fraught with unease as Joe distrusts Sam, and Rachel grapples with conflicting emotions towards both men. However, it becomes clear that Sam is not the same person he once was, and his presence begins to have terrifying effects on Tony. As the family dynamic unravels, they must confront the sinister truth behind Sam's alien encounter. With a budget of 272.0 million dollars, "Xtro," delivers a chilling tale of extraterrestrial terror where some visitors from beyond the stars are anything but friendly. Starring Bernice Stegers, Philip Sayer, Simon Nash, and Maryam d'Abo, this film will leave audiences questioning the true nature of the unknown. 
 
 

 
title = Big Jake 
overview = An aging Texas cattle man who has outlived his time swings into action when outlaws kidnap his grandson. 
tagline = They wanted gold. They gave them lead instead! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = They wanted gold. They gave them lead instead! 

In "Big Jake," an aging Texas cattle man finds himself facing a dangerous situation when outlaws kidnap his grandson. With a tagline that promises "They wanted gold. They gave them lead instead!" this action-packed film follows the cattle man as he swings into action to rescue his family member. As the stakes get higher and the danger increases, the old cowboy must rely on his experience and skills to outsmart the outlaws and bring his grandson back home safely. Get ready for a thrilling ride full of suspense, loyalty, and the unbreakable bond between a grandfather and his grandson.

title = This Property Is Condemned 
overview = A railroad official, Owen Legate comes to Dodson, Mississippi to shut down much of the town's railway (town's main income). Owen unexpectedly finds love with Dodson's flirt and main attraction, Alva Starr. Alva and Owen then try to escape Alva's mother's (Hazel) clutches and the town's revenge. 
date of release = the 3 of August 1966 
Director = Sydney Pollack 
Producer = John Houseman 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.1 
budget = 136.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 3 of August 1966 

In the 1966 film "This Property Is Condemned," directed by Sydney Pollack and produced by John Houseman, a railroad official named Owen Legate arrives in Dodson, Mississippi with the intention of shutting down much of the town's railway, which is its main source of income. Despite this contentious mission, Owen unexpectedly finds himself falling in love with Alva Starr, Dodson's charismatic flirt and main attraction. As their relationship blossoms, Alva and Owen must navigate the challenges posed by Alva's overbearing mother, Hazel, and the town seeking revenge. With an average rating of 6.1, this English-language film was released on the 3rd of August 1966 with a budget of 136.8 million dollars.

title = Lizzie Borden Took An Ax 
overview = Lizzie Borden Took An Ax chronicles the scandal and enduring mystery surrounding Lizzie Borden, who was tried in 1892 for axing her parents to death. As the case rages on, the courtroom proceedings fuel an enormous amount of sensationalized stories and headlines in newspapers throughout the country, forever leaving Lizzie Borden’s name in infamy. 
duration of the movie = 1h31 
cast = Christina Ricci, Clea DuVall, Gregg Henry, Stephen McHattie 
average note = 5.6 
budget = 271.9 millions of dollars 
revenue = 8.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h31 

In "Lizzie Borden Took An Ax," viewers are taken back to the infamous 1892 trial of Lizzie Borden, who was accused of brutally axing her parents to death. The movie delves into the scandal and enduring mystery surrounding the case, showcasing how the courtroom proceedings sparked sensationalized stories and headlines in newspapers across the country. Starring Christina Ricci, Clea DuVall, Gregg Henry, and Stephen McHattie, this gripping film runs for 1 hour and 31 minutes. Despite a star-studded cast and a budget of a staggering $271.9 million, the movie only managed to rake in $8.9 million in revenue. With an average rating of 5.6, "Lizzie Borden Took An Ax" leaves a lasting impression as it immortalizes the name of Lizzie Borden in the annals of infamy.

title = Big Trouble 
overview = The story of how a mysterious suitcase brings together, and changes, the lives of a divorced dad, an unhappy housewife, two hitmen, a pair of street thugs, two love struck teens, two FBI men and a psychedelic toad. Based on Pulitzer Prize-winning humorist Dave Barry's best-selling first novel, "Big Trouble." 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Barry Sonnenfeld 
date of release = the 5 of April 2002 
average note = 6.3 
tagline = They have forty-five minutes to save the world. They need forty-six. 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Tim Allen, Rene Russo, Patrick Warburton, Ben Foster 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the action-packed comedy "Big Trouble," directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, a diverse group of individuals find their lives intertwined by a mysterious suitcase. This suitcase sets off a chain of events that involve a divorced dad, an unhappy housewife, two hitmen, street thugs, love-struck teens, FBI agents, and even a psychedelic toad. Set in the United States of America, this film, based on Dave Barry's best-selling novel, is a wild ride filled with humor and unexpected twists. With an average rating of 6.3, the movie was released on the 5th of April 2002, featuring a star-studded cast including Tim Allen, Rene Russo, Patrick Warburton, and Ben Foster. As the characters race against time with the tagline "They have forty-five minutes to save the world. They need forty-six," "Big Trouble" promises non-stop entertainment and laughter for viewers. The original language of the movie is English.

In the action-packed comedy "Big Trouble," directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, a diverse group of individuals find their lives intertwined by a mysterious suitcase. This suitcase sets off a chain of events that involve a divorced dad, an unhappy housewife, two hitmen, street thugs, love-struck teens, FBI agents, and even a psychedelic toad. Set in the United States of America, this film, based on Dave Barry's best-selling novel, is a wild ride filled with humor and unexpected twists. With an average rating of 6.3, the movie was released on the 5th of April 2002, featuring a star-studded cast including Tim Allen, Rene Russo, Patrick Warburton, and Ben Foster. As the characters race against time with the tagline "They have forty-five minutes to save the world. They need forty-six," "Big Trouble" promises non-stop entertainment and laughter for viewers. The original language of the movie is English.

title = The Devil's Backbone 
overview = After losing his father, 10-year-old Carlos arrives at the Santa Lucia School, which shelters orphans of the Republican militia and politicians, and is taken in by the steely headmistress, Carmen, and the kindly professor, Casares. Soon after his arrival, Carlos has a run-in with the violent caretaker, Jacinto. Gradually, Carlos uncovers the secrets of the school, including the youthful ghost that wanders the grounds. 
Producer = Guillermo del Toro 
production countrie = Spain 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Guillermo del Toro 

In Guillermo del Toro's haunting masterpiece, "The Devil's Backbone," we are transported to the Santa Lucia School in Spain, a refuge for orphans of the Republican militia and politicians. The story follows 10-year-old Carlos, who, after losing his father, finds solace under the care of the stern headmistress, Carmen, and the compassionate professor, Casares. However, the tranquility of the school is shattered by the menacing presence of the violent caretaker, Jacinto. As Carlos delves deeper into the mysteries of the school, he discovers the chilling secret of a ghostly figure that roams the grounds, seeking justice from beyond the grave. Amidst the backdrop of political turmoil and personal loss, "The Devil's Backbone" weaves a tale of suspense, betrayal, and the supernatural, leaving audiences spellbound till the very end.

Producer: Guillermo del Toro
Production Country: Spain

['correct']

Amidst the backdrop of political turmoil and personal loss, "The Devil's Backbone" weaves a tale of suspense, betrayal, and the supernatural, leaving audiences spellbound till the very end.

title = Amreeka 
overview = Eager to provide a better future for her son, Fadi (Melkar Muallem), divorcée Muna Farah (Nisreen Faour) leaves her Palestinian homeland and takes up residence in rural Illinois -- just in time to encounter the domestic repercussions of America's disastrous war in Iraq. Now, the duo must reinvent their lives with some help from Muna's sister, Raghda (Hiam Abbass), and brother-in-law, Nabeel (Yussuf Abu-Warda). Cherien Dabis writes and directs. 
Producer = Liz Jarvis 
budget = 11.2 millions of dollars 
tagline = Life's best adventures are journeys of the heart. 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
cast = Nisreen Faour, Melkar Muallem, Hiam Abbass, Alia Shawkat 
date of release = the 17 of January 2009 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Liz Jarvis 

In "Amreeka", directed and written by Cherien Dabis, we follow the story of Muna Farah, portrayed by Nisreen Faour, as she embarks on a journey from her Palestinian homeland to rural Illinois with her son Fadi, played by Melkar Muallem. Eager to secure a better future for her family, Muna faces the challenges of adapting to a new life in America, just as the repercussions of the Iraq war unfold domestically. With the support of her sister Raghda (Hiam Abbass) and brother-in-law Nabeel (Yussuf Abu-Warda), Muna and Fadi navigate the complexities of reinventing their lives in a foreign land. The film, released on January 17, 2009, explores themes of family, resilience, and the pursuit of the American dream. With a budget of 11.2 million dollars, "Amreeka" runs for 1 hour and 36 minutes, featuring a talented cast including Alia Shawkat alongside the lead actors. As the tagline suggests, this movie beautifully captures how life's best adventures are truly journeys of the heart. The producer of "Amreeka" is Liz Jarvis.

Eager to secure a better future for her family, Muna faces the challenges of adapting to a new life in America, just as the repercussions of the Iraq war unfold domestically. With the support of her sister Raghda (Hiam Abbass) and brother-in-law Nabeel (Yussuf Abu-Warda), Muna and Fadi navigate the complexities of reinventing their lives in a foreign land. The film, released on January 17, 2009, explores themes of family, resilience, and the pursuit of the American dream. With a budget of 11.2 million dollars, "Amreeka" runs for 1 hour and 36 minutes, featuring a talented cast including Alia Shawkat alongside the lead actors. As the tagline suggests, this movie beautifully captures how life's best adventures are truly journeys of the heart. The producer of "Amreeka" is Liz Jarvis.

title = Harriet Craig 
overview = Domineering Harriet Craig holds more regard for her home and its possessions than she does for any person in her life. Among those she treats like household objects are her kind husband Walter, whom she has lied to about her inability to have children; her cousin Claire, whom she treats like a secretary; and her servants whom she treats like slaves. Summary written by Daniel Bubbeo. 
Producer = William Dozier 
tagline = What was Harriet Craig's lie? 
average note = 7.3 
budget = 99.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
revenue = 269.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Vincent Sherman 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = William Dozier 

In "Harriet Craig," directed by Vincent Sherman and produced by William Dozier, viewers are taken into the world of the titular character, Harriet Craig. Harriet is a domineering woman who values her possessions more than the people in her life, including her husband Walter, whom she has deceived about her inability to have children. As the story unfolds, we see Harriet's manipulative behavior towards her cousin Claire, whom she treats as a mere secretary, and her servants, whom she treats as slaves. Set in the United States of America and filmed by Columbia Pictures Corporation, this gripping drama delves into the consequences of Harriet's lies and selfish actions. With an average rating of 7.3, "Harriet Craig" captivates audiences for 1 hour and 30 minutes in English language. The movie's budget of 99.7 million dollars proves to be a wise investment, as it rakes in a revenue of 269.5 million dollars. The tagline "What was Harriet Craig's lie?" sets the stage for a compelling exploration of deceit and manipulation in this riveting film.

In "How to Make a Monster," master monster make-up man Pete Dumond finds himself out of a job after being fired by the new bosses of American International Studios. Seeking revenge, he utilizes his incredible creations to wreak havoc. With a stellar cast including Robert H. Harris, Paul Brinegar, Gary Conway, and Gary Clarke, this English-language film produced by American International Pictures (AIP) and helmed by producer Herman Cohen takes viewers on a thrilling ride. Despite a budget of 51.1 million dollars, the movie managed to rake in an impressive 238.5 million dollars at the box office, captivating audiences with an average rating of 5.2. The production country of the movie is the United States of America.

title = Moulin Rouge! 
overview = A celebration of love and creative inspiration takes place in the infamous, gaudy and glamorous Parisian nightclub, at the cusp of the 20th century. A young poet, who is plunged into the heady world of Moulin Rouge, begins a passionate affair with the club's most notorious and beautiful star. 
production countrie = Australia 
tagline = No Laws. No Limits. One Rule. Never Fall In Love. 
duration of the movie = 2h07 
average note = 7.4

cast = Nicole Kidman, Ewan McGregor, John Leguizamo, Jim Broadbent 
Producer = Steve E. Andrews 
revenue = 179.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Bazmark Films 
Director = Baz Luhrmann 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Australia 

In the heart of the gaudy and glamorous Parisian nightclub, Moulin Rouge, a young poet finds himself entangled in a whirlwind of love and creative inspiration. Directed by Baz Luhrmann and set at the cusp of the 20th century, this Australian production showcases a passionate affair between the poet and the club's most notorious star, played by Nicole Kidman. As the tagline suggests, "No Laws. No Limits. One Rule. Never Fall In Love," the film explores the boundaries of love and artistry. With a runtime of 2 hours and 7 minutes, Moulin Rouge! captivates audiences with its English dialogue and a stellar cast including Ewan McGregor, John Leguizamo, and Jim Broadbent. Released on the 9th of March 2001, the movie received an average rating of 7.4 and grossed a remarkable $179.2 million against a budget of $52.5 million, making it a dazzling spectacle from start to finish. The production company behind this cinematic masterpiece is Bazmark Films, and the producer is Steve E. Andrews.

title = Experimenter 
overview = Yale University, 1961. Stanley Milgram designs a psychology experiment that still resonates to this day, in which people think they’re delivering painful electric shocks to an affable stranger strapped into a chair in another room. Despite his pleads for mercy, the majority of subjects don’t stop the experiment, administering what they think is a near-fatal electric shock, simply because they’ve been told to do so. With Nazi Adolf Eichmann’s trial airing in living rooms across America, Milgram strikes a nerve in popular culture and the scientific community with his exploration into people’s tendency to comply with authority. Celebrated in some circles, he is also accused of being a deceptive, manipulative monster, but his wife Sasha stands by him through it all. 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 22.9 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
Director = Michael Almereyda 
tagline = The Stanley Milgram Story 
Producer = Danny A. Abeckaser 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 16 of October 2015 
cast = Peter Sarsgaard, Winona Ryder, Edoardo Ballerini, Jim Gaffigan 
average note = 6.8 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "Experimenter," a thought-provoking film directed by Michael Almereyda, viewers are transported to Yale University in 1961. The movie delves into the infamous psychology experiment conducted by Stanley Milgram, portrayed by Peter Sarsgaard, where participants are led to believe they are administering electric shocks to a stranger. Despite the stranger's pleas for mercy, the majority of subjects continue the experiment, highlighting the chilling tendency of individuals to comply with authority figures. As the trial of Nazi Adolf Eichmann unfolds on television screens across America, Milgram's work sparks discussions in both popular culture and the scientific community. Winona Ryder shines as Sasha, Milgram's supportive wife, amidst the controversy surrounding his methods. With a budget of 22.9 million dollars, a runtime of 1 hour and 37 minutes, and a release date of October 16, 2015, "Experimenter" offers a captivating exploration of human behavior and the impact of authority.

The production country of the movie is the United States of America. The tagline of the film is "The Stanley Milgram Story." The producer of the movie is Danny A. Abeckaser. The original language of the movie is English. The cast includes Peter Sarsgaard, Winona Ryder, Edoardo Ballerini, and Jim Gaffigan. The average note for the movie is 6.8.

['correct']

title = Hell Comes to Frogtown 
overview = 'Hell' is the name of the hero of the story. He's a prisoner of the women who now run the USA after a nuclear/biological war. Results of the war are that mutants have evolved, and the human race is in danger of extinction due to infertility. Hell is given the task of helping in the rescue of a group of fertile women from the harem of the mutant leader (resembling a frog). Hell cannot escape since he has a bomb attached to his private parts which will detonate if he strays more than a few hundred yards from his guard. 
budget = 141.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = R.J. Kizer 
cast = Roddy Piper, Sandahl Bergman, William Smith, Rory Calhoun 
revenue = 282.7 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.7 
tagline = A new breed of enemy has taken over the world... Sam Hell has come to take it back. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 141.5 millions of dollars 

In a post-apocalyptic United States, where mutants threaten the survival of the human race due to infertility, a reluctant hero named Hell finds himself in a perilous situation. Forced to assist in rescuing a group of fertile women from a mutant leader resembling a frog, Hell must navigate a dangerous mission with a literal ticking time bomb attached to his private parts. Directed by R.J. Kizer, "Hell Comes to Frogtown" features a stellar cast including Roddy Piper, Sandahl Bergman, William Smith, and Rory Calhoun. With a budget of 141.5 million dollars, the film garnered a revenue of 282.7 million dollars, captivating audiences with its unique storyline. As Hell battles against formidable foes, the tagline "A new breed of enemy has taken over the world... Sam Hell has come to take it back" sets the tone for this action-packed adventure. The movie has a duration of 1h28 and is in the English language. It was produced in the United States of America and has an average note of 5.7. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h28 

In a post-apocalyptic United States, where mutants threaten the survival of the human race due to infertility, a reluctant hero named Hell finds himself in a perilous situation. Forced to assist in rescuing a group of fertile women from a mutant leader resembling a frog, Hell must navigate a dangerous mission with a literal ticking time bomb attached to his private parts. Directed by R.J. Kizer, "Hell Comes to Frogtown" features a stellar cast including Roddy Piper, Sandahl Bergman, William Smith, and Rory Calhoun. With a budget of 141.5 million dollars, the film garnered a revenue of 282.7 million dollars, captivating audiences with its unique storyline. As Hell battles against formidable foes, the tagline "A new breed of enemy has taken over the world... Sam Hell has come to take it back" sets the tone for this action-packed adventure. The movie has a duration of 1h28 and is in the English language. It was produced in the United States of America and has an average note of 5.7.

title = 1984 
overview = In a totalitarian future society, a man whose daily work is rewriting history tries to rebel by falling in love. 
Producer = N. Peter Rathvon 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 193.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = N. Peter Rathvon 

In the dystopian world of "1984," produced by N. Peter Rathvon, we are taken on a journey into a totalitarian society where history is constantly rewritten. The protagonist, a man tasked with altering the past, finds himself drawn to rebellion through the powerful emotion of love. As the story unfolds in its original English language, viewers are immersed in a gripping narrative that challenges the boundaries of control and freedom. With a budget of 193.5 million dollars, this 1 hour and 30-minute film captivates audiences with its thought-provoking themes and intense portrayal of a society on the brink of collapse.

title = Charlie Wilson's War 
overview = The true story of Texas congressman Charlie Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan, where his efforts to assist rebels in their war with the Soviets had some unforeseen and long-reaching effects. 
original language of the movie = English

fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Charlie Wilson's War," viewers are taken on a gripping journey through the true story of Texas congressman Charlie Wilson. As he engages in covert dealings in Afghanistan, Wilson's mission to aid rebels in their fight against the Soviets sets off a chain of events with unforeseen and far-reaching consequences. The movie is based on true events.

title = In Tranzit 
overview = Nazi POWs suspected of heinous acts are locked up in a Soviet women's prison run by vengeful female guards. To weed out the guilty, the innocent must pay. Can supposed enemies turn into great loves? Based on a true post-World War II story, this drama stars Thomas Kretschmann, John Malkovich and Vera Farmiga in a bitter game of cat and mouse and a battle between hate and humanity, mercy and revenge. 
production countrie = Russia 
tagline = From her greatest enemy came her greatest love. 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Daniel Brühl, Patrick Kennedy, Vera Farmiga, John Lynch 
production compagnie = Thema Production 
Producer = Jimmy de Brabant 
budget = 221.1 millions of dollars 
revenue = 67.4 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 16 of May 2007 
average note = 6.2 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
Director = Tom Roberts 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Russia 

In "In Tranzit," a gripping drama set in a Soviet women's prison post-World War II, Nazi POWs find themselves under suspicion for heinous acts, leading to a tense battle of wits and emotions. Led by a stellar cast including Thomas Kretschmann, John Malkovich, and Vera Farmiga, the film delves into the complexities of hate and humanity, mercy and revenge. As the vengeful female guards seek justice, the innocent are caught in a dangerous game where love may unexpectedly bloom. Based on a true story, this English-language production from Russia, directed by Tom Roberts and produced by Jimmy de Brabant for Thema Production, explores the blurred lines between enemies and lovers. With a budget of 221.1 million dollars and a revenue of 67.4 million dollars, "In Tranzit" was released on May 16, 2007, to critical acclaim with an average rating of 6.2. Don't miss this captivating tale where the tagline rings true: "From her greatest enemy came her greatest love."

Facts included in the final description:
- Title: In Tranzit
- Overview of the movie
- Production country: Russia
- Tagline: "From her greatest enemy came her greatest love."
- Original language of the movie: English
- Cast: Daniel Brühl, Patrick Kennedy, Vera Farmiga, John Lynch
- Production company: Thema Production
- Producer: Jimmy de Brabant
- Budget: 221.1 million dollars
- Revenue: 67.4 million dollars
- Date of release: May 16, 2007
- Average rating: 6.2
- Duration of the movie: 1h53
- Director: Tom Roberts

- Director: Tom Roberts

['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Thema Production 

In "In Tranzit," a gripping drama set in a Soviet women's prison post-World War II, Nazi POWs find themselves under suspicion for heinous acts, leading to a tense battle of wits and emotions. Led by a stellar cast including Thomas Kretschmann, John Malkovich, and Vera Farmiga, the film delves into the complexities of hate and humanity, mercy and revenge. As the vengeful female guards seek justice, the innocent are caught in a dangerous game where love may unexpectedly bloom. Based on a true story, this English-language production from Russia, directed by Tom Roberts and produced by Jimmy de Brabant for Thema Production, explores the blurred lines between enemies and lovers. With a budget of 221.1 million dollars and a revenue of 67.4 million dollars, "In Tranzit" was released on May 16, 2007, to critical acclaim with an average rating of 6.2. Don't miss this captivating tale where the tagline rings true: "From her greatest enemy came her greatest love."

- Budget: 221.1 million dollars
- Revenue: 67.4 million dollars

title = Legion 
overview = When God loses faith in humankind, he sends his legion of angels to bring on the Apocalypse. Humanity's only hope for survival lies in a group of strangers trapped in an out-of-the-way, desert diner with the Archangel Michael. 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
tagline = When the last angel falls, the fight for mankind begins. 
budget = 26.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 21 of January 2010 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Bold Films 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 67.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Peter Schink 
Director = Scott Stewart 
cast = Paul Bettany, Dennis Quaid, Kevin Durand, Kate Walsh 
average note = 5.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h40 

In the action-packed movie "Legion," when God loses faith in humankind, he unleashes his legion of angels to initiate the Apocalypse. As chaos ensues, a diverse group of strangers find themselves trapped in a remote desert diner, their only hope for survival resting on the shoulders of the Archangel Michael. Directed by Scott Stewart and produced by Peter Schink, this thrilling film boasts a stellar cast including Paul Bettany, Dennis Quaid, Kevin Durand, and Kate Walsh. With a budget of 26.0 million dollars, "Legion" was released on January 21, 2010, in the United States of America. The tagline "When the last angel falls, the fight for mankind begins" sets the tone for this intense 1 hour and 40-minute movie. Despite its average rating of 5.2, "Legion" managed to generate a revenue of 67.9 million dollars, proving to be a captivating and profitable venture for Bold Films.

title = The Country Bears 
overview = For Beary Barrington, The Country Bears' young #1 fan, fitting in with his all-too-human family is proving im-paws-ible. When he runs away to find Country Bear Hall and his heroes, he discovers the venue that made them famous is near foreclosure. Beary hightails it over the river and through the woods to get the Bears in the Band back together for an all-out reunion concert to save Country Bear Hall. 
tagline = It's A Bear Getting The Family Together! 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
Director = Peter Hastings 
cast = Haley Joel Osment, Diedrich Bader, Candy Ford, James Gammon 
Producer = Jeffrey Chernov 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = It's A Bear Getting The Family Together! 

In "The Country Bears," directed by Peter Hastings and produced by Jeffrey Chernov, Beary Barrington, a devoted fan of The Country Bears, embarks on a journey to save Country Bear Hall from foreclosure. With a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes, this heartwarming tale follows Beary as he reunites the Bears in the Band, including Haley Joel Osment, Diedrich Bader, Candy Ford, and James Gammon, for a concert to rescue their beloved venue. Set in English and released by Walt Disney Pictures, this film's tagline, "It's A Bear Getting The Family Together," perfectly captures the spirit of friendship and music that drives the story.

Set in English and released by Walt Disney Pictures, this film's tagline, "It's A Bear Getting The Family Together," perfectly captures the spirit of friendship and music that drives the story.

title = Crash Landing 
overview = When a hostage situation arises on-board a private plane with the daughter of a billionaire on-board. Major John Masters (Sabato Jr.) teams up with Captain Williams (Michael Paré) to stop the terrorist and land the plane. 
tagline = A deadly standoff at 30,000 feet... 
budget = 113.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Canada 
Director = Jim Wynorski 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
revenue = 136.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 4.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = A deadly standoff at 30,000 feet... 

In the high-octane thriller "Crash Landing," directed by Jim Wynorski, a tense hostage situation unfolds on a private plane soaring through the skies with the daughter of a billionaire on board. Major John Masters, portrayed by Sabato Jr., joins forces with Captain Williams, played by Michael Paré, to confront the terrorists and safely land the aircraft. As the deadly standoff escalates at 30,000 feet, the clock ticks down in this heart-pounding race against time. Set against the backdrop of Canada, this English-language film with a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes delivers non-stop action and suspense. With a budget of 113.6 million dollars, "Crash Landing" soared to a revenue of 136.4 million dollars, captivating audiences with an average rating of 4.7. A deadly standoff at 30,000 feet...
