title = Anatomy of a Murder 
overview = The film pits a humble small-town lawyer against a hard-headed big city prosecutor. Emotions flare as a jealous army lieutenant pleads innocent to murdering the rapist of his seductive, beautiful wife. 
cast = James Stewart, Lee Remick, Ben Gazzara, Arthur O'Connell 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Otto Preminger 
date of release = the 1 of July 1959 
duration of the movie = 2h40 
tagline = No search of human emotions has ever probed so deeply, so truthfully as ... Anatomy of a Murder. 
budget = 250.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = James Stewart, Lee Remick, Ben Gazzara, Arthur O'Connell 

In the riveting legal drama "Anatomy of a Murder," a modest small-town lawyer finds himself in a high-stakes courtroom battle against a determined big city prosecutor. Tensions run high as a possessive army lieutenant pleads not guilty to the murder of the man who assaulted his alluring wife. Starring James Stewart, Lee Remick, Ben Gazzara, and Arthur O'Connell, this American production by Otto Preminger delves into the complexities of human emotions. Released on the 1st of July 1959, this 2-hour and 40-minute film meticulously examines the intricacies of the case, leaving audiences on the edge of their seats. With a budget of 250.3 million dollars, "Anatomy of a Murder" stands as a timeless exploration of truth and justice. As the tagline aptly states, no other film has delved as deeply and truthfully into the anatomy of human emotions.

['correct']

title = Hellraiser: Hellseeker 
overview = Kirsty Cotten is now all grown up and married. Her memory of the events that took place back at her parent's home and the mental institution have dimmed, but she is still traumatized. A fatal car crash kills Kirsty. Now, her husband finds himself in a strange world full of sexy women, greed and murder, making him believe that he is in hell. 
date of release = the 15 of October 2002 
Director = Rick Bota 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 4.7 
cast = Dean Winters, Ashley Laurence, Rachel Hayward, Sarah-Jane Redmond 
Producer = Michael Leahy 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
tagline = Evil. Deadly. Immortal. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 15 of October 2002 

In the 2002 American horror film "Hellraiser: Hellseeker," directed by Rick Bota, Kirsty Cotton, now married and haunted by her past, tragically dies in a car crash. Her husband, Trevor, played by Dean Winters, is thrust into a nightmarish world filled with temptation, violence, and suspicion, leading him to believe he is in hell. As he navigates this twisted reality, he uncovers dark secrets and faces unimaginable horrors. Starring Ashley Laurence as Kirsty Cotton, Rachel Hayward, and Sarah-Jane Redmond, this chilling tale of evil and immortality will keep you on the edge of your seat. With an average rating of 4.7, this 1 hour and 29-minute film was released on October 15, 2002, captivating audiences with its haunting storyline and unforgettable characters. The tagline "Evil. Deadly. Immortal." perfectly encapsulates the spine-tingling journey that unfolds in this gripping cinematic experience. Produced by Michael Leahy, "Hellraiser: Hellseeker" takes viewers on a terrifying ride through a world where reality and nightmare blend seamlessly. The film was shot in the United States of America, adding to its eerie and atmospheric setting.

Her husband, Trevor, played by Dean Winters, is thrust into a nightmarish world filled with temptation, violence, and suspicion, leading him to believe he is in hell. As he navigates this twisted reality, he uncovers dark secrets and faces unimaginable horrors. Starring Ashley Laurence as Kirsty Cotton, Rachel Hayward, and Sarah-Jane Redmond, this chilling tale of evil and immortality will keep you on the edge of your seat. With an average rating of 4.7, this 1 hour and 29-minute film was released on October 15, 2002, captivating audiences with its haunting storyline and unforgettable characters. The tagline "Evil. Deadly. Immortal." perfectly encapsulates the spine-tingling journey that unfolds in this gripping cinematic experience. Produced by Michael Leahy, "Hellraiser: Hellseeker" takes viewers on a terrifying ride through a world where reality and nightmare blend seamlessly. The film was shot in the United States of America, adding to its eerie and atmospheric setting.

title = The Andromeda Strain 
overview = When virtually all of the residents of Piedmont, New Mexico, are found dead after the return to Earth of a space satellite, the head of the US Air Force's Project Scoop declares an emergency. A group of eminent scientists led by Dr. Jeremy Stone scramble to a secure laboratory and try to first isolate the life form while determining why two people from Piedmont - an old alcoholic and a six-month-old baby - survived. The scientists methodically study the alien life form unaware that it has already mutated and presents a far greater danger in the lab, which is equipped with a nuclear self-destruct device designed to prevent the escape of dangerous biological agents.. 
date of release = the 12 of March 1971 
budget = 6.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 12 of March 1971 

In the sci-fi thriller "The Andromeda Strain," released on the 12th of March 1971 with a budget of 6.5 million dollars, a mysterious space satellite brings death to the residents of Piedmont, New Mexico. When virtually all of the residents are found dead, the head of the US Air Force's Project Scoop declares an emergency. Dr. Jeremy Stone and a group of eminent scientists scramble to a secure laboratory to study and contain the deadly alien life form that has already mutated. They are tasked with isolating the life form and understanding why only two people from Piedmont, an old alcoholic and a six-month-old baby, survived. As they uncover the secrets behind the survivors, they must also grapple with the looming threat of a nuclear self-destruct device within the lab. Will they be able to prevent the escape of this dangerous biological agent before it's too late?

['correct']

As they uncover the secrets behind the survivors, they must also grapple with the looming threat of a nuclear self-destruct device within the lab. Will they be able to prevent the escape of this dangerous biological agent before it's too late?

title = Kung Fu Jungle 
overview = A martial arts instructor working at a police academy gets imprisoned after killing a man by accident. But when a vicious killer starts targeting martial arts masters, the instructor offers to help the police in return for his freedom. 
date of release = the 31 of October 2014 
Director = Teddy Chan 
duration of the movie = 1h40

original language of the movie = Unknown language [cn] 
revenue = 0.1 millions of dollars

production countrie = Hong Kong

tagline = Kung Fu is a Skill for Killing 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 31 of October 2014 

In "Kung Fu Jungle," directed by Teddy Chan, a martial arts instructor finds himself behind bars after a fatal accident. However, when a ruthless murderer begins targeting martial arts experts, the instructor strikes a deal with the police to assist in exchange for his freedom. Released on the 31st of October 2014 in Hong Kong, this action-packed film stars Donnie Yen, Charlie Yeung, Wang Baoqiang, and Bai Bing. With a runtime of 1 hour and 40 minutes, the movie, produced by Catherine Hun under Emperor Motion Pictures, is in an unknown language [cn]. Despite a budget of 25.0 million dollars, the film only grossed 0.1 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average rating of 6.5. The tagline "Kung Fu is a Skill for Killing" sets the tone for this thrilling martial arts masterpiece.

title = Blood on the Sun 
overview = Nick Condon, an American journalist in 1945 Tokyo, publishes the Japanese master plan for world domination. Reaction from the understandably upset Japanese provides the action, but this is overshadowed by the propaganda of the time. 
revenue = 1.3 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 1.3 millions of dollars 

In "Blood on the Sun," set in 1945 Tokyo, American journalist Nick Condon stirs up controversy by exposing the Japanese master plan for world domination. As tensions rise and the Japanese authorities retaliate, Condon finds himself in the midst of a dangerous game of cat and mouse. Amidst the propaganda of the time, the true cost of revealing such a secret becomes clear. With a revenue of 1.3 million dollars and an average rating of 5.1, this gripping thriller delves into the consequences of speaking truth to power in a time of war. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.1 

In "Blood on the Sun," set in 1945 Tokyo, American journalist Nick Condon stirs up controversy by exposing the Japanese master plan for world domination. As tensions rise and the Japanese authorities retaliate, Condon finds himself in the midst of a dangerous game of cat and mouse. Amidst the propaganda of the time, the true cost of revealing such a secret becomes clear. With a revenue of 1.3 million dollars and an average rating of 5.1, this gripping thriller delves into the consequences of speaking truth to power in a time of war.

title = Vera Cruz 
overview = After the American Civil War, mercenaries travel to Mexico to fight in their revolution for money. The former soldier and gentleman Benjamin Trane meets the gunman and killer Joe Erin and his men, and together they are hired by the Emperor Maximillian and the Marquis Henri de Labordere to escort the Countess Marie Duvarre to the harbor of Vera Cruz. 
date of release = the 25 of December 1954 
production compagnie = United Artists 
tagline = The Giants Battle In The Biggest Spectacle Of Them All! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 25 of December 1954 

In the epic Western film "Vera Cruz," set in the aftermath of the American Civil War, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey to Mexico where mercenaries are drawn into a revolution for profit. The story follows the unlikely partnership between the former soldier Benjamin Trane and the ruthless gunman Joe Erin, as they are enlisted by Emperor Maximillian and Marquis Henri de Labordere to escort Countess Marie Duvarre to the port of Vera Cruz. Released on December 25, 1954, by United Artists, this action-packed movie promises audiences a spectacle of epic proportions as giants clash and alliances are tested in the midst of chaos. As the tagline boldly declares, "The Giants Battle In The Biggest Spectacle Of Them All!"

title = The Aerial 
overview = La Antena (English: The Aerial, 2007) is an Argentine drama film, written and directed by acclaimed film director Esteban Sapir. The film features Alejandro Urdapilleta, Rafael Ferro, Florencia Raggi, and others. The movie begins with a pair of hands typing on a typewriter. The denizens of a nameless city "in the year XX" have lost their voices. People communicate by mouthing out words that are spelled mid-air. The only person who has kept the use of her voice is La Voz ("the voice"), a singer working for the sole TV channel broadcast in the city, run by Mr. TV, who desires La Voz. La Voz wears a hood over her head that hides away her face. She has a son called Tomás, an eyeless little kid who nonetheless also has a voice (although this is kept a secret). Tomás lives next door to Ana, whom he one day befriends after a letter addressed to his house is erroneously delivered to hers. 
Director = Esteban Sapir 
tagline = A city without a voice... 
production compagnie = LadobleA 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
budget = 73.1 millions of dollars 
cast = Valeria Bertuccelli, Alejandro Urdapilleta, Julieta Cardinali, Rafael Ferro 
revenue = 73.1 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 17 of April 2007 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
production countrie = Argentina 
Producer = Federico Rotstein 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Esteban Sapir 

In the visually stunning Argentine drama film "The Aerial" (2007), directed by the acclaimed Esteban Sapir, the city's inhabitants have mysteriously lost their voices in the year XX. Communication is now done by mouthing words that appear in the air. The only exception is La Voz, a singer with a hidden identity, who still possesses her voice and works for the city's sole TV channel controlled by the enigmatic Mr. TV. La Voz's son, Tomás, who is visually impaired, also has a voice that is kept secret. When Tomás befriends Ana, a neighbor, after a letter mix-up, their lives intertwine in unexpected ways. With a captivating cast including Valeria Bertuccelli, Alejandro Urdapilleta, Julieta Cardinali, and Rafael Ferro, "The Aerial" explores themes of communication, identity, and connection in a city where silence reigns. The movie had a budget of 73.1 million dollars and generated the same amount in revenue. Don't miss this thought-provoking film that will leave you speechless.

title = The King's Speech 
overview = The King's Speech tells the story of the man who became King George VI, the father of Queen Elizabeth II. After his brother abdicates, George ('Bertie') reluctantly assumes the throne. Plagued by a dreaded stutter and considered unfit to be king, Bertie engages the help of an unorthodox speech therapist named Lionel Logue. Through a set of unexpected techniques, and as a result of an unlikely friendship, Bertie is able to find his voice and boldly lead the country into war. 
revenue = 414.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 414.2 millions of dollars 

title = The King's Speech 
overview = The King's Speech tells the story of the man who became King George VI, the father of Queen Elizabeth II. After his brother abdicates, George ('Bertie') reluctantly assumes the throne. Plagued by a dreaded stutter and considered unfit to be king, Bertie engages the help of an unorthodox speech therapist named Lionel Logue. Through a set of unexpected techniques, and as a result of an unlikely friendship, Bertie is able to find his voice and boldly lead the country into war. 
revenue = 414.2 millions of dollars 

In "The King's Speech," viewers are transported back in time to witness the remarkable journey of King George VI, who overcame a debilitating stutter to lead his nation during a tumultuous period. When his unexpected ascension to the throne leaves him grappling with self-doubt and public scrutiny, Bertie seeks the unconventional guidance of speech therapist Lionel Logue. Through their unlikely friendship and innovative methods, Bertie discovers the power of his own voice and rises to the challenge of guiding his country through the trials of war. With a revenue of 414.2 million dollars, this inspiring tale of perseverance and friendship captivates audiences with its poignant portrayal of a king finding his strength in the face of adversity.

['wrong']
fact : Producer = Emile Sherman 

title = The King's Speech 
overview = The King's Speech tells the story of the man who became King George VI, the father of Queen Elizabeth II. After his brother abdicates, George ('Bertie') reluctantly assumes the throne. Plagued by a dreaded stutter and considered unfit to be king, Bertie engages the help of an unorthodox speech therapist named Lionel Logue. Through a set of unexpected techniques, and as a result of an unlikely friendship, Bertie is able to find his voice and boldly lead the country into war. 
revenue = 414.2 millions of dollars 

In "The King's Speech," viewers are transported back in time to witness the remarkable journey of King George VI, who overcame a debilitating stutter to lead his nation during a tumultuous period. When his unexpected ascension to the throne leaves him grappling with self-doubt and public scrutiny, Bertie seeks the unconventional guidance of speech therapist Lionel Logue. Through their unlikely friendship and innovative methods, Bertie discovers the power of his own voice and rises to the challenge of guiding his country through the trials of war. With a revenue of 414.2 million dollars, this inspiring tale of perseverance and friendship captivates audiences with its poignant portrayal of a king finding his strength in the face of adversity.

title = 100 Rifles 
overview = When half-breed Indian Yaqui Joe robs an Arizona bank, he is pursued by dogged lawman Lyedecker. Fleeing to Mexico, Joe is imprisoned by General Verdugo, who is waging a war against the Yaqui Indians. When Lyedecker attempts to intervene, he is thrown into prison as well. Working together, the two escape and take refuge in the hills, where Lyedecker meets beautiful Yaqui freedom fighter Sarita and begins to question his allegiances. 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 134.8 millions of dollars 
revenue = 252.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
Producer = Marvin Schwartz 
average note = 5.5 
tagline = All they need is . . . 100 RIFLES 
Director = Tom Gries 
date of release = the 26 of March 1969 
duration of the movie = 1h50 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the action-packed Western film "100 Rifles," directed by Tom Gries and released on the 26th of March 1969, half-breed Indian Yaqui Joe finds himself on the run from lawman Lyedecker after robbing an Arizona bank. Their paths intertwine as they both end up imprisoned by General Verdugo in Mexico, amidst a war with the Yaqui Indians. With a budget of 134.8 million dollars, the movie went on to gross 252.2 million dollars at the box office. As they escape and seek refuge in the hills, Lyedecker and Joe join forces, leading to a fateful encounter with the beautiful Yaqui freedom fighter Sarita. Amidst the action and drama, Lyedecker begins to question his loyalties, all set against the backdrop of the tagline, "All they need is... 100 RIFLES." Produced by Marvin Schwartz under Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, this English-language film with an average rating of 5.5 offers a thrilling and thought-provoking cinematic experience in its 1 hour and 50-minute runtime. 

**Facts included:**
- Title: 100 Rifles
- Overview of the movie
- Original language of the movie: English
- Production country: United States of America
- Budget: 134.8 million dollars
- Revenue: 252.2 million dollars
- Production company: Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation
- Producer: Marvin Schwartz
- Average rating: 5.5
- Tagline: All they need is... 100 RIFLES
- Director: Tom Gries
- Date of release: the 26th of March 1969
- Duration of the movie: 1 hour and 50 minutes

['wrong']
fact : cast = Jim Brown, Raquel Welch, Burt Reynolds, Fernando Lamas 

In the action-packed Western film "100 Rifles," directed by Tom Gries and released on the 26th of March 1969, half-breed Indian Yaqui Joe finds himself on the run from lawman Lyedecker after robbing an Arizona bank. Their paths intertwine as they both end up imprisoned by General Verdugo in Mexico, amidst a war with the Yaqui Indians. With a budget of 134.8 million dollars, the movie went on to gross 252.2 million dollars at the box office. As they escape and seek refuge in the hills, Lyedecker and Joe join forces, leading to a fateful encounter with the beautiful Yaqui freedom fighter Sarita. Amidst the action and drama, Lyedecker begins to question his loyalties, all set against the backdrop of the tagline, "All they need is... 100 RIFLES." Produced by Marvin Schwartz under Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, this English-language film with an average rating of 5.5 offers a thrilling and thought-provoking cinematic experience in its 1 hour and 50-minute runtime.

What they don't know is that they are digging holes in order to search for a lost treasure hidden somewhere in the camp.

title = Nowhere in Africa 
overview = A Jewish woman named Jettel Redlich flees Nazi Germany with her daughter Regina, to join her husband, Walter, on a farm in Kenya. At first, Jettel refuses to adjust to her new circumstances, bringing with her a set of china dishes and an evening gown. While Regina adapts readily to this new world, forming a strong bond with her father's cook, an African named Owuor. 
Director = Caroline Link 
duration of the movie = 2h20 
revenue = 239.4 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Germany 
date of release = the 11 of December 2001 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Caroline Link 

In the award-winning film "Nowhere in Africa," directed by Caroline Link, viewers are taken on a poignant journey following the Redlich family as they escape Nazi Germany to start anew on a farm in Kenya. Jettel Redlich, a Jewish woman, struggles to adapt to her new surroundings initially, clinging to remnants of her past life such as china dishes and an evening gown. Meanwhile, her daughter Regina thrives in this unfamiliar environment, forming a deep connection with Owuor, her father's African cook. As the story unfolds over the 2 hours and 20 minutes duration, audiences witness the emotional complexities of displacement, resilience, and cultural integration. Released on the 11th of December 2001, in Germany, "Nowhere in Africa" captivated audiences worldwide, grossing an impressive $239.4 million in revenue. The production country of the film is Germany.

['correct']

title = Me, Myself & Irene 
overview = Rhode Island State Trooper Charlie Baileygates has a multiple personality disorder. One personality is crazy and aggressive, while the other is more friendly and laid back. Both of these personalities fall in love with the same woman named Irene after Charlie loses his medication. 
budget = 51.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = From gentle to mental. 
date of release = the 22 of June 2000 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
Director = Bobby Farrelly 
duration of the movie = 1h56 
Producer = Bobby Farrelly 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 51.0 millions of dollars 

In the comedy film "Me, Myself & Irene," Rhode Island State Trooper Charlie Baileygates finds himself struggling with a multiple personality disorder. One of his personalities is wild and aggressive, while the other is more easygoing and friendly. When Charlie accidentally misplaces his medication, both of his alter egos end up vying for the affections of the same woman named Irene. Directed by Bobby Farrelly and produced by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, this English-language movie was released on the 22nd of June 2000 in the United States of America. With a budget of 51.0 million dollars, the film runs for 1 hour and 56 minutes and boasts the tagline "From gentle to mental." Despite its quirky premise, "Me, Myself & Irene" has garnered an average rating of 6.1.

One of his personalities is wild and aggressive, while the other is more easygoing and friendly. When Charlie accidentally misplaces his medication, both of his alter egos end up vying for the affections of the same woman named Irene. Directed by Bobby Farrelly and produced by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, this English-language movie was released on the 22nd of June 2000 in the United States of America. With a budget of 51.0 million dollars, the film runs for 1 hour and 56 minutes and boasts the tagline "From gentle to mental." Despite its quirky premise, "Me, Myself & Irene" has garnered an average rating of 6.1. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : cast = Jim Carrey, Renée Zellweger, Anthony Anderson, Robert Forster 

In the comedy film "Me, Myself & Irene," Rhode Island State Trooper Charlie Baileygates finds himself struggling with a multiple personality disorder. One of his personalities is wild and aggressive, while the other is more easygoing and friendly. When Charlie accidentally misplaces his medication, both of his alter egos end up vying for the affections of the same woman named Irene. Directed by Bobby Farrelly and produced by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, this English-language movie was released on the 22nd of June 2000 in the United States of America. With a budget of 51.0 million dollars, the film runs for 1 hour and 56 minutes and boasts the tagline "From gentle to mental." Despite its quirky premise, "Me, Myself & Irene" has garnered an average rating of 6.1. 
 
 

 
title = Song of the Islands 
overview = With his sidekick Rusty, Jeff Harper sails to paradisiacal tropical isle Ahmi-Oni to bargain on behalf of his cattle baron father for land owned by transplanted Irishman Dennis O'Brien. But Jeff falls in love with O'Brien's daughter, Eileen, and even his father can't break them up after he arrives and himself falls under the spell of island splendor. 
cast = Betty Grable, Victor Mature, Jack Oakie, Thomas Mitchell 
revenue = 228.8 millions of dollars 
Director = Walter Lang 
tagline = BETTY'S EVEN GOT THE PALM TREES SWAYING! 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
budget = 17.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Betty Grable, Victor Mature, Jack Oakie, Thomas Mitchell 

In the enchanting film "Song of the Islands," directed by Walter Lang, viewers are transported to the paradisiacal tropical isle of Ahmi-Oni. Jeff Harper, portrayed by Victor Mature, embarks on a journey with his sidekick Rusty, played by Jack Oakie, to negotiate for land on behalf of his cattle baron father, portrayed by Thomas Mitchell. However, their plans take an unexpected turn when Jeff falls head over heels for Eileen, the daughter of the landowner Dennis O'Brien, played by Betty Grable. As romance blossoms amidst the island splendor, even Jeff's father finds himself captivated by the beauty of Ahmi-Oni. With a stellar cast, including Betty Grable, Victor Mature, Jack Oakie, and Thomas Mitchell, "Song of the Islands" mesmerizes audiences with its tale of love and paradise. With a budget of 17.2 million dollars and a staggering revenue of 228.8 million dollars, this Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation production proves that love truly conquers all, even amidst swaying palm trees. As the tagline aptly states, "BETTY'S EVEN GOT THE PALM TREES SWAYING!"

Facts included in the final description:
- Title: Song of the Islands
- Overview of the movie
- Cast: Betty Grable, Victor Mature, Jack Oakie, Thomas Mitchell
- Revenue: 228.8 million dollars
- Director: Walter Lang
- Tagline: BETTY'S EVEN GOT THE PALM TREES SWAYING!
- Production Company: Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation
- Budget: 17.2 million dollars

title = Rated X 
overview = Based on the true story of Jim and Artie Mitchell, two brothers who entered the porn industry in the early 60's. After creating such legendary porn films as "Behind the Green Door" and "Inside Marily Chambers", they later became addicted to drugs and began a downward spiral leading to bankruptcy and murder. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Emilio Estevez 
Producer = Richard Berg 
date of release = the 1 of January 2000 
duration of the movie = 1h55 
cast = Charlie Sheen, Emilio Estevez, Tracy Hutson, Nicole de Boer 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 234.3 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = District 
revenue = 252.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the American film "Rated X", directed by Emilio Estevez and released on the 1st of January 2000, viewers are taken on a gripping journey through the true story of brothers Jim and Artie Mitchell. These siblings ventured into the adult film industry during the 1960s, creating iconic movies like "Behind the Green Door" and "Inside Marily Chambers". As their success grew, so did their struggles with drug addiction, leading them down a path of financial ruin and tragic consequences. The star-studded cast includes Charlie Sheen, Emilio Estevez, Tracy Hutson, and Nicole de Boer, who deliver powerful performances in English, the original language of the movie. With a budget of 234.3 million dollars, the production by District reaped a revenue of 252.9 million dollars, making "Rated X" a compelling tale of fame, fortune, and the dark side of the entertainment industry. The production company behind the film is District, and the movie has a duration of 1 hour and 55 minutes. The film was produced by Richard Berg and is set in the United States of America.

With a budget of 234.3 million dollars, the production by District reaped a revenue of 252.9 million dollars, making "Rated X" a compelling tale of fame, fortune, and the dark side of the entertainment industry. The production company behind the film is District, and the movie has a duration of 1 hour and 55 minutes. The film was produced by Richard Berg and is set in the United States of America.

title = I Am Legend 
overview = Robert Neville is a scientist who was unable to stop the spread of the terrible virus that was incurable and man-made. Immune, Neville is now the last human survivor in what is left of New York City and perhaps the world. For three years, Neville has faithfully sent out daily radio messages, desperate to find any other survivors who might be out there. But he is not alone. 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
production compagnie = Village Roadshow Pictures 
date of release = the 14 of December 2007 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Francis Lawrence 
tagline = The last man on Earth is not alone 
budget = 150.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.9 
Producer = Akiva Goldsman 
cast = Will Smith, Alice Braga, Charlie Tahan, Salli Richardson-Whitfield 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 585.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h41 

In the post-apocalyptic thriller "I Am Legend," directed by Francis Lawrence and released on the 14th of December 2007 in the United States of America, we follow the journey of Robert Neville, portrayed by Will Smith. Neville, a scientist immune to a man-made virus that has devastated humanity, is the last survivor in a desolate New York City. For three years, he broadcasts daily radio messages in the hopes of finding other survivors. However, Neville soon discovers that he is not alone in this barren world. With a budget of 150.0 million dollars, the film, produced by Village Roadshow Pictures and Akiva Goldsman, captivates audiences with its intense storyline and gripping performances by Alice Braga, Charlie Tahan, and Salli Richardson-Whitfield. The tagline "The last man on Earth is not alone" perfectly encapsulates the suspense and drama that unfolds in this 1 hour and 41-minute movie. Despite the challenges Neville faces, "I Am Legend" garnered an average rating of 6.9 and an impressive revenue of 585.3 million dollars, solidifying its status as a must-watch film in the English language.

title = Ejecta 
overview = Two men witness an unexplainable event in the sky as a historic solar storm approaches, and they try to survive as a terrifying life form hunts them. 
duration of the movie = 1h22 
tagline = We were never alone. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h22 

In the heart-pounding thriller "Ejecta," two men find themselves at the mercy of a terrifying life form after witnessing an unexplainable event in the sky just as a historic solar storm looms on the horizon. As they struggle to survive, they come to realize the chilling truth - "We were never alone." This English-language film, with a runtime of 1 hour and 22 minutes, will keep you on the edge of your seat as the characters fight for their lives against an otherworldly threat.

title = In the Cut 
overview = Following the gruesome murder of a young woman in her neighborhood, a self-determined woman living in New York City--as if to test the limits of her own safety--propels herself into an impossibly risky sexual liaison. Soon she grows increasingly wary about the motives of every man with whom she has contact--and about her own. 
cast = Meg Ryan, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Nick Damici 
duration of the movie = 1h59 
production compagnie = Pathe Productions 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 4.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Meg Ryan, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Nick Damici 

In the thriller "In the Cut," set in New York City, a bold and independent woman finds herself entangled in a dangerous sexual relationship following a brutal murder in her neighborhood. As she navigates the murky waters of desire and danger, she becomes suspicious of the motives of those around her, including every man she encounters. Starring Meg Ryan, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Jason Leigh, and Nick Damici, this gripping tale unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 59 minutes. Produced by Pathe Productions, this English-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats with an average rating of 4.7.

title = Always Leave Them Laughing 
overview = Director Roy Del Ruth's 1949 film, about a self-absorbed comedian who steps all over his friends and colleagues in order to achieve success, stars Milton Berle, Virginia Mayo, Ruth Roman, Bert Lahr and Alan Hale. 
Producer = Jerry Wald 
Director = Roy Del Ruth 
budget = 146.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
average note = 0.0 
date of release = the 26 of November 1949 
cast = Milton Berle, Virginia Mayo, Ruth Roman, Bert Lahr 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h56 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Jerry Wald 

In the 1949 film "Always Leave Them Laughing," directed by Roy Del Ruth and produced by Jerry Wald, audiences are taken on a journey into the life of a self-absorbed comedian who will stop at nothing to achieve success, even if it means stepping all over his friends and colleagues. Starring Milton Berle, Virginia Mayo, Ruth Roman, Bert Lahr, and Alan Hale, this Warner Bros. production delves into the dark side of comedy and the price of fame. Set in the United States of America, the movie was released on the 26th of November 1949, with a budget of 146.0 million dollars. With a runtime of 1 hour and 56 minutes, "Always Leave Them Laughing" is a classic tale of ambition, betrayal, and the cost of chasing stardom. The average note for the film is 0.0.

In the 1949 film "Always Leave Them Laughing," directed by Roy Del Ruth and produced by Jerry Wald, audiences are taken on a journey into the life of a self-absorbed comedian who will stop at nothing to achieve success, even if it means stepping all over his friends and colleagues. Starring Milton Berle, Virginia Mayo, Ruth Roman, Bert Lahr, and Alan Hale, this Warner Bros. production delves into the dark side of comedy and the price of fame. Set in the United States of America, the movie was released on the 26th of November 1949, with a budget of 146.0 million dollars. With a runtime of 1 hour and 56 minutes, "Always Leave Them Laughing" is a classic tale of ambition, betrayal, and the cost of chasing stardom. The average note for the film is 0.0.

In the English-language film "Rites of Spring," a group of kidnappers find themselves in a terrifying predicament when their ransom scheme goes awry, leading them to uncover a horrifying secret. As the group grapples with the consequences of their actions, they realize that they have become victims of a sinister tradition that demands a terrible price every spring. With a runtime of 1 hour and 21 minutes, this suspenseful thriller will keep viewers on the edge of their seats as the chilling truth is revealed.

title = The Mighty Quinn 
overview = Police chief Xavier Quinn investigates the gruesome murder of Donald Pater, one of the wealthiest residents on a Caribbean island. He was found decapitated in his Jacuzzi. Although the local political establishment, especially crooked Governor Chalk, insists that small-time thief Maubee is responsible, Xavier has his doubts. This view is complicated by the police chief's personal history with Maubee: The men have been friends since childhood. 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Star Partners II Ltd. 
Director = Carl Schenkel 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "The Mighty Quinn," police chief Xavier Quinn finds himself in the midst of a puzzling investigation on a Caribbean island. When wealthy resident Donald Pater is discovered decapitated in his Jacuzzi, Quinn, who works for the police department, is tasked with uncovering the truth behind the gruesome murder. Despite pressure from corrupt Governor Chalk to pin the crime on small-time thief Maubee, Quinn's personal connection to Maubee, as childhood friends, adds a layer of complexity to the case. Directed by Carl Schenkel and produced by Star Partners II Ltd., this thrilling mystery delves into themes of loyalty, betrayal, and the blurred lines between friendship and justice. The movie "The Mighty Quinn" is set in the Caribbean.

title = Resident Evil 
overview = When a virus leaks from a top-secret facility, turning all resident researchers into ravenous zombies and their lab animals into mutated hounds from hell, the government sends in an elite military task force to contain the outbreak. Alice and Rain are charged with leading the mission. But they only have three hours before the pathogen becomes airborne and infects the world. 
cast = Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez, Eric Mabius, Ryan McCluskey 
Producer = Paul W.S. Anderson 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
average note = 6.4 
Director = Paul W.S. Anderson 
production countrie = France 
production compagnie = Impact Pictures 
revenue = 103.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = A secret experiment. A deadly virus. A fatal mistake. 
date of release = the 15 of March 2002 
budget = 33.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez, Eric Mabius, Ryan McCluskey 

In "Resident Evil," directed by Paul W.S. Anderson, a top-secret facility breach leads to a terrifying outbreak where researchers turn into zombies and lab animals mutate into monstrous creatures. Milla Jovovich and Michelle Rodriguez star as Alice and Rain, members of an elite military task force sent by the government to contain the deadly virus. With only three hours before the pathogen goes airborne and threatens global infection, the pressure is on to stop the chaos. This action-packed thriller, released on the 15th of March 2002, takes viewers on a pulse-pounding journey through a world overrun by horror. With a budget of 33.0 million dollars, the film went on to gross 103.0 million dollars at the box office. The tagline "A secret experiment. A deadly virus. A fatal mistake." sets the tone for this intense and suspenseful movie, which received an average rating of 6.4. Paul W.S. Anderson's direction, combined with the stellar performances of the cast, including Eric Mabius and Ryan McCluskey, makes "Resident Evil" a must-watch for fans of the genre. The production company behind the film is Impact Pictures, and it was produced by Paul W.S. Anderson. The movie has a duration of 1h40 and the original language is English. The production country is France.

Milla Jovovich and Michelle Rodriguez star as Alice and Rain, members of an elite military task force sent by the government to contain the deadly virus. With only three hours before the pathogen goes airborne and threatens global infection, the pressure is on to stop the chaos. title = The Wicked 
overview = A Group of teenagers test the legend of an immortal witch and get more than they bargained for. It's almost Halloween and six young people, spooked but not undaunted by the folklore surrounding an old haunted house, make their way to the abode of the legendary Wicked, perhaps hoping to provoke the malevolent witch, but clearly not prepared for what they've certainly unleashed. 
Director = Peter Winther 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = The Wicked Will Get You... 
date of release = the 20 of March 2013 
cast = Devon Werkheiser, Nicole Forester, Justin Deeley, Caitlin Carmichael 
duration of the movie = 1h45 
revenue = 108.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Peter Winther 

In "The Wicked," directed by Peter Winther, a group of teenagers decides to test the legend of an immortal witch as Halloween approaches. Unaware of the true power they are about to face, the six young individuals venture into the haunted house of the infamous Wicked, hoping to provoke her but underestimating the consequences of their actions. Starring Devon Werkheiser, Nicole Forester, Justin Deeley, and Caitlin Carmichael, this American film, released on the 20th of March 2013, unfolds in English. With a runtime of 1 hour and 45 minutes, "The Wicked" grossed an impressive $108.1 million at the box office, leaving audiences with the chilling tagline: "The Wicked Will Get You..."

The movie was produced in the United States of America.

title = Pompeii 
overview = Set in 79 A.D., POMPEII tells the epic story of Milo, a slave turned invincible gladiator who finds himself in a race against time to save his true love Cassia, the beautiful daughter of a wealthy merchant who has been unwillingly betrothed to a corrupt Roman Senator. As Mount Vesuvius erupts in a torrent of blazing lava, Milo must fight his way out of the arena in order to save his beloved as the once magnificent Pompeii crumbles around him. 
Producer = Paul W.S. Anderson 
tagline = No warning. No escape. 
revenue = 117.8 millions of dollars 
cast = Kit Harington, Carrie-Anne Moss, Emily Browning, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h45 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Paul W.S. Anderson 

In the thrilling movie "Pompeii," produced by Paul W.S. Anderson, viewers are transported back to 79 A.D. where they witness the epic tale of Milo, a former slave who becomes an unbeatable gladiator. As Mount Vesuvius ominously rumbles to life, Milo races against time to rescue his true love, Cassia, the daughter of a wealthy merchant who is promised to a corrupt Roman Senator. With no warning and no escape, Milo must navigate through the crumbling city of Pompeii, fighting for survival amidst a torrent of blazing lava. Starring Kit Harington, Carrie-Anne Moss, Emily Browning, and Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, this action-packed film, with a revenue of 117.8 million dollars, keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 45-minute duration.

As Mount Vesuvius ominously rumbles to life, Milo races against time to rescue his true love, Cassia, the daughter of a wealthy merchant who is promised to a corrupt Roman Senator. With no warning and no escape, Milo must navigate through the crumbling city of Pompeii, fighting for survival amidst a torrent of blazing lava. Starring Kit Harington, Carrie-Anne Moss, Emily Browning, and Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, this action-packed film, with a revenue of 117.8 million dollars, keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 45-minute duration. 
 
 

 
title = The Priest's Wife 
overview = After discovering her boyfriend for the past four years is married, a distraught and depressed young woman turns to a Catholic priest for counseling -- and finds mutual attraction. Now the inseparable couple are thwarted by his holy vow of celibacy, and must rely on the Vatican for a solution to their dilemma. 
production compagnie = PECF 
average note = 6.0 
duration of the movie = 1h43 
tagline = A Girl in Love Has Enough Problems... 
date of release = the 22 of December 1970 
production countrie = Italy 
Director = Dino Risi 
cast = Sophia Loren, Marcello Mastroianni, Venantino Venantini, Jacques Stany 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = PECF 

In the romantic drama "The Priest's Wife," directed by Dino Risi, a young woman, devastated after discovering her boyfriend's marital status, seeks solace from a Catholic priest. Unexpectedly, they both develop feelings for each other, but their budding romance faces a major obstacle - the priest's vow of celibacy. As they navigate their forbidden love, they must seek a solution from the Vatican. Starring Sophia Loren, Marcello Mastroianni, Venantino Venantini, and Jacques Stany, this Italian production by PECF offers a poignant exploration of love and faith. Released on the 22nd of December 1970, with an average rating of 6.0, "The Priest's Wife" presents a compelling narrative with the tagline, "A Girl in Love Has Enough Problems..."

The production company behind the movie is PECF, and it has a duration of 1 hour and 43 minutes. The movie was filmed in Italy and is known for its captivating storyline about the challenges faced by a couple in love, constrained by the priest's commitment to celibacy.

title = Eat Pray Love 
overview = Liz Gilbert had everything a modern woman is supposed to dream of having – a husband, a house and a successful career – yet like so many others, she found herself lost, confused and searching for what she really wanted in life. Newly divorced and at a crossroads, Gilbert steps out of her comfort zone, risking everything to change her life, embarking on a journey around the world that becomes a quest for self-discovery. In her travels, she discovers the true pleasure of nourishment by eating in Italy, the power of prayer in India and, finally and unexpectedly, the inner peace and balance of true love in Bali. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : cast = Julia Roberts, James Franco, Javier Bardem, Billy Crudup 

In "Eat Pray Love," Liz Gilbert, a woman who seemingly had it all - a husband, a career, and a home - finds herself at a crossroads, feeling lost and in search of true fulfillment. Following a difficult divorce, she bravely ventures out of her comfort zone on a global journey of self-discovery. As she travels to Italy, India, and Bali, Liz experiences the joy of indulging in delicious food, the solace of prayer, and ultimately, unexpectedly finds inner peace and love. This heartfelt tale showcases the transformative power of stepping into the unknown and embracing life's uncertainties.

Facts included in the description:
- Liz Gilbert had a husband, a house, and a successful career.
- Liz Gilbert found herself lost, confused, and searching for what she really wanted in life.
- Liz Gilbert steps out of her comfort zone and risks everything to change her life.
- Liz Gilbert embarks on a journey around the world for self-discovery.
- Liz discovers the pleasure of eating in Italy.
- Liz discovers the power of prayer in India.
- Liz finds inner peace and balance of true love in Bali.

As she travels to Italy, India, and Bali, Liz experiences the joy of indulging in delicious food, the solace of prayer, and ultimately, unexpectedly finds inner peace and love. This heartfelt tale showcases the transformative power of stepping into the unknown and embracing life's uncertainties.

Facts included in the description:
- Liz Gilbert had a husband, a house, and a successful career.
- Liz Gilbert found herself lost, confused, and searching for what she really wanted in life.
- Liz Gilbert steps out of her comfort zone and risks everything to change her life.
- Liz Gilbert embarks on a journey around the world for self-discovery.
- Liz discovers the pleasure of eating in Italy.
- Liz discovers the power of prayer in India.
- Liz finds inner peace and balance of true love in Bali.

title = Darker Than Night 
overview = When four women move into an old house left by one woman's aunt, strange things begin to happen. Bizarre voices, visions of ghosts, and mysterious noises lead them to discover the darkest powers of evil and a horror and agony beyond terror. 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
revenue = 179.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
production compagnie = Filmadora Nacional 
average note = 4.0 
Producer = José María Torre 
date of release = the 5 of September 2014 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = Spanish 

In the Spanish-language film "Darker Than Night," produced by José María Torre and released on September 5, 2014, four women move into an old house left by one woman's aunt. As they settle in, they are plagued by bizarre voices, visions of ghosts, and mysterious noises that lead them to uncover the darkest powers of evil. The horror and agony they experience go beyond terror, making for a chilling 1 hour and 40 minutes of suspense. With a revenue of 179.8 million dollars and an average rating of 4.0, this Filmadora Nacional production is sure to leave viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = Licence to Kill 
overview = James Bond and his American colleague Felix Leiter arrest the drug lord Sanchez who succeeds in escaping and takes revenge on Felix and his wife. Bond knows but just one thing: revenge. 
budget = 32.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 156.2 millions of dollars 
tagline = His bad side is a dangerous place to be. 
date of release = the 7 of July 1989 
Producer = Albert R. Broccoli 
cast = Timothy Dalton, Carey Lowell, Robert Davi, Talisa Soto 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Eon Productions 
Director = John Glen 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
duration of the movie = 2h13 
average note = 5.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 32.0 millions of dollars 

In "Licence to Kill," James Bond finds himself on a mission of revenge after drug lord Sanchez escapes custody and seeks vengeance on his colleague Felix Leiter and his wife. With a budget of 32.0 million dollars, the film went on to generate a revenue of 156.2 million dollars upon its release on the 7th of July 1989. The tagline "His bad side is a dangerous place to be" sets the tone for the action-packed thriller. Directed by John Glen and produced by Albert R. Broccoli under Eon Productions, the movie features a stellar cast including Timothy Dalton, Carey Lowell, Robert Davi, and Talisa Soto. Set in the United Kingdom and primarily in English, the film runs for 2 hours and 13 minutes, captivating audiences with an average rating of 5.9.

title = Summer Lovers 
overview = Michael Pappas and his girlfriend, Cathy, are enjoying the white sand beaches of a Greek island as well as the freewheeling nature of the locals. When Michael meets Lina, who is in Greece from Paris doing archaeological work, he is enamored with the beautiful foreigner. Cathy, unhappy about Lina getting close to Michael, confronts the woman -- only to be unexpectedly wooed by her charms as well. 
budget = 152.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Mike Moder 
cast = Peter Gallagher, Daryl Hannah, Valérie Quennessen, Barbara Rush 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Randal Kleiser 
date of release = the 16 of July 1982 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 152.9 millions of dollars 

In the romantic drama "Summer Lovers," directed by Randal Kleiser and produced by Mike Moder, viewers are transported to the picturesque white sand beaches of a Greek island. Michael Pappas and his girlfriend, Cathy, are soaking up the carefree atmosphere until they encounter Lina, a captivating archaeologist from Paris. As Michael becomes infatuated with Lina, tensions rise between the trio. Peter Gallagher, Daryl Hannah, Valérie Quennessen, and Barbara Rush deliver captivating performances in this tale of love and jealousy. Released on the 16th of July 1982, with a budget of 152.9 million dollars, "Summer Lovers" is a story of unexpected romance and allure set against the stunning backdrop of Greece. The original language of the movie is English. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Mike Moder

fact : cast = Peter Gallagher, Daryl Hannah, Valérie Quennessen, Barbara Rush 

In the romantic drama "Summer Lovers," directed by Randal Kleiser and produced by Mike Moder, viewers are transported to the picturesque white sand beaches of a Greek island. Michael Pappas and his girlfriend, Cathy, are soaking up the carefree atmosphere until they encounter Lina, a captivating archaeologist from Paris. As Michael becomes infatuated with Lina, tensions rise between the trio. Peter Gallagher, Daryl Hannah, Valérie Quennessen, and Barbara Rush deliver captivating performances in this tale of love and jealousy. Released on the 16th of July 1982, with a budget of 152.9 million dollars, "Summer Lovers" is a story of unexpected romance and allure set against the stunning backdrop of Greece. The original language of the movie is English.

title = The Curse of the Cat People 
overview = The young, friendless daughter of Oliver and Alice Reed befriends her father's dead first wife and an aging, reclusive actress. 
cast = Simone Simon, Kent Smith, Jane Randolph, Ann Carter 
tagline = A tender tale of terror! 
budget = 91.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Simone Simon, Kent Smith, Jane Randolph, Ann Carter 

In "The Curse of the Cat People," a haunting tale unfolds as the young, friendless daughter of Oliver and Alice Reed finds solace in unexpected friendships with her father's deceased first wife and an aging, reclusive actress. As eerie events begin to unravel, the boundaries between reality and imagination blur, leading to a tender yet terrifying journey. Starring Simone Simon, Kent Smith, Jane Randolph, and Ann Carter, this film delves into the depths of the supernatural with a budget of 91.6 million dollars. Experience the chilling embrace of the unknown in this captivating story where the past and present collide in unexpected ways. Don't miss out on this unique blend of horror and heart in "The Curse of the Cat People" - a cinematic masterpiece that will leave you spellbound. A tender tale of terror!

title = Unfinished Business 
overview = A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives.  But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every imaginable – and unimaginable – way, including unplanned stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit. 
Director = Ken Scott 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 14.4 millions of dollars 
budget = 35.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 5 of March 2015 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Best business trip ever. 
Producer = Todd Black 
cast = Vince Vaughn, Dave Franco, James Marsden, June Diane Raphael 
production compagnie = Studio Babelsberg 
average note = 5.0 
duration of the movie = 1h31 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Ken Scott 

In "Unfinished Business," directed by Ken Scott, a hard-working small business owner and his two associates embark on a trip to Europe to close a crucial deal. However, their routine business journey takes unexpected turns, leading them to unconventional stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit. With a star-studded cast including Vince Vaughn, Dave Franco, James Marsden, and June Diane Raphael, this English-language film was released on the 5th of March 2015 in the United States of America. Despite its unique storyline, the movie only grossed 14.4 million dollars in revenue against a budget of 35.0 million dollars. Produced by Todd Black and Studio Babelsberg, "Unfinished Business" boasts a tagline that promises the "Best business trip ever" and has an average rating of 5.0. With a runtime of 1 hour and 31 minutes, this comedy promises a wild ride through the world of business and beyond.

title = Sister Act 
overview = A Reno singer witnesses a mob murder and the cops stash her in a nunnery to protect her from the hitmen. The mother superior does not trust her, and takes steps to limit her influence on the other nuns. Eventually the singer rescues the failing choir and begins helping with community projects, which gets her an interview on TV. 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
cast = Whoopi Goldberg, Maggie Smith, Kathy Najimy, Wendy Makkena 
Producer = Teri Schwartz 
date of release = the 28 of May 1992 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h40 

In the heartwarming comedy "Sister Act," a Reno singer played by Whoopi Goldberg finds herself in a dangerous situation after witnessing a mob murder. To protect her from hitmen, the police hide her in a nunnery where the skeptical mother superior, portrayed by Maggie Smith, tries to keep her at a distance. Despite initial distrust, the singer manages to breathe new life into the failing choir and becomes involved in community projects. As her influence grows, she even lands a TV interview. With a stellar cast including Kathy Najimy and Wendy Makkena, this film produced by Teri Schwartz captivates audiences with its mix of humor, music, and heartwarming moments. Released on the 28th of May 1992, this 1 hour and 40-minute movie is a must-watch for those seeking a blend of comedy and inspiration. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Whoopi Goldberg, Maggie Smith, Kathy Najimy, Wendy Makkena 

In the heartwarming comedy "Sister Act," a Reno singer played by Whoopi Goldberg finds herself in a dangerous situation after witnessing a mob murder. To protect her from hitmen, the police hide her in a nunnery where the skeptical mother superior, portrayed by Maggie Smith, tries to keep her at a distance. Despite initial distrust, the singer manages to breathe new life into the failing choir and becomes involved in community projects. As her influence grows, she even lands a TV interview. With a stellar cast including Kathy Najimy and Wendy Makkena, this film produced by Teri Schwartz captivates audiences with its mix of humor, music, and heartwarming moments. Released on the 28th of May 1992, this 1 hour and 40-minute movie is a must-watch for those seeking a blend of comedy and inspiration.

title = Stay 
overview = Psychiatrist Sam Foster has a new patient, Henry Letham, who claims to be suicidal. In trying to diagnose him, Sam visits Henry's prior therapist and also finds Henry's mother -- even though Henry has said that he murdered both of his parents. As reality starts to contradict fact, Sam spirals into an unstable mental state. Then he finds a clue as to how and when Henry may try to kill himself, and races to try to stop him. 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
cast = Ewan McGregor, Ryan Gosling, Naomi Watts, Kate Burton 
date of release = the 24 of September 2005 
budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Arnon Milchan 
tagline = Between the worlds of the living and the dead there is a place you're not supposed to stay. 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.5 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h39 

In the psychological thriller "Stay", psychiatrist Sam Foster, portrayed by Ewan McGregor, is faced with a new patient, Henry Letham, played by Ryan Gosling, who claims to be suicidal. As Sam delves into Henry's troubled past, he uncovers unsettling truths that blur the lines between reality and fiction. With the help of Henry's prior therapist and his mother, portrayed by Naomi Watts and Kate Burton respectively, Sam races against time to prevent a potential tragedy. Produced by Arnon Milchan and released on September 24, 2005, in the United States, this gripping film with a budget of 50 million dollars explores the thin line between life and death, leaving viewers questioning what is real. The tagline "Between the worlds of the living and the dead there is a place you're not supposed to stay" sets the tone for this mind-bending thriller, which received an average rating of 6.5. At a duration of 1 hour and 39 minutes, "Stay" keeps audiences on the edge of their seats as Sam navigates a complex web of secrets and lies to uncover the truth. 

The movie stars Ewan McGregor, Ryan Gosling, Naomi Watts, and Kate Burton.

title = La vérité si je mens ! 
overview = The sentimental and comedic adventures of Eddie, a non-Jew trying to pass as Jewish though totally ignorant of Jewish traditions, as he works in a Jewish community 
average note = 6.3 
production compagnie = France 2 Cinéma 
Director = Thomas Gilou 
production countrie = France 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.3 

In "La vérité si je mens!", directed by Thomas Gilou and produced by France 2 Cinéma, we follow the hilarious journey of Eddie, a non-Jew who finds himself pretending to be Jewish despite his lack of knowledge about Jewish traditions. Set within a vibrant Jewish community, Eddie navigates through sentimental and comedic adventures that keep audiences entertained throughout. With an average rating of 6.3, this French film offers a unique perspective on identity, culture, and the lengths one may go to fit in. The production country of the film is France.

title = Mysterious Skin 
overview = A teenage hustler and a young man obsessed with alien abductions cross paths, together discovering a horrible, liberating truth. 
date of release = the 20 of May 2004 
Producer = Gregg Araki 
tagline = Two boys. One can't remember. The other can't forget. 
budget = 141.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 1.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = TLA Releasing 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 20 of May 2004 

In the gripping and haunting film "Mysterious Skin," released on the 20th of May 2004, director Gregg Araki delves into the lives of two young men whose paths intertwine in unexpected ways. One is a teenage hustler, while the other is fixated on alien abductions, leading them both to uncover a disturbing and cathartic truth. With a budget of 141.3 million dollars, the movie, produced by TLA Releasing, explores the complexities of memory, trauma, and resilience. The tagline "Two boys. One can't remember. The other can't forget" encapsulates the heart-wrenching journey these characters embark on, all portrayed in the original language of English. Despite its critical acclaim, the film grossed 1.5 million dollars, leaving audiences with a profound and thought-provoking cinematic experience.

title = FM 
overview = Q-SKY is the #1 radio station in Los Angeles mainly because of the music they play; running the station the way they want to, it has made them a ratings success. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the bustling city of Los Angeles, Q-SKY reigns supreme as the #1 radio station, captivating listeners with its unparalleled music selection. The station's unapologetic approach to running things on their own terms has propelled them to the top of the ratings chart, solidifying their status as a cultural phenomenon. As the beats pulse through the airwaves, FM takes audiences on a thrilling ride through the world of radio, where passion, power struggles, and the pursuit of success collide in a symphony of sound. Q-SKY is the #1 radio station in Los Angeles mainly because of the music they play; running the station the way they want to, it has made them a ratings success.

title = Hannibal 
overview = After having successfully eluded the authorities for years, Hannibal peacefully lives in Italy in disguise as an art scholar. Trouble strikes again when he's discovered leaving a deserving few dead in the process. He returns to America to make contact with now disgraced Agent Clarice Starling, who is suffering the wrath of a malicious FBI rival as well as the media. 
average note = 6.4 
date of release = the 8 of February 2001 
duration of the movie = 2h11

['correct']
fact : average note = 6.4 

In the thrilling movie "Hannibal," the infamous Hannibal Lecter, living in Italy under a new identity, is forced to return to America after a series of murders. Seeking out disgraced Agent Clarice Starling, he becomes entangled in a dangerous game with a malicious FBI rival and the media. Released on the 8th of February 2001, this 2-hour and 11-minute film captivates audiences with its suspenseful storyline. With an average rating of 6.4, "Hannibal" keeps viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end.

In the thrilling movie "Hannibal," the infamous Hannibal Lecter, living in Italy under a new identity, is forced to return to America after a series of murders. Seeking out disgraced Agent Clarice Starling, he becomes entangled in a dangerous game with a malicious FBI rival and the media. Released on the 8th of February 2001, this 2-hour and 11-minute film captivates audiences with its suspenseful storyline. With an average rating of 6.4, "Hannibal" keeps viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = The Sign of the Cross 
overview = After burning Rome, Emperor Nero decides to blame the Christians, and issues the edict that they are all to be caught and sent to the arena. Two old Christians are caught, and about to be hauled off, when Marcus, the highest military official in Rome, comes upon them. When he sees their stepdaughter Mercia, he instantly falls in love with her and frees them. Marcus pursues Mercia, which gets him into trouble with Emperor (for being easy on Christians) and with the Empress, who loves him and is jealous. 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
budget = 35.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = Cecil B. DeMille 
cast = Fredric March, Elissa Landi, Claudette Colbert, Charles Laughton 
duration of the movie = 2h04 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

In the epic historical drama "The Sign of the Cross," produced by Paramount Pictures and helmed by the legendary Cecil B. DeMille, viewers are transported to ancient Rome during the reign of Emperor Nero. As chaos ensues after the city is set ablaze, Nero cunningly shifts the blame to the Christians, leading to a brutal edict condemning them to the arena. Amidst this turmoil, the honorable Marcus, portrayed by Fredric March, crosses paths with two elderly Christians and their captivating stepdaughter Mercia, played by Elissa Landi. Instantly smitten by Mercia, Marcus defies the Emperor's orders and sets them free, sparking a dangerous love triangle involving the power-hungry Emperor and his jealous Empress, portrayed by Charles Laughton and Claudette Colbert respectively. As Marcus navigates the treacherous political landscape of ancient Rome, his forbidden romance with Mercia puts him at odds with the ruling elite, ultimately leading to a gripping tale of love, betrayal, and sacrifice. With a budget of 35.1 million dollars and a runtime of 2 hours and 4 minutes, "The Sign of the Cross" is a lavish spectacle that immerses audiences in a world of opulence, intrigue, and moral dilemmas. The cast includes Fredric March, Elissa Landi, Claudette Colbert, and Charles Laughton.

title = Paul Blart: Mall Cop 
overview = Mild-mannered Paul Blart (Kevin James) has always had huge dreams of becoming a State Trooper. Until then, he patrols the local mall as a security guard. With his closely cropped moustache, personal transporter and gung-ho attitude, only Blart seems to take his job seriously. All that changes when a team of thugs raids the mall and takes hostages. Untrained, unarmed and a super-size target, Blart has to become a real cop to save the day. 
revenue = 183.3 millions of dollars 
tagline = Safety Never Takes A Holiday. 
budget = 26.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 183.3 millions of dollars 

In "Paul Blart: Mall Cop," we follow the story of Paul Blart, a dedicated but somewhat bumbling security guard at a local mall, played by Kevin James. Despite his aspirations of becoming a State Trooper, Blart takes his job seriously, patrolling the mall with his trusty personal transporter. However, his world is turned upside down when a group of criminals takes hostages during a raid on the mall. Unarmed and untrained, Blart must step up to the challenge and become a real cop to save the day. With a budget of 26.0 million dollars, the film went on to gross an impressive 183.3 million dollars at the box office. As the tagline suggests, in this action-packed comedy, "Safety Never Takes A Holiday."

['correct']

title = Deathstalker 
overview = The warrior Deathstalker is tasked by an old witch lady to obtain and unite the three powers of creation - a chalice, an amulet, and a sword - lest the evil magician Munkar get them and use them for nefarious purposes. After obtaining the sword, Deathstalker joins with other travelers going to the Big Tournament to determine the strongest warrior. The false king holds the true princess in captivity, and plots to have Deathstalker killed, and Deathstalker must fight to free the princess. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 4.3 
budget = 207.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 8.9 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h20 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the action-packed movie "Deathstalker," the fearless warrior Deathstalker embarks on a quest assigned by an old witch to retrieve and combine the three powers of creation - a chalice, an amulet, and a sword - to prevent the evil magician Munkar from using them for his wicked schemes. Along the way, Deathstalker acquires the powerful sword and joins forces with fellow travelers heading to the prestigious Big Tournament, where the strongest warriors compete. However, complications arise as the deceitful king imprisons the rightful princess and schemes to eliminate Deathstalker. With a thrilling mix of battles and bravery, Deathstalker must confront formidable foes to rescue the princess and thwart the king's treacherous plans. This English-language film, with an average rating of 4.3, unfolds in a runtime of 1 hour and 20 minutes, against a backdrop of a budget of 207.3 million dollars and a revenue of 8.9 million dollars.

['correct']

Along the way, Deathstalker acquires the powerful sword and joins forces with fellow travelers heading to the prestigious Big Tournament, where the strongest warriors compete. However, complications arise as the deceitful king imprisons the rightful princess and schemes to eliminate Deathstalker. However, complications arise as the deceitful king imprisons the rightful princess and schemes to eliminate Deathstalker. With a thrilling mix of battles and bravery, Deathstalker must confront formidable foes to rescue the princess and thwart the king's treacherous plans. This English-language film, with an average rating of 4.3, unfolds in a runtime of 1 hour and 20 minutes, against a backdrop of a budget of 207.3 million dollars and a revenue of 8.9 million dollars.

In the action-packed movie "Deathstalker," the fearless warrior Deathstalker embarks on a quest assigned by an old witch to retrieve and combine the three powers of creation - a chalice, an amulet, and a sword - to prevent the evil magician Munkar from using them for his wicked schemes. Along the way, Deathstalker acquires the powerful sword and joins forces with fellow travelers heading to the prestigious Big Tournament, where the strongest warriors compete. However, complications arise as the deceitful king imprisons the rightful princess and schemes to eliminate Deathstalker. title = The Lion King 2: Simba's Pride 
overview = The circle of life continues for Simba, now fully grown and in his rightful place as the king of Pride Rock. Simba and Nala have given birth to a daughter, Kiara who's as rebellious as her father was. But Kiara drives her parents to distraction when she catches the eye of Kovu, the son of the evil lioness, Zira. Will Kovu steal Kiara's heart? 
date of release = the 24 of October 1998 
tagline = The Circle of Life Continues... 
budget = 248.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h21

fact : date of release = the 24 of October 1998 

In "The Lion King 2: Simba's Pride," the circle of life continues as Simba takes his place as the rightful king of Pride Rock. Alongside Nala, they welcome their rebellious daughter, Kiara, into the world. However, Kiara's life takes a turn when she meets Kovu, the son of the villainous lioness, Zira. As their love story unfolds, tensions rise between the two families. Released on the 24th of October 1998, this sequel to the beloved classic is a tale of love, loyalty, and the enduring legacy of the circle of life. With a budget of 248.8 million dollars and a runtime of 1 hour and 21 minutes, "The Lion King 2: Simba's Pride" reminds us that the circle of life continues to shape destinies and relationships. Don't miss out on this captivating continuation of the iconic story with the tagline: "The Circle of Life Continues..."

title = Last Man Standing 
overview = John Smith is a mysterious stranger who is drawn into a vicious war between two Prohibition-era gangs. In a dangerous game, he switches allegiances from one to another, offering his services to the highest bidder. As the death toll mounts, Smith takes the law into his own hands in a deadly race to stay alive. 
average note = 6.2 
Director = Walter Hill 
budget = 67.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 20 of September 1996 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
revenue = 47.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
cast = Bruce Willis, Bruce Dern, William Sanderson, Christopher Walken 
Producer = Walter Hill 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = In a town with no justice, there is only one law... Every man for himself. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.2 

In the action-packed film "Last Man Standing," directed by Walter Hill and produced by Walter Hill, viewers are taken back to the Prohibition era where John Smith, portrayed by the talented Bruce Willis, becomes embroiled in a deadly feud between two ruthless gangs. As the body count rises, Smith navigates the treacherous underworld by playing both sides, ultimately taking matters into his own hands in a desperate bid for survival. With a stellar cast including Bruce Dern, William Sanderson, and Christopher Walken, this gritty tale of betrayal and survival keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for the movie's 1 hour and 41 minutes runtime. Released on September 20, 1996, by New Line Cinema, "Last Man Standing" delivers a thrilling narrative of shifting alliances and brutal retribution, where the only rule is to fend for oneself in a town devoid of justice. Despite its $67 million budget, the film grossed $47.3 million at the box office, garnering an average rating of 6.2. The original language of the movie is English and it was produced in the United States of America. The tagline for the movie is "In a town with no justice, there is only one law... Every man for himself." 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Walter Hill

fact : date of release = the 20 of September 1996 

In the action-packed film "Last Man Standing," directed by Walter Hill and produced by Walter Hill, viewers are taken back to the Prohibition era where John Smith, portrayed by the talented Bruce Willis, becomes embroiled in a deadly feud between two ruthless gangs. As the body count rises, Smith navigates the treacherous underworld by playing both sides, ultimately taking matters into his own hands in a desperate bid for survival. With a stellar cast including Bruce Dern, William Sanderson, and Christopher Walken, this gritty tale of betrayal and survival keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for the movie's 1 hour and 41 minutes runtime. Released on September 20, 1996, by New Line Cinema, "Last Man Standing" delivers a thrilling narrative of shifting alliances and brutal retribution, where the only rule is to fend for oneself in a town devoid of justice. Despite its $67 million budget, the film grossed $47.3 million at the box office, garnering an average rating of 6.2. The original language of the movie is English and it was produced in the United States of America. The tagline for the movie is "In a town with no justice, there is only one law... Every man for himself."

['correct']
fact : tagline = In a town with no justice, there is only one law... Every man for himself. 

In the action-packed film "Last Man Standing," directed by Walter Hill and produced by Walter Hill, viewers are taken back to the Prohibition era where John Smith, portrayed by the talented Bruce Willis, becomes embroiled in a deadly feud between two ruthless gangs. As the body count rises, Smith navigates the treacherous underworld by playing both sides, ultimately taking matters into his own hands in a desperate bid for survival. With a stellar cast including Bruce Dern, William Sanderson, and Christopher Walken, this gritty tale of betrayal and survival keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for the movie's 1 hour and 41 minutes runtime. Released on September 20, 1996, by New Line Cinema, "Last Man Standing" delivers a thrilling narrative of shifting alliances and brutal retribution, where the only rule is to fend for oneself in a town devoid of justice. Despite its $67 million budget, the film grossed $47.3 million at the box office, garnering an average rating of 6.2. The original language of the movie is English and it was produced in the United States of America. The tagline for the movie is "In a town with no justice, there is only one law... Every man for himself."
